translated: At the Moranivāpa: the word nivāpa means food. The meaning is: at the place where food was given to the peacocks without fear. In the open air: in the courtyard.

original: Assāsapattāti tuṭṭhipattā somanassapattā. Ajjhāsayanti uttamanissayabhūtaṃ. Ādibrahmacariyanti
analyzed: assāsa pattā ati tuṭṭhi pattā somanassa pattā ajjhāsayanti uttama nissaya bhūtam ādi brahmacariyanti
translated: “The peak of in-breaths and out-breaths” is the peak of satisfaction and the peak of gladness. “The highest resort”: the highest kind of resort. “The beginning of the holy life”:

original: purāṇabrahmacariyasaṅkhātaṃ ariyamaggaṃ. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – “ko nāma so, bhante,🔽dhammo yena bhagavatā sāvakā vinītā ajjhāsayādibrahmacariyabhūtaṃ ariyamaggaṃ pūretvā
analyzed: purāṇa brahmacariya saṅkhātam ariya maggam idam vuttam hoti kaḥ nāma saḥ bhante  dhammaḥ yena bhagavatā sāvakāḥ vinītāḥ ajjhāsaya ādi brahmacariya bhūtam ariya maggam pūretvā
translated: ‘They have attained to the heart’s release’: they have attained to satisfaction, to gladness. ‘The heart’s ground’: the supreme ground of reliance. ‘The beginning of the holy life’: the noble path, which is called the ancient holy life. What is meant is: ‘What, venerable sir, is that state

original: arahattādhigamavasena assāsapattā paṭijānantī”ti.
analyzed: arahatta adhigama vasena paṭijānanti iti
translated: in which the Blessed One’s disciples, when trained in it, declare that they have attained to the heart’s release and fulfilled the heart’s ground, the noble path, by reaching Arahantship?’

original: Tapojigucchāvādavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tapojigucchā vāda vaṇṇanā
translated: The praise of the doctrine of austerity and self-mortification

original: 55. Vippakatāti mamāgamanapaccayā aniṭṭhitā, va hutvā ṭhitā, kathehi, ahametaṃ niṭṭhapetvā matthakaṃ pāpetvā dassemīti sabbaññupavāraṇaṃ pavāresi.
analyzed: vippakatā ati mama āgamana paccayā aniṭṭhitā va hutvā ṭhitā kathehi aham etam niṭṭhapetvā matthakam pāpetvā dassemi iti sabbaññu pavāraṇam pavāresi
translated: ‘Not completed’: not finished, not brought to an end, by my coming. ‘Tell me’: ‘Tell me, I will complete it, bring it to an end, and show it to you.’ He thus invited the Blessed One to question him.

original: 56. Dujjānaṃ khoti bhagavā paribbājakassa vacanaṃ sutvā “ayaṃ paribbājako mayā sāvakānaṃ
analyzed: dujjānam kho ti bhagavā paribbājakassa vacanam sutvā ayam paribbājakaḥ mayā sāvakānam
translated: ‘Hard to see’: when the Blessed One heard the wanderer’s words, he thought: ‘This wanderer is asking me about the Dhamma that I teach and about the practice that my disciples fulfil,

original: desetabbaṃ dhammaṃ tehi pūretabbaṃ paṭipattiṃ pucchati, sacassāhaṃ āditova taṃ kathessāmi,
analyzed: desetabbam dhammam tehi pūretabbam paṭipattim pucchati sacassa aham āditas va tam kathessāmi
translated: If I tell him from the beginning, he will not believe me, and that will be to his harm and unhappiness for a long time. So I shall question him in return.

original: kathitampi naṃ na jānissati, ayaṃ pana vīriyena pāpajigucchanavādo, handāhaṃ etasseva
analyzed: kathitam pi nam na jānissati ayam pana vīriyena pāpa jigucchana vādaḥ handa aham etassa iva
translated: he will not understand what is said, but this is a talk on the reproving of evil through energy, let me now

original: visaye pañhaṃ pucchāpetvā puthusamaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ laddhiyā niratthakabhāvaṃ dassemi.
analyzed: visaye pañham pucchāpetvā puthu samaṇa brāhmaṇānam laddhiyāḥ niratthaka bhāvam dassemi
translated: He will not understand what is said to him. But this is a matter of the censure of evil by means of energy. Let me ask him a question in this field and show that the theories of the other sectarians are useless.

original: Atha pacchā imaṃ pañhaṃ byākarissāmī”ti cintetvā dujjānaṃ kho etantiādimāha. Tattha
analyzed: atha pacchā imam pañham byākarissāmi iti cintetvā dujjānam kho etat ti ādim āha tattha
translated: Then afterwards I will answer the question.” So he said “It is hard to know” , etc. Herein

original: sake ācariyaketi attano ācariyavāde. Adhijeguccheti vīriyena pāpajigucchanabhāve.🔽Kathaṃ santāti kathaṃ bhūtā. Tapojigucchāti vīriyena pāpajigucchā pāpavivajjanā.
analyzed: sake ācariyakā iti attanaḥ ācariya vāde adhijegucchā iti vīriyena pāpa jigucchana bhāve  katham santā ati katham bhūtā tapaḥ jigucchā ati vīriyena pāpa jigucchā pāpa vivajjanā
translated: in his own teacher’s doctrine means in his own teacher’s doctrine of censure of evil by means of energy.

original: Paripuṇṇāti parisuddhā. Kathaṃ aparipuṇṇāti kathaṃ aparisuddhā hotīti evaṃ pucchāti.
analyzed: paripuṇṇā ati parisuddhā katham a paripuṇṇā ati katham a parisuddhā hoti iti evam pucchāti
translated: How is it fulfilled? How is it not fulfilled? means: how is it purified? how is it not purified? he asks thus.

original: Yatra hi nāmāti yo nāma.🔽57. Appasadde katvāti nirave appasadde katvā. So kira cintesi – “samaṇo gotamo ekaṃ
analyzed: yatra hi nāma ati yaḥ nāma  appasadde katvā ti nirave appasadde katvā saḥ kira cintesi samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ekam
translated: Yatra hi nāma means: yo nāma.

original: pañhampi na katheti, sallāpakathāpissa atibahukā natthi, ime pana ādito paṭṭhāya
analyzed: pañham pi na katheti sallāpa kathā apissa atibahukā natthi ime pana āditaḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: Having made it low-voiced means: having made it soundless and low-voiced. He thought: “The ascetic Gotama does not answer even one question. He has very few conversations. But these people

original: samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ anuvattanti ceva pasaṃsanti ca, handāhaṃ ime nissadde katvā sayaṃ
analyzed: samaṇam gotamam anuvattanti ca iva pasaṃsanti ca handa aham ime nissadde katvā sayam
translated: and they follow the recluse Gotama and praise him. Let me now make them silent and🔽then I will speak myself.” He did so. Hence it is said, “having made them silent.”

original: kathemī”ti. So tathā akāsi. Tena vuttaṃ “appasadde katvā”ti. “Tapojigucchavādā”tiādīsu
analyzed: kathemi iti saḥ tathā akāsi tena vuttam appasadde katvā iti tapo jiguccha vāda ati ādīsu
translated: In the passage beginning “They are ascetics who preach austerity,”

original: tapojigucchaṃ vadāma, manasāpi tameva sārato gahetvā vicarāma, kāyenapimhā tameva
analyzed: tapojiguccham vadāma manasā api tam eva sārataḥ gahetvā vicarāma tam eva
translated: we are ascetics who preach austerity, we live with that as our highest object, even mentally. We are devoted to that austerity,

original: allīnā, nānappakārakaṃ attakilamathānuyogamanuyuttā viharāmāti attho.
analyzed: nānā pakārakam atta kilamatha anuyogam anuyuttāḥ viharāma ati attho
translated: we are absorbed in that austerity, we are committed to the practice of self-mortification in its various forms.

original: Upakkilesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: upakkilesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the defilements

original: 58. Tapassīti tapanissitako. “Acelako”tiādīni sīhanāde vitthāritanayeneva veditabbāni.
analyzed: tapassī iti tapanissitakaḥ acelakaḥ ti ādīni sīhanāde vitthāri tanayena iva veditabbāni
translated: An ascetic: one who depends on austerity. The passages beginning with “naked” should be understood in the way given in the commentary on the “lion’s roar” .

original: Tapaṃ samādiyatīti acelakabhāvādikaṃ tapaṃ sammā ādiyati, daḷhaṃ gaṇhāti. Attamano
analyzed: tapam samādiyati iti acelaka bhāva ādikam tapam ādiyati daḷham gaṇhāti atta manaḥ
translated: He undertakes austerity: he undertakes the austerity of nakedness, etc., he grasps it firmly.

original: hotīti ko añño mayā sadiso imasmiṃ tape atthīti tuṭṭhamano hoti. Paripuṇṇasaṅkappoti
analyzed: hoti iti kaḥ aññaḥ mayā sadisaḥ imasmin tape atthi iti tuṭṭha manaḥ hoti paripuṇṇa saṅkappo ti
translated: He is satisfied: he is satisfied, thinking, “Who is there equal to me in this austerity?”

original: alamettāvatāti evaṃ pariyositasaṅkappo, idañca titthiyānaṃ vasena āgataṃ. Sāsanāvacarenāpi
analyzed: alam ettāvatā ati evam pariyosita saṅkappaḥ idam ca titthiyānam vasena āgatam sāsanāvacarena api
translated: His resolution is fulfilled: his resolution is completed, thinking, “This is enough.” This is said with reference to the sectarians. But one who has gone forth in the Dispensation

original: pana dīpetabbaṃ. Ekacco hi dhutaṅgaṃ samādiyati, so teneva dhutaṅgena ko añño mayā
analyzed: pana dīpetabbam ekaccaḥ hi dhutaṅgam samādiyati saḥ tena iva dhutaṅgena kaḥ aññaḥ mayā
translated: but it should be pointed out. For one who undertakes a practice of austerity may be pleased with that austerity and think, “Who is there equal to me in austerity?”

original: sadiso dhutaṅgadharoti attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo. Tapassino upakkileso hotīti
analyzed: sadisaḥ dhutaṅga dharo ti atta manaḥ hoti paripuṇṇa saṅkappo tapassinaḥ upakkilesaḥ hoti iti
translated: and so he is not satisfied with his own austerity. This is the defilement of the ascetic.

original: duvidhassāpetassa tapassino ayaṃ upakkileso hoti. Ettāvatāyaṃ tapo upakkileso hotīti vadāmi.
analyzed: duvidhassa apetassa tapassinaḥ ayam upakkilesaḥ hoti ettāvatā ayam tapo upakkilesaḥ hoti iti vadāmi
translated: I say that this austerity is defiled as far as this.🔽He exalts himself: he exalts himself, he extols himself, thinking “Who is there equal to me?”

original: Attānukkaṃsetīti “ko mayā sadiso atthī”ti attānaṃ ukkaṃsati ukkhipati. Paraṃ vambhetīti “ayaṃ na mādiso”ti paraṃ saṃhāreti avakkhipati.🔽Majjatīti mānamadakaraṇena majjati. Mucchatīti mucchito hoti gadhito ajjhāpanno.
analyzed: attā anukkaṃseti iti kaḥ mayā sadisaḥ atthi iti attānam ukkaṃsati ukkhipati param vambheti iti ayam na mādisaḥ iti param saṃhāreti avakkhipati  majjati iti māna mada karaṇena majjati mucchati iti mucchitaḥ hoti gadhitaḥ ajjhāpanno
translated: He disparages others: he disparages others, he looks down upon others, thinking “He is not equal to me.”🔽He becomes intoxicated: he becomes intoxicated with that conceit. He becomes negligent: he becomes negligent, he becomes remiss.🔽He becomes lax: he becomes lax in his practice.

original: Pamādamāpajjatīti etadeva sāranti pamādamāpajjati. Sāsane pabbajitopi dhutaṅgasuddhiko
analyzed: pamādam āpajjati iti etat eva sāranti pamādam āpajjati sāsane pabbajitaḥ api dhutaṅga suddhiko
translated: Even though he has gone forth in the Dispensation, he is pure in austerity,

original: hoti, na kammaṭṭhānasuddhiko. Dhutaṅgameva arahattaṃ viya sārato pacceti.
analyzed: hoti na kammaṭṭhāna suddhikaḥ dhutaṅgam eva arahattam viya sārataḥ pacceti
translated: not in meditation subject. He values austerity as if it were Arahantship.

original: 59. Lābhasakkārasilokanti ettha cattāro paccayā labbhantīti lābhā, teyeva suṭṭhu🔽katvā paṭisaṅkharitvā laddhā sakkāro, vaṇṇabhaṇanaṃ siloko. Abhinibbattetīti acelakādibhāvaṃ🔽terasadhutaṅgasamādānaṃ vā nissāya mahālābho uppajjati, tasmā “abhinibbattetī”ti
analyzed: ettha cattāro paccayā labbhanti iti lābhā te eva suṭṭhu  katvā paṭisaṅkharitvā laddhā sakkāraḥ vaṇṇa bhaṇanam silokaḥ abhinibbatteti iti acelaka ādi bhāvam  terasa dhutaṅga samādānam vā nissāya mahā lābhaḥ uppajjati tasmai abhinibbatteti iti
translated: “Gain, honour, and fame”: there are four kinds of requisites called “gain” . When these are well🔽prepared and put together, they are called “honour” . The proclamation of one’s good qualities is “fame” . “He creates”: by means of the state of being a naked ascetic, etc.,🔽or by undertaking the thirteen ascetic practices, great gain arises, and so it is said that “he creates it” .🔽

original: vutto. Sesamettha purimavāranayeneva duvidhassāpi tapassino vasena veditabbaṃ.🔽60. Vodāsaṃ āpajjatīti dvebhāgaṃ āpajjati, dve bhāge karoti. Khamatīti ruccati. Nakkhamatīti
analyzed: vuttaḥ sesam ettha purima vāra nayena iva duvidhassa api tapassinaḥ vasena veditabbam  vodāsam āpajjati iti dvebhāgam āpajjati dve bhāge karoti khamati iti ruccati na khamati iti
translated: 1. “Gain, honour, and fame”: there are four kinds of gains . Honour is the respect that is well made and well prepared. Fame is the speaking of praise. “He creates”: because great gains arise for him on the basis of the state of being a naked ascetic, etc., or on the basis of the undertaking of the thirteen ascetic practices, he is said to “create” them. The rest should be understood here according to the method stated in the first section.

original: na ruccati. Sāpekkho pajahatīti sataṇho pajahati. Kathaṃ? Pātova khīrabhattaṃ bhutto
analyzed: na ruccati sa apekkhaḥ pajahati iti sa taṇho pajahati katham pāto uva khīra bhattam bhuttaḥ
translated: 2. “He falls into a double state”: he falls into a twofold state, he makes a twofold state. “He approves”: he likes. “He does not approve”: he does not like. “He abandons with desire”: he abandons with craving. How? In the morning he eats milk-rice.

original: hoti. Athassa maṃsabhojanaṃ upaneti. Tassa evaṃ hoti “idāni evarūpaṃ kadā labhissāma,
analyzed: hoti athassa maṃsa bhojanam upaneti tassa evam hoti idāni evarūpam kadā labhissāma
translated: Then they bring him meat to eat. He thinks: “When shall I get such a thing again?

original: sace jāneyyāma, pātova khīrabhattaṃ na bhuñjeyyāma, kiṃ mayā sakkā kātuṃ, gaccha
analyzed: sace jāneyyāma khīra bhattam na bhuñjeyyāma kim mayā sakkā kātum gaccha
translated: If I had known, I would not have eaten the milk-rice in the morning. What can I do now? Go and get me some more milk-rice.”

original: bho, tvameva bhuñjā”ti jīvitaṃ pariccajanto viya sāpekkho pajahati. Gadhitoti gedhajāto.
analyzed: bho tvam eva bhuñjāti jīvitam pariccajantaḥ viya sa apekkho pajahati gadhitaḥ iti gedha jāto
translated: “Eat it yourself, sir,” as though he were giving up his life. “Entangled” means “caught in a snare.”

original: Mucchitoti balavataṇhāya mucchito saṃmuṭṭhassatī hutvā. Ajjhāpannoti āmise atilaggo,
analyzed: mucchitaḥ iti balava taṇhāya mucchitaḥ saṃmuṭṭha satī hutvā ajjhāpannaḥ ti āmise atilaggo
translated: “Bewitched” means “bewitched by strong craving, with mindfulness quite obscured.” “Greedy” means “over-greedy for material things.”

original: “bhuñjissatha, āvuso”ti dhammanimantanamattampi akatvā mahante mahante kabaḷe karoti.🔽Anādīnavadassāvītiādīnavamattampi na passati. Anissaraṇapaññoti idha mattaññutānissaraṇapaccavekkhaṇaparibhogamattampi
analyzed: bhuñjissatha āvuso ti dhamma nimantana mattam pi a katvā mahante mahante kabaḷe karoti  anādīnava dassāvi iti ādīnava mattam pi na passati a nissaraṇa pañño ti idha mattaññu tā nissaraṇa paccavekkhaṇa paribhoga mattam pi
translated: “You will eat, won’t you, friend?” without even saying “Let me give you a little,” he makes a big lump.🔽“Not seeing danger” : he does not see even the slightest danger. “Lacking the knowledge of escape” : he does not know even the escape by moderation, by reviewing, and by using as the nutriment for the path.

original: na karoti. Lābhasakkārasilokanikantihetūti lābhādīsu taṇhāhetu.
analyzed: na karoti lābha sakkāra siloka nikanti hetu uti lābha ādīsu taṇhā hetu
translated: “Because of his attachment to gain, honour, and fame” : because of his craving for gain, etc.

original: 61. Saṃbhakkhetīti saṃkhādati. Asanivicakkanti vicakkasaṇṭhānā asaniyeva. Idaṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: saṃbhakkheti iti saṃkhādati asani vicakkam ti vicakka saṇṭhānā asaniyā iva idam vuttam
translated: “He gobbles it up” : he eats it. “His jaw works like a threshing-mill’s” : his jaw works like a pestle. This is what is meant.

original: hoti “asanivicakkaṃ imassa dantakūṭaṃ mūlabījādīsu na kiñci na saṃbhuñjati. Atha
analyzed: hoti imassa dantakūṭam mūla bīja ādīsu na kiñci na saṃbhuñjati atha
translated: “His teeth-tips are not spared anything among the roots, etc.,

original: ca pana naṃ samaṇappavādena samaṇoti sañjānantī”ti. Evaṃ apasādeti avakkhipati. Idaṃ
analyzed: ca pana nam samaṇa pavādena samaṇaḥ iti sañjānanti iti evam apasādeti avakkhipati idam
translated: but still they reckon him a recluse because of the mere name ‘recluse.’“ Thus he disparages and insults him.

original: titthiyavasena āgataṃ. Bhikkhuvasena panettha ayaṃ yojanā, attanā dhutaṅgadharo hoti,
analyzed: titthiya vasena āgatam bhikkhu vasena pana ittha ayam yojanā attanā dhutaṅgadharaḥ hoti
translated: and it is the sectarians who are meant here. But the explanation by way of bhikkhus is this: he himself is one who carries out the ascetic practices,

original: so aññaṃ evaṃ apasādeti “kiṃ samaṇā nāma ime samaṇamhāti vadanti, dhutaṅgamattampi
analyzed: so aññam evam apasādeti kim samaṇāḥ nāma ime vadanti
translated: and he disparages another thus: “What are these recluses? They are not recluses. They have no ascetic practices at all.

original: natthi, uddesabhattādīni pariyesantā paccayabāhullikā vicarantī”ti. Lūkhājīvinti
analyzed: natthi uddesa bhatta ādīni pariyesantā paccaya bāhullikā vicaranti iti lūkhājīvin ti
translated: They go about seeking invitations to meals and so on, and they are addicted to many needs.” He is one of austere living:🔽he is one who lives austerely by the naked ascetics’ way of life or by the ascetic practices. He is envious and selfish:

original: acelakādivasena vā dhutaṅgavasena vā lūkhājīviṃ. Issāmacchariyanti parassa sakkārādisampattikhīyanalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: acelaka ādi vasena vā dhutaṅga vasena vā lūkhā jīvim parassa sakkāra ādi sampatti khīyana lakkhaṇam
translated: envy has the characteristic of annoyance at another’s success.

original: issaṃ, sakkārādikaraṇaakkhamanalakkhaṇaṃ macchariyañca.🔽62. Āpāthakanisādī hotīti manussānaṃ āpāthe dassanaṭṭhāne nisīdati. Yattha te passanti,🔽tattha ṭhito vaggulivataṃ carati, pañcātapaṃ tappati, ekapādena tiṭṭhati, sūriyaṃ
analyzed: issam sakkāra ādi karaṇa akkhamana lakkhaṇam macchariyam ca  āpāthaka nisādī hoti iti manussānam āpāthe dassana ṭṭhāne nisīdati yattha te passanti  tattha ṭhitaḥ vaggulivatam carati pañca ātapam tappati eka pādena tiṭṭhati sūriyam
translated: Selfishness has the characteristic of unwillingness to share one’s own success.🔽He sits in the public places: he sits in places where people see him,🔽where they can see him as he goes about begging in the streets, as he stands in the wind and sun, as he pays homage to the sun,

original: namassati. Sāsane pabbajitopi samādinnadhutaṅgo sabbarattiṃ sayitvā manussānaṃ cakkhupathe
analyzed: namassati sāsane pabbajitaḥ api samādinna dhutaṅgo sabbarattim sayitvā manussānam cakkhupathe
translated: and so on. Even one gone forth in the Dispensation, who has taken up the ascetic practices, sleeps all night, and then sits in the public places

original: tapaṃ karoti, mahāsāyanheyeva cīvarakuṭiṃ karoti, sūriye uggate paṭisaṃharati, manussānaṃ
analyzed: tapam karoti cīvarakuṭim karoti sūriye uggate paṭisaṃharati manussānam
translated: He does the painful practice, and he makes his robe-tent only in the middle of the day, and he takes it down when the sun has risen. When he finds out that people are coming,

original: āgatabhāvaṃ ñatvā ghaṇḍiṃ paharitvā cīvaraṃ matthake ṭhapetvā caṅkamaṃ otarati, sammuñjaniṃ
analyzed: āgata bhāvam ñatvā ghaṇḍim paharitvā cīvaram matthake ṭhapetvā caṅkamam otarati sammuñjanim
translated: he rings a gong, puts his robe on his head, and goes down to the walk. Taking a broom,

original: gahetvā vihāraṅgaṇaṃ sammajjati.
analyzed: gahetvā vihāra aṅgaṇam sammajjati
translated: he sweeps the courtyard of the dwelling.

original: Attānanti attano guṇaṃ adassayamānoti ettha a-kāro nipātamattaṃ, dassayamānoti attho.
analyzed: attānanti attanaḥ guṇam a dassayamānaḥ iti ettha akāraḥ nipātam attam dassayamānaḥ iti atthaḥ
translated: As to ‘himself’: not showing his own virtue. Here the letter a is a mere particle. The meaning is, ‘not showing’.

original: Idampi me tapasminti idampi kammaṃ mameva tapasmiṃ, paccatte vā bhummaṃ, idampi mama🔽tapoti attho. So hi asukasmiṃ ṭhāne acelako atthi muttācārotiādīni sutvā amhākaṃ🔽esa tapo, amhākaṃ so antevāsikotiādīni bhaṇati. Asukasmiṃ vā pana ṭhāne paṃsukūliko
analyzed: idam pi me tapasmin ti idam pi kammam mama iva tapasmin paccatte vā bhummam idam pi mama  tapoti attho so hi asukasmin ṭhāne acelakaḥ atthi muttācāraḥ ti ādīni sutvā amhākam  amhākam saḥ antevāsika uti ādīni bhaṇati asukasmin vā pana ṭhāne paṃsukūlikaḥ
translated: As to ‘this too’: this action is in my painful practice. Or else the locative case is objective: this too is my painful practice.

original: bhikkhu atthītiādīni sutvā amhākaṃ esa tapo, amhākaṃ so antevāsikotiādīni bhaṇati.
analyzed: bhikkhu atthi itiādīni sutvā amhākam esa tapaḥ amhākam so antevāsikaḥ iti ādīni bhaṇati
translated: The meaning is, ‘this too is my painful practice’. For when he hears, ‘There is a naked ascetic in such-and-such a place, who goes about naked and smeared with clay, and he is a good ascetic’, he says, ‘That is our practice, he is our pupil.’ Or when he hears, ‘In such-and-such a place there is a bhikkhu who is a refuse-rag wearer’, he says, ‘That is our practice, he is our pupil.’

original: Kiñcidevāti kiñci vajjaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ vā. Paṭicchannaṃ sevatīti yathā aññe na jānanti,
analyzed: kiñcid eva ati kiñci vajjam diṭṭhi gatam vā paṭicchannam sevati iti yathā aññe na jānanti
translated: ‘Some little thing’: some little fault or view. ‘He associates with the concealed’: he associates in such a way that others do not know about it.

original: evaṃ sevati. Akkhamamānaṃ āha khamatīti aruccamānaṃyeva ruccati meti vadati. Attanā🔽kataṃ atimahantampi vajjaṃ appamattakaṃ katvā paññapeti, parena kataṃ dukkaṭamattaṃ
analyzed: evam sevati a khamamānam āha khamati iti ruccati mā iti vadati attanā  katam ati mahantam pi vajjam appamattakam katvā paññapeti parena katam dukkaṭa mattam
translated: ‘He says what is not fact is fact’: he says what is not agreeable is agreeable to him.🔽He makes even a very great fault seem small, and he makes even a minor offence or transgression committed by another seem like a grave offence.🔽‘What should be approved’: what should be approved of and rejoiced in.

original: vītikkamampi pārājikasadisaṃ katvā dasseti. Anuññeyyanti anujānitabbaṃ anumoditabbaṃ.🔽63. Kodhano hoti upanāhīti kujjhanalakkhaṇena kodhena, veraappaṭinissaggalakkhaṇena🔽upanāhena ca samannāgato. Makkhī hoti paḷāsīti paraguṇamakkhanalakkhaṇena makkhena,🔽yugaggāhalakkhaṇena paḷāsena ca samannāgato.
analyzed: vītikkamam pi pārājika sadisam katvā dasseti anuññeyyam ti anujānitabbam anumoditabbam  kodhanaḥ hoti upanāhi iti kujjhana lakkhaṇena kodhena vera appaṭinissagga lakkhaṇena  upanāhena ca samannāgataḥ makkhī hoti paḷāsī iti para guṇa makkhana lakkhaṇena makkhena  yuga ggāha lakkhaṇena paḷāsena ca samannāgataḥ
translated: ‘He is angry and revengeful’: he is endowed with anger, which is characterized by irritation, and with revenge, which is characterized by non-forgiveness.🔽‘He is deceitful and pretentious’: he is endowed with deceit, which is characterized by the concealing of one’s faults, and with pretense, which is characterized by the assuming of an air of virtue.

original: Issukī hoti maccharīti parasakkārādīsu usūyanalakkhaṇāya issāya, āvāsakulalābhavaṇṇadhammesu
analyzed: issukī hoti maccharī iti para sakkāra ādīsu usūyana lakkhaṇāya issāya āvāsa kula lābha vaṇṇa dhammesu
translated: ‘He is envious and selfish’: he is endowed with envy, which is characterized by jealousy over the gains, honors, etc., of others, and with selfishness, which is characterized by the desire to possess dwellings, families, gain, and so forth.

original: maccharāyanalakkhaṇena pañcavidhamaccherena ca samannāgato hoti. Saṭho hoti māyāvīti
analyzed: maccharāyana lakkhaṇena pañcavidha maccherena ca samannāgataḥ hoti saṭhaḥ hoti māyāvī iti
translated: He is full of the five kinds of avarice, which have the characteristic of stinginess. He is fraudulent and deceitful:

original: kerāṭikalakkhaṇena sāṭheyyena, katappaṭicchādanalakkhaṇāya māyāya ca samannāgato🔽hoti. Thaddho hoti atimānīti nissinehanikkaruṇathaddhalakkhaṇena thambhena, atikkamitvā🔽maññanalakkhaṇena atimānena ca samannāgato hoti. Pāpiccho hotīti asantasambhāvanapatthanalakkhaṇāya
analyzed: kerāṭika lakkhaṇena sāṭheyyena kata paṭicchādana lakkhaṇāya māyāya ca samannāgataḥ  hoti thaddhaḥ hoti atimānī iti nissineha nikkaruṇa thaddha lakkhaṇena thambhena atikkamitvā  maññana lakkhaṇena atimānena ca samannāgataḥ hoti pāpa icchaḥ hoti iti asanta sambhāvana patthana lakkhaṇāya
translated: he is full of fraudulence, which has the characteristic of crookedness, and of deceit, which has the characteristic of concealing one’s faults. He is obstinate and arrogant:🔽he is obstinate, which has the characteristic of lack of humility and lack of compassion, and he is arrogant, which has the characteristic of thinking “I am” and of despising others. He is of evil wishes:🔽he is full of evil wishes, which have the characteristic of aiming at what is improper. He is under the control of evil wishes:

original: pāpicchatāya samannāgato hoti. Pāpikānanti tāsaṃyeva lāmakānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gato.🔽Micchādiṭṭhikoti natthi dinnantiādinayappavattāya ayāthāvadiṭṭhiyā upeto. Antaggāhikāyāti
analyzed: pāpa icchatāya samannāgataḥ hoti tāsam yā iva lāmakānam icchānam vasam gataḥ  micchādiṭṭhiko ti natthi dinna nti ādi naya ppavattāya a yāthāva diṭṭhiyā upetaḥ antaggāhikāya ati
translated: he is under the control of those same evil wishes. He has wrong view:🔽he is possessed of wrong view, which occurs thus: “There is nothing given,” and so on. He is fixed on that:

original: sāyeva diṭṭhi ucchedantassa gahitattā “antaggāhikā”ti vuccati, tāya samannāgatoti
analyzed: sāya iva diṭṭhi uccheda antassa gahita ttā antaggāhikā iti vuccati tāya samannāgataḥ ti
translated: that same view is called “fixed on the extremity” because it seizes the extreme of annihilation. The meaning is that he is possessed of that . He is attached to his own views, holds on to them, and relinquishes them with difficulty:🔽his own view is his “own view” . He holds on to it and does not let go. He is obstinate and arrogant:

original: attho. Sandiṭṭhiparāmāsītiādīsu sayaṃ diṭṭhi sandiṭṭhi, sandiṭṭhimeva parāmasati
analyzed: attho sandiṭṭhi parāmāsī itiādīsu sayam diṭṭhi sandiṭṭhi sandiṭṭhim eva parāmasati
translated: he is obstinate, which has the characteristic of lack of humility and lack of compassion, and he is arrogant, which has the characteristic of thinking “I am” and of despising others.

original: gahetvā vadatīti sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī. Ādhānaṃ vuccati daḷhaṃ suṭṭhu ṭhapitaṃ, tathā
analyzed: gahetvā vadati iti sandiṭṭhi parāmāsī ādhānam vuccati daḷham suṭṭhu ṭhapitam tathā
translated: He is one who grasps at rules and vows: he grasps at them firmly and well,🔽and he holds on to them thus. He is one who finds it hard to give up: he cannot be made to give up, like Ariṭṭha.

original: katvā gaṇhātīti ādhānaggāhī. Ariṭṭho viya na sakkā hoti paṭinissajjāpetunti duppaṭinissaggī. Yadimeti yadi ime.
analyzed: katvā gaṇhāti iti ādhāna ggāhī ariṭṭhaḥ viya na sakkā hoti paṭinissajjāpetunti duppaṭinissaggī yat ime iti yadi ime
translated: If these are: if these are.

original: Parisuddhapapaṭikappattakathāvaṇṇanā🔽64. Idha, nigrodha, tapassīti evaṃ bhagavā aññatitthiyehi gahitaladdhiṃ tesaṃ rakkhitaṃ🔽tapaṃ sabbameva saṃkiliṭṭhanti upakkilesapāḷiṃ dassetvā idāni parisuddhapāḷidassanatthaṃ
analyzed: idha nigrodha tapassī iti evam bhagavā añña titthiyehi gahita laddhim tesam rakkhitam  tapam sabbam eva saṃkiliṭṭhanti upakkilesa pāḷim dassetvā idāni parisuddha pāḷi dassana attham
translated: The explanation of the section on “one who has attained to the way to purity.”

original: desanamārabhanto idha, nigrodhātiādimāha. Tattha “na attamano”tiādīni vuttavipakkhavaseneva🔽veditabbāni. Sabbavāresu ca lūkhatapassino ceva dhutaṅgadharassa ca vasena yojanā
analyzed: desanam ārabhantaḥ idha nigrodha ati ādim āha tattha na atta manaḥ ti ādīni vutta vipakkha vasena iva  veditabbāni sabba vāresu ca lūkhatapassino ca iva dhutaṅga dharassa ca vasena yojanā
translated: Here, Nigrodha, an ascetic: the Blessed One, having shown the text on defilement thus, “Nigrodha, here an ascetic does not understand as it really is the gratification that is in the world as it really is the danger, the deliverance, and the escape from the world,” now began the teaching in order to show the text on purity with the words “Here, Nigrodha, an ascetic understands as it really is the gratification that is in the world as it really is the danger, the deliverance, and the escape from the world.”🔽Herein, he is not pleased: he is not pleased with that view.🔽He is not satisfied: he is not satisfied with that view.🔽He does not hold on to it: he does not hold on to that view.

original: veditabbā. Evaṃ so tasmiṃ ṭhāne parisuddho hotīti evaṃ so tena na attamanatā na paripuṇṇasaṅkappabhāvasaṅkhātena
analyzed: veditabbā evam saḥ tasmim ṭhāne parisuddhaḥ hoti iti evam saḥ tena na atta mana tā na paripuṇṇa saṅkappa bhāva saṅkhātena
translated: He does not speak of it: he does not speak of that view.🔽He is not one who holds his own view as paramount: he does not hold on to that view as paramount.🔽He is not one who grasps at rules and vows: he does not grasp at that view.🔽He is one who finds it easy to give up: he can be made to give up that view.🔽He is purified in that respect: he is purified by the abandoning of that view.

original: kāraṇena parisuddho nirupakkileso hoti, uttari vāyamamāno kammaṭṭhānasuddhiko hutvā
analyzed: kāraṇena parisuddhaḥ nirupakkilesaḥ hoti uttari vā āyamamānaḥ kammaṭṭhāna suddhikaḥ hutvā
translated: He is purified by reason, free from defilement, and by striving further he becomes one who has purified the subject of meditation.

original: arahattaṃ pāpuṇāti. Iminā nayena sabbavāresu attho veditabbo.🔽69. Addhā kho, bhanteti bhante evaṃ sante ekaṃseneva vīriyena pāpajigucchanavādo🔽parisuddho hotīti anujānāti. Ito parañca aggabhāvaṃ vā sārabhāvaṃ vā ajānanto aggappattā
analyzed: arahattam pāpuṇāti iminā nayena sabba vāresu atthaḥ veditabbo  addhā kho bhante iti bhante evam sante ekaṃsena iva vīriyena pāpa jigucchana vādaḥ  parisuddhaḥ hoti iti anujānāti itas parañca agga bhāvam vā sāra bhāvam vā a jānantaḥ agga ppattā
translated: And he attains Arahantship. The meaning should be understood in this way in all the passages.🔽“Surely, venerable sir,” etc. If it is so, then the doctrine of the condemnation of evil is approved by the Blessed One as being entirely of such a nature as to be purified by energy.

original: sārappattā cāti āha. Athassa bhagavā sārappattabhāvaṃ paṭisedhento na kho nigrodhātiādimāha.
analyzed: sāra ppattā ca iti āha athassa bhagavā sāra ppatta bhāvam paṭisedhentaḥ na kho nigrodha ati ādim āha
translated: And from here on the Blessed One does not know of any excellence or pith in the doctrine of the condemnation of evil, so he says, “They are not Arahants,” etc., in order to show that it is not the doctrine of Arahants or of those who have reached the pith.

original: Papaṭikappattā hotīti sāravato rukkhassa sāraṃ phegguṃ tacañca atikkamma bahipapaṭikasadisā hotīti dasseti.
analyzed: papaṭika ppattā hoti iti sāravataḥ rukkhassa sāram pheggum tacam ca atikkamma bahi papaṭika sadisā hoti iti dasseti
translated: “They become mere stumps” : he shows that they are like the outer bark of a tree that has lost its pith.

original: Parisuddhatacappattādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: parisuddha taca ppatta ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on “purified by the bark, etc.”

original: 70. Aggaṃ pāpetūti desanāvasena aggaṃ pāpetvā desetu, sāraṃ pāpetvā desetūti dasabalaṃ
analyzed: aggam pāpetu uti desanā vasena aggam pāpetvā desetu sāram pāpetvā desetu iti dasa balam
translated: “Let him bring to the fore”: let him teach after bringing to the fore by way of the teaching, let him teach after bringing to the fore the ten powers of the Buddha.

original: yācati. Cātuyāmasaṃvarasaṃvutoti catubbidhena saṃvarena pihito. Na pāṇaṃ atipātetīti🔽pāṇaṃ na hanati. Na bhāvitamāsīsatīti bhāvitaṃ nāma tesaṃ saññāya pañca kāmaguṇā,
analyzed: yācati cātuyāma saṃvara saṃvutaḥ uti catubbidhena saṃvarena pihitaḥ na pāṇam atipāta iti iti  pāṇam na hanati na bhāvitam āsīsati iti bhāvitam nāma tesam saññāya pañca kāmaguṇā
translated: He is “bound by the fourfold restraint” because he is restrained by the fourfold restraint. He does not kill living beings:

original: te na āsīsati na sevatīti attho.🔽Aduṃ cassa hotīti etañcassa idāni vuccamānaṃ “so abhiharatī”tiādilakkhaṇaṃ. Tapassitāyāti🔽tapassibhāvena hoti. Tattha so abhiharatīti so taṃ sīlaṃ abhiharati, uparūpari vaḍḍheti.🔽Sīlaṃ me paripuṇṇaṃ, tapo āraddho, alamettāvatāti na vīriyaṃ vissajjeti. No hīnāyāvattatīti🔽hīnāya gihibhāvatthāya na āvattati. Sīlato uttari visesādhigamatthāya vīriyaṃ karotiyeva,
analyzed: te na āsīsati na sevati iti attho  cassa hoti iti etat ca ssa idāni vuccamānam saḥ abhiharati iti ādi lakkhaṇam tapassi tāya ati  tapassi bhāvena hoti tattha saḥ abhiharati iti saḥ tam sīlam abhiharati upari upari vaḍḍheti  sīlam me paripuṇṇam tapaḥ āraddhaḥ alam ettāvatā ati na vīriyam vissajjeti no hīnāya avattati iti  hīnāya gihi bhāva tthāya na āvattati sīlataḥ uttari visesa adhigama tthāya vīriyam
translated: he does not kill living beings. He does not take what has not been given:

original: evaṃ karonto so vivittaṃ senāsanaṃ bhajati. “Arañña”ntiādīni sāmaññaphale vitthāritāneva.
analyzed: evam karontaḥ saḥ vivittam senāsanam bhajati araññanti ādīni sāmañña phale
translated: he does not take what has not been given. He does not engage in sexual intercourse: he does not engage in sexual intercourse. He does not tell lies: he does not tell lies. He does not drink intoxicating drinks: he does not drink intoxicating drinks. He abstains from untimely eating: he abstains from untimely eating. He abstains from dancing, singing, music, and going to see entertainments: he abstains from dancing, singing, music, and going to see entertainments. He abstains from wearing garlands, embellishing himself with scents, and beautifying himself with unguents: he abstains from wearing garlands, embellishing himself with scents, and beautifying himself with unguents. He abstains from accepting gold and silver: he abstains from accepting gold and silver. He abstains from accepting raw grain: he abstains from accepting raw grain. He abstains from accepting raw meat: he abstains from accepting raw meat. He abstains from accepting women and girls: he abstains from accepting women and girls. He abstains from accepting men and women slaves: he abstains from accepting men and women slaves. He abstains from accepting goats and sheep: he abstains from accepting goats and sheep. He abstains from accepting fowl and pigs: he abstains from accepting fowl and pigs. He abstains from accepting elephants, cattle, horses, and mares: he abstains from accepting elephants, cattle, horses, and mares. He abstains from accepting fields and land: he abstains from accepting fields and land. He abstains from going on errands: he abstains from going on errands. He abstains from buying and selling: he abstains from buying and selling. He abstains from dealing with false weights, false metals, and false measures: he abstains from dealing with false weights, false metals, and false measures. He abstains from cheating and deceiving with weights, metals, and measures: he abstains from cheating and deceiving with weights, metals, and measures. He abstains from cheating and deceiving by dividing things into parts: he abstains from cheating and deceiving by dividing things into parts. He ab

original: “Mettāsahagatenā”tiādīni visuddhimagge vaṇṇitāni. Tacappattāti papaṭikato abbhantaraṃ
analyzed: mettā sahagatena ati ādīni visuddhi magge vaṇṇitāni taca pattā ti pa paṭikataḥ abbhantaram
translated: “With loving-kindness” and so on are described in the Path of Purification . The “stage of the skin” is the stage inside the bark.

original: tacaṃ pattā. Phegguppattāti tacato abbhantaraṃ phegguṃ pattā, pheggusadisā hotīti attho.
analyzed: tacam pattā pheggu pattā ati tacataḥ abbhantaram pheggum pattā pheggu sadisā hoti iti attho
translated: The “stage of the inner skin” is the stage inside the skin. The meaning is that it is like the inner skin.

original: 74. “Ettāvatā, kho nigrodha, tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā cā”ti idaṃ
analyzed: ettāvatā kho nigrodha tapaḥ jigucchā agga ppattā ca hoti sāra ppattā ca ati idam
translated: “Nigrodha, at this point austerity through self-mortification reaches its peak and its consummation” .

original: bhagavā titthiyānaṃ vasenāha. Titthiyānañhi lābhasakkāro rukkhassa sākhāpalāsasadiso.
analyzed: bhagavā titthiyānam vasena āha titthiyānam hi lābha sakkāraḥ rukkhassa sākhā palāsa sadiso
translated: The Blessed One said this with reference to the sectarians. For the sectarians’ gain and honour are like the branches and foliage of a tree.

original: Pañcasīlamattakaṃ papaṭikasadisaṃ. Aṭṭhasamāpattimattaṃ tacasadisaṃ. Pubbenivāsañāṇāvasānā
analyzed: pañca sīla mattakam papaṭika sadisam aṭṭha samāpatti mattam taca sadisam pubbenivāsa ñāṇa avasānā
translated: The five precepts are like the bark. The eight attainments are like the inner skin. The kinds of direct knowledge ending with knowledge of past lives

original: abhiññā pheggusadisā. Dibbacakkhuṃ panete arahattanti gahetvā vicaranti. Tena nesaṃ
analyzed: abhiññā pheggu sadisā dibba cakkhum pana ete arahattanti gahetvā vicaranti tena na īsam
translated: are like the sapwood. But they wander about taking the eye of the Dhamma as the heartwood. Therefore

original: taṃ rukkhassa sārasadisaṃ. Sāsane pana lābhasakkāro sākhāpalāsasadiso. Sīlasampadā
analyzed: tam rukkhassa sāra sadisam sa āsane pana lābha sakkāro sākhā palāsa sadisaḥ sīla sampadā
translated: their Dhamma is like the heartwood of a tree. But in the Dispensation gain and honour are like the branches and foliage.

original: papaṭikasadisā. Jhānasamāpattiyo tacasadisā. Lokiyābhiññā pheggusadisā. Maggaphalaṃ
analyzed: papaṭika sadisāḥ jhāna samāpattiyaḥ taca sadisā lokiya abhiññā pheggu sadisā magga phalam
translated: The perfection of virtue is like the bark. The jhāna attainments are like the inner skin. The mundane kinds of direct knowledge are like the sapwood. The path and fruit are like the heartwood.

original: sāro. Iti bhagavatā attano sāsanaṃ onatavinataphalabhārabharitarukkhūpamāya upamitaṃ.
analyzed: iti bhagavatā sāsanam onata vinata phala bhāra bharita rukkhu upamāya upamitam
translated: is the heartwood. Thus the Blessed One’s Dispensation is compared to a tree that bears fruit in the form of humility and obedience.

original: So desanākusalatāya tato tacasārasampattito mama sāsanaṃ uttaritarañceva paṇītatarañca,
analyzed: saḥ desanā kusala tāya tatas taca sāra sampattitaḥ mama sāsanam uttaritaram ca iva paṇītataram ca
translated: But because of his skill in teaching, he says: “My Dispensation is superior and more excellent than his in the matter of the attainment of the heartwood,”

original: taṃ tuvaṃ kadā jānissasīti attanodesanāya visesabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “iti kho nigrodhā”ti
analyzed: tam tuvam kadā jānissasi iti attanā desanāya visesa bhāvam dassetuṃ iti kho nigrodha ati
translated: and in order to show the distinction of his own teaching, he begins the discourse with the words: “Thus, Nigrodha.”

original: desanaṃ ārabhi. Te paribbājakāti te tassa parivārā tiṃsasatasaṅkhyā paribbājakā.
analyzed: desanam ārabhi te paribbājakā ati te tassa parivārā tiṃsa sata saṅkhyā paribbājakā
translated: “Those wanderers” are the three hundred wanderers who were his followers.

original: Ettha mayaṃ anassāmāti ettha acelakapāḷiādīsu, idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti “amhākaṃ acelakapāḷimattampi
analyzed: ettha mayam anassāma ati ettha acelaka pāḷi ādīsu idam vuttam hoti amhākam acelaka pāḷi mattam pi
translated: “Here we are at a loss” : here in the Acceka-pāḷi, etc. This is what is meant: “We do not even have the Acceka-pāḷi,

original: natthi, kuto parisuddhapāḷi. Amhākaṃ parisuddhapāḷimattampi natthi, kuto cātuyāmasaṃvarādīni.
analyzed: natthi kutas parisuddha pāḷi amhākam parisuddha pāḷimattam pi natthi kutas cātuyāma saṃvara ādīni
translated: let alone a pure recitation. We do not even have a pure recitation, let alone the fourfold restraint of the uposatha observance, etc.

original: Cātuyāmasaṃvaropi natthi, kuto araññavāsādīni. Araññavāsopi natthi, kuto nīvaraṇappahānādīni.
analyzed: cātuyāma saṃvaro api natthi kutas arañña vāsa ādīni arañña vāso api natthi kutas nīvaraṇa ppahāna ādīni
translated: We do not even have the fourfold restraint of the uposatha observance, let alone dwelling in the forest, etc. We do not even have dwelling in the forest, let alone the abandoning of the hindrances, etc.

original: Nīvaraṇappahānampi natthi, kuto brahmavihārādīni. Brahmavihāramattampi natthi, kuto🔽pubbenivāsādīni. Pubbenivāsañāṇamattampi natthi, kuto amhākaṃ dibbacakkhu. Ettha
analyzed: nīvaraṇa ppahānam pi natthi kutas brahmavihāra ādīni brahmavihāra mattam pi natthi kutas  pubbenivāsa ādīni pubbenivāsa ñāṇa mattam pi na atthi kutas amhākam dibba cakkhu ettha
translated: There is no abandoning of the hindrances, let alone the divine abidings,🔽There is no divine abiding, let alone the knowledge of recollecting past lives,🔽There is no knowledge of recollecting past lives, let alone the divine eye.

original: mayaṃ saācariyakā naṭṭhā”ti. Ito bhiyyo uttaritaranti ito dibbacakkhuñāṇādhigamato
analyzed: mayam sa ācariyakā itas bhiyyas uttaritaranti itas dibba cakkhu ñāṇa adhigamato
translated: “There is no abandoning of the hindrances, let alone the divine abidings. There is no divine abiding, let alone knowledge of past lives. There is no knowledge of past lives, let alone the divine eye. Here we are lost with our teacher.”

original: bhiyyo aññaṃ uttaritaraṃ visesādhigamaṃ mayaṃ sutivasenāpi na jānāmāti vadanti.
analyzed: bhiyyas aññam uttaritaram visesa adhigamam mayam suti vasena api na jānāma ati vadanti
translated: “We do not know of any higher or more superlative knowledge than the attainment of the knowledge of the divine eye.🔽”

original: Nigrodhassapajjhāyanavaṇṇanā🔽75. Atha nigrodhaṃ paribbājakanti evaṃ kirassa ahosi “ime paribbājakā idāni bhagavato🔽bhāsitaṃ sussūsanti, iminā ca nigrodhena bhagavato parammukhā kakkhaḷaṃ durāsadavacanaṃ
analyzed: atha nigrodham paribbājakan ti evam kirassa ahosi ime paribbājakāḥ idāni bhagavataḥ  bhāsitam sussūsanti iminā ca nigrodhena bhagavataḥ parammukhā kakkhaḷam durāsada vacanam
translated: The explanation of Nigrodha’s questions

original: vuttaṃ, idāni ayampi sotukāmo jāto, kālo dāni me imassa mānaddhajaṃ nipātetvā bhagavato
analyzed: vuttam idāni ayam pi sotu kāmaḥ jātaḥ kālaḥ dāni me imassa mānaddhajam nipātetvā bhagavataḥ
translated: Then Nigrodha said, “Now these wanderers are listening attentively to the Blessed One’s words. And this Nigrodha has spoken harsh and unpalatable words to the Blessed One. Now he is eager to listen. This is the time for me to knock down his banner of conceit and to make him bow his head to the Blessed One’s feet.”

original: sāsanaṃ ukkhipitu”nti. Atha nigrodhaṃ paribbājakaṃ etadavoca. Aparampissa ahosi “ayaṃ
analyzed: sāsanam ukkhipitunti atha nigrodham paribbājakam etat avoca aparam pissa ahosi ayam
translated: “I will overthrow the Dispensation.” Then he said this to the wanderer Nigrodha: Another thought occurred to him: “If I do not speak to him, he will not ask for forgiveness from the Teacher,

original: mayi akathente satthāraṃ na khamāpessati, tadassa anāgate ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattissati,
analyzed: mayi a kathente satthāram na khamāpessati tat assa anāgate ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattissati

translated: but if I speak to him, he will ask for forgiveness, and that will lead to his welfare and happiness for a long time.”

original: Atha nigrodhaṃ paribbājakaṃ etadavoca. Aparisāvacaraṃ pana naṃ karothāti ettha panāti
analyzed: atha nigrodham paribbājakam etat avoca a parisā avacaram pana nam karotha ati ettha pana ati
translated: Then he said this to the wanderer Nigrodha: But in the phrase “make him one who does not move in assemblies” the word “but” (panā)

original: nipāto, atha naṃ aparisāvacaraṃ karothāti attho. “Aparisāvacareta”ntipi pāṭho, aparisāvacaraṃ
analyzed: nipātaḥ atha nam a parisāvacaram karotha ati atthaḥ a parisāvacaram
translated: is a particle, and the meaning is: “make him one who does not move in assemblies.” There is also the reading “make him one who does not move in assemblies” (a-parisāvacareta),

original: vā etaṃ karotha, gokāṇādīnaṃ vā aññataranti attho.
analyzed: vai etam karotha gokāṇa ādīnam vai aññataranti attho
translated: and the meaning is: “make him one who does not move in assemblies,” or “make him one who is like a cow’s horn, etc.”🔽In the phrase “like a cow’s horn” the meaning is: “make him one who moves about like a cow’s horn that is at the end of its tether.” He became silent,

original: Gokāṇanti etthāpi gokāṇaṃ pariyantacāriniṃ viya karothāti attho. Tuṇhībhūtoti tuṇhībhāvaṃ
analyzed: gokāṇam ti ettha api gokāṇam pariyanta cārinim viya karotha ati attho tuṇhībhūtaḥ ti tuṇhībhāvam
translated: he adopted silence,🔽he became without brilliance, he lost his brilliance,🔽he became with bent shoulder, he became with bent neck,

original: upagato. Maṅkubhūtoti nittejataṃ āpanno. Pattakkhandhoti onatagīvo. Adhomukhoti heṭṭhāmukho.
analyzed: upagataḥ maṅku bhūtaḥ iti nittejatam āpanno pattakkhandho ti onata gīvaḥ adhomukhaḥ ti heṭṭhāmukhaḥ
translated: he became with downcast face, he became with face turned downwards.

original: 76. Buddho so bhagavā bodhāyāti sayaṃ buddho sattānampi catusaccabodhatthāya dhammaṃ🔽deseti. Dantoti cakkhutopi danto…pe… manatopi danto. Damathāyāti aññesampi damanatthāya🔽eva, na vādatthāya. Santoti rāgasantatāya santo, dosamohasantatāya sabba akusalasabbābhisaṅkhārasantatāya
analyzed: buddhaḥ saḥ bhagavā bodhāya ati sayam buddhaḥ sattānam pi catu sacca bodha tthāya dhammaṃ  deseti danto ti cakkhutaḥ pi danto upe manataḥ pi danto damathāya ati aññesam pi damana tthāya  eva na vāda tthāya santaḥ iti rāga santatāya santaḥ dosa moha santatāya sabba akusala sabba abhisaṅkhāra santatāya
translated: He is the Enlightened One, the Blessed One, for the sake of enlightenment: he himself is enlightened, and he teaches the Dhamma for the sake of the four kinds of noble beings’ enlightenment of disciples, etc.,🔽He is the tamed one, the composed one, the self-confident one, the one who has attained security from bondage, the one who remembers his past lives, the one who has the divine eye, the one who has mastered the destruction of the taints: he is tamed in that he has tamed the fourfold and fivefold taints in himself;

original: santo. Samathāyāti mahājanassa rāgādisamanatthāya dhammaṃ deseti. Tiṇṇoti cattāro🔽oghe tiṇṇo. Taraṇāyāti mahājanassa oghanittharaṇatthāya. Parinibbutoti kilesaparinibbānena🔽parinibbuto. Parinibbānāyāti mahājanassāpi sabbakilesaparinibbānatthāya dhammaṃ deseti.🔽Brahmacariyapariyosānādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: santaḥ samathāya ati mahājanassa rāga ādi samana tthāya dhammam deseti tiṇṇaḥ ti cattāro  oghe taraṇāya ati mahājanassa ogha nittharaṇa atthāya parinibbutaḥ ti kilesa parinibbānena  parinibbutaḥ parinibbānāya ati mahājanassa api sabba kilesa parinibbāna tthāya dhammam deseti  brahmacariya pariyosāna ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: he is composed in that he has composed the fourfold and fivefold taints in himself; he is self-confident in that he has no fear of the fourfold and fivefold taints; he has attained security from bondage in that he has no fear of the fourfold and fivefold taints; he remembers his past lives in that he remembers his various former lives; he has the divine eye in that he sees the passing away and arising of beings; he has mastered the destruction of the taints in that he has destroyed the fourfold and fivefold taints.

original: 77. Accayotiādīni sāmaññaphale vuttāni. Ujujātikoti kāyavaṅkādivirahito ujusabhāvo.
analyzed: accayo ti ādīni sāmañña phale vuttāni uju jātiko ti kāya vaṅka ādi virahitaḥ uju sabhāvaḥ
translated: He is the one who knows and the seer, the one who has no more cankers, the one fully released by heart, the one who has reached the ultimate, the one who has attained the ultimate security from bondage, the one who has attained the ultimate destruction of the taints, the one who is foremost, the one who is supreme, the one who is pre-eminent, the one who is the best, the one who is the chief, the one who is the foremost, the one who is the highest, the one who is the highest of the high, the one who is the deva of devas, the one who is the supreme deva, the one who is the deva supreme, the one who is the deva above all other devas, the one who is the Buddha, the one who is the supreme Buddha, the one who is the Buddha supreme, the one who is the Buddha above all other Buddhas: he is the one who knows in that he has known the four noble truths; he is the seer in that he has seen the four noble truths; he is the one who has no more cankers in that he has destroyed the fourfold and fivefold cankers; he is the one fully released by heart in that he has released the fourfold and fivefold cankers in his heart; he has reached the ultimate in that he

original: Ahamanusāsāmīti ahaṃ tādisaṃ puggalaṃ anusāsāmi, dhammaṃ assa desemi. Sattāhanti🔽sattadivasāni, idaṃ sabbampi bhagavā dandhapaññaṃ puggalaṃ sandhāyāha asaṭho pana
analyzed: aham anusāsāmi iti aham tādisam puggalam anusāsāmi dhammam assa desemi sattāham ti  satta divasāni idam sabbam pi bhagavā dandha paññam puggalam sandhāya āha asaṭhaḥ pana
translated: I will instruct him : I will instruct such a person, I will teach him the Dhamma. Seven days :

original: amāyāvī ujujātiko taṃmuhutteneva arahattaṃ pattuṃ sakkhissati. Iti bhagavā “asaṭha”ntiādivacanena
analyzed: amāyāvī uju jātiko tad muhuttena iva arahattam pattum sakkhissati iti bhagavā asaṭha nti ādi vacanena
translated: seven days and nights. The Blessed One said this with reference to a person of slow understanding. But one who is not deceitful, not fraudulent, but upright, will be able to attain arahatship in that very moment. Thus, by the words “not deceitful,”

original: saṭho hi vaṅkavaṅko, mayāpi na sakkā anusāsitunti dīpento paribbājakaṃ pādesu gahetvā🔽mahāmerupādatale viya khipittha. Kasmā? Ayañhi atisaṭho, kuṭilacitto satthari evaṃ
analyzed: saṭhaḥ hi vaṅka vaṅkaḥ mayā api na sakkā anusāsitunti dīpentaḥ paribbājakam pādesu gahetvā  mahā meru pāda tale viya khipittha kasmai ayam hi ati saṭhaḥ kuṭila citto satthari evam
translated: the Blessed One shows that he is not able to instruct a deceitful person, who is crooked and twisted. He seizes the wanderer by the feet and hurls him away as if he were a lump of clay,

original: kathentepi buddhadhammasaṅghesu nādhimuccati, adhimuccanatthāya sotaṃ na odahati,
analyzed: buddha dhamma saṅghesu na adhimuccati adhimuccana atthāya sotam na odahati
translated: as if he were on the slope of a great mountain. Why? Because this person is extremely deceitful, his mind is crooked. Even when the Teacher speaks thus, he does not gain confidence in the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha. He does not open his ears to listen in order to gain confidence.

original: kohaññe ṭhito satthāraṃ khamāpeti. Tasmā bhagavā tassajjhāsayaṃ viditvā “etu viññū
analyzed: kohaññe ṭhito satthāram khamāpeti tasmai bhagavā tassa ajjhāsayam viditvā etu viññū
translated: Standing in the midst of the assembly, he asks the Teacher for forgiveness. The Blessed One, knowing his intention, says: “Let the wise man come,

original: puriso asaṭho”tiādimāha. Saṭhaṃ panāhaṃ anusāsituṃ na sakkomīti.
analyzed: puriso asaṭhaḥ iti ādim āha saṭham pana aham anusāsitum na sakkomi iti
translated: not deceitful,” etc. I am not able to instruct a deceitful person.

original: 78. Antevāsikamyatāti antevāsikamyatāya, amhe antevāsike icchanto. Evamāhāti “etu🔽viññupuriso”tiādimāha. Yo eva vo ācariyoti yo eva tumhākaṃ pakatiyā ācariyo. Uddesā🔽no cāvetukāmoti attano anusāsaniṃ gāhāpetvā amhe amhākaṃ uddesato cāvetukāmo. So🔽eva vo uddeso hotūti yo tumhākaṃ pakatiyā uddeso, so tumhākaṃyeva hotu, na mayaṃ
analyzed: antevāsi kamyatā ati antevāsi kamyatāya amhe antevāsike icchantaḥ evam āha ati etu  viññu puriso tiādim āha yaḥ eva vaḥ ācariyo ti yaḥ eva tumhākam pakatiyā uddesā  no cāvetu kāmaḥ ti attanaḥ anusāsanim gāhāpetvā amhe amhākam uddesataḥ cāvetu kāmaḥ saḥ  eva vaḥ uddesaḥ hotu uti yaḥ tumhākam pakatiyā uddeso saḥ tumhākam yeva hotu na mayam
translated: ‘If you want me as a pupil’: if you want me as a pupil. ‘Let him come’: he said, ‘Let the man of understanding come.’ ‘Your own teacher’: your own usual teacher. ‘He does not want to hand over the recitation’: he does not want to hand over his own instruction to us, to take us away from his recitation. ‘Let that recitation be yours’: let that recitation which is yours be yours.

original: tumhākaṃ uddesena atthikā. Ājīvāti ājīvato. Akusalasaṅkhātāti akusalāti koṭṭhāsaṃ🔽pattā. Akusalā dhammāti dvādasa akusalacittuppādadhammā taṇhāyeva vā visesena. Sā🔽hi punabbhavakaraṇato “ponobbhavikā”ti vuttā. Sadarathāti kilesadarathasampayuttā.🔽Jātijarāmaraṇiyāti jātijarāmaraṇānaṃ paccayabhūtā. Saṃkilesikā dhammāti dvādasa akusalacittuppādā.
analyzed: tumhākam uddesena atthikā ājīvā āti ājīvataḥ akusala saṅkhātā ati akusalā ati koṭṭhāsam 🔽pattā akusalā dhammā ti dvādasa akusala cittuppāda dhammā taṇhāya iva vā visesena sā 🔽hi punabbhava karaṇato ponobbhavikā ati vuttā sadarathā ati kilesa daratha sampayuttā 🔽jāti jarāmaraṇiyā ati jāti jarā maraṇānam paccaya bhūtā saṃkilesikā dhammā ti dvādasa akusala cittuppādā
translated: “As a pupil”: as one who wants pupils, wishing for us as pupils. “Come, you who are wise” : he said this, etc. “Your own teacher”: your own usual teacher. “He does not want to hand over the recitation” : he wants to hand us over from his own recitation. “Let that recitation be yours” : let that recitation which is yours be yours alone; we are not in need of your recitation. “As to livelihood”: as to the means of livelihood. “As to what is called unwholesome” : as to what has fallen into the category of the unwholesome. “Unwholesome states” : states of the twelve unwholesome types of consciousness, or craving in particular. For that is called “leading to renewed existence” because it brings about renewed existence. “With the defilements” : associated with the defilements. “Subject to birth, aging, and death” : a condition for birth, aging, and death. “Defiled states” : the twelve unwholesome types of consciousness.

original: Vodāniyāti, samathavipassanā dhammā. Te hi satte vodāpenti, tasmā “vodāniyā”ti vuccanti.
analyzed: vodāniyā ati samatha vipassanāḥ dhammā te hi satte vodāpenti tasmā vodāniyā ati vuccanti
translated: “To be purified”: the states of serenity and insight. They purify beings, thus they are called “to be purified.”

original: Paññāpāripūrinti maggapaññāpāripūriṃ. Vepullattañcāti phalapaññāvepullataṃ, ubhopi🔽vā etāni aññamaññavevacanāneva. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti “tato tumhe maggapaññañceva phalapaññañca
analyzed: paññā pāripūrim ti magga paññā pāripūrim vepulla tam ca ati phala paññā vepulla tam ubho pi  vā etāni idam vuttam hoti tatas tumhe magga paññañca iva phala paññañca
translated: “To be fulfilled with wisdom”: the fulfillment of the wisdom of the path. “To be expanded”: the expansion of the wisdom of the fruition.🔽Or both of these are mere synonyms. This is the meaning: “From there you will enter and dwell having known, experienced, and attained the wisdom of the path and the wisdom of the fruition

original: diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissathā”ti. Evaṃ bhagavā
analyzed: diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissatha ati evam bhagavā
translated: for yourselves right in this very life.” Thus the Blessed One,

original: paribbājake ārabbha attano ovādānusāsaniyā phalaṃ dassento arahattanikūṭena desanaṃ niṭṭhapesi.
analyzed: paribbājake ārabbha attano ovāda anusāsaniyā phalam dassentaḥ arahatta nikūṭena desanam niṭṭhapesi
translated: showing the fruit of his own advice and instruction with regard to the wanderers, concluded the teaching with the peak of arahantship.

original: 79. Yathā taṃ mārenāti yathā mārena pariyuṭṭhitacittā nisīdanti evameva tuṇhībhūtā…pe… appaṭibhānā nisinnā.
analyzed: yathā tam mārena ati yathā mārena pariyuṭṭhita cittāḥ nisīdanti evam eva tuṇhībhūta āpe appaṭibhānā nisinnā
translated: “As if possessed by Mara”: just as they sit there silent, etc.,

original: Māro kira satthā ativiya gajjanto buddhabalaṃ dīpetvā imesaṃ paribbājakānaṃ dhammaṃ
analyzed: māraḥ kira satthā ativiya gajjantaḥ buddha balam dīpetvā imesam paribbājakānam dhammaṃ
translated: Mara, it seems, was possessed by the thought: “The Teacher is displaying his own power in a most imposing way to these wanderers.

original: deseti, kadāci dhammābhisamayo bhaveyya, handāhaṃ pariyuṭṭhāmīti so tesaṃ cittāni
analyzed: deseti kadāci dhamma abhisamayaḥ bhaveyya handa aham pariyuṭṭhāmi iti saḥ tesam cittāni
translated: “If I were to teach the Dhamma, would they understand me?”🔽“If I were to teach the Dhamma, would they understand me?”

original: pariyuṭṭhāsi. Appahīnavipallāsānañhi cittaṃ mārassa yathākāmakaraṇīyaṃ hoti. Tepi
analyzed: pariyuṭṭhāsi appahīna vipallāsānam hi cittam mārassa yathākāma karaṇīyam hoti te pi
translated: If he were to teach them, they might attain the supramundane state. Let me therefore possess their minds.” He then possessed their minds. For the minds of those who have not abandoned the perversions are subject to the control of Māra.

original: mārena pariyuṭṭhitacittā thaddhaṅgapaccaṅgā viya tuṇhī appaṭibhānā nisīdiṃsu. Atha🔽satthā ime paribbājakā ativiya niravā hutvā nisinnā, kiṃ nu khoti āvajjanto mārena🔽pariyuṭṭhitabhāvaṃ aññāsi. Sace pana tesaṃ maggaphaluppattihetu bhaveyya, māraṃ paṭibāhitvāpi
analyzed: mārena pariyuṭṭhita cittā thaddhaṅga paccaṅgā viya tuṇhī appaṭibhānā nisīdiṃsu atha  satthā ime paribbājakāḥ ativiya niravāḥ hutvā nisinnāḥ kim nu khalu iti āvajjantaḥ mārena  pariyuṭṭhita bhāvam aññāsi sace pana tesam magga phala uppatti hetu bhaveyya māram paṭibāhitvā api
translated: They sat there as if their limbs were paralyzed, unable to speak.

original: bhagavā dhammaṃ deseyya, so pana tesaṃ natthi. “Sabbepi me tucchapurisā”ti aññāsi.
analyzed: bhagavā dhammam deseyya so pana tesam natthi sabbe pi me tuccha purisā ti aññāsi
translated: Then the Teacher, observing that the wanderers were sitting there in utter silence, thought, “Why are they sitting here like this?” He then understood that they were possessed by Māra. If there had been any possibility of their attaining the paths and fruits, the Blessed One would have repelled Māra and taught them the Dhamma even by force. But there was no such possibility. “All of them are empty men,” he thought.

original: Tena vuttaṃ “atha kho bhagavato etadahosi sabbepi me moghapurisā”tiādi.
analyzed: tena vuttam atha kho bhagavataḥ etat ahosi sabbe pi me mogha purisa atiādi
translated: That is why he said: “Then the Blessed One considered thus: ‘All these worthless men …’ ”

original: Tattha phuṭṭhā pāpimatāti pāpimatā mārena phuṭṭhā. Yatra hi nāmāti yesu nāma. Aññāṇatthampīti
analyzed: tattha phuṭṭhā pāpimatā ati pāpimatā mārena phuṭṭhā yatra hi nāma ati yesu nāma aññāṇa attham pi iti
translated: Herein, possessed by the Evil One means possessed by Māra, the Evil One. Where indeed means in regard to what. For the sake of ignorance means for the sake of the perversion of perception.

original: jānanatthampi. Kiṃ karissati sattāhoti samaṇena gotamena paricchinnasattāho amhākaṃ
analyzed: jānana attham pi kim karissati sattāhaḥ iti samaṇena gotamena paricchinna sattāhaḥ amhākam
translated: “What will a week do for him? What will a week do for us?

analyzed: kim karissati idam vuttam hoti samaṇena gotamena sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja
translated: This is what is said: “The ascetic Gotama has said, ‘I will attain nibbana by realization myself during the night,’

original: viharissati sattāha’nti vuttaṃ, so sattāho amhākaṃ kiṃ apphāsukaṃ karissati. Handa🔽mayaṃ sattāhabbhantare etaṃ dhammaṃ sacchikātuṃ sakkā, na sakkāti aññāṇatthampi brahmacariyaṃ🔽carissāmā”ti. Atha vā jānāma tāvassa dhammanti ekadivase ekavāraṃ aññāṇatthampi etesaṃ
analyzed: viharissati sattāhan ti vuttam saḥ sattāhaḥ amhākam kim apphāsukam karissati handa  mayam satta ahabbhantare etam dhammam sacchikātum sakkā na sakkā ati aññāṇa ttham pi brahmacariyam  carissāma ati atha vā jānāma tāvassa dhammanti eka divase eka vāram aññāṇa attham pi etesam
