analyzed: sujjhanti iti dassana attham cattāro me vāseṭṭha vaṇṇa ati ādim āha akusala saṅkhātā ati akusalā ati
translated: “Called unprofitable” : called unprofitable, or belonging to the unprofitable class.

original: saṅkhātā akusalakoṭṭhāsabhūtā vā. Esa nayo sabbattha. Na alamariyāti ariyabhāve asamatthā.
analyzed: saṅkhātā akusala koṭṭhāsa bhūtā vā esa nayo sabbattha na alam ariyāti ariya bhāve asamatthā
translated: The same method applies in all the other cases. “Not fit for the noble state” : not fit for the noble state of a disciple of the noble one .

original: Kaṇhāti pakatikāḷakā. Kaṇhavipākāti vipākopi nesaṃ kaṇho dukkhoti attho. Khattiyepi
analyzed: kaṇhā ati pakati kāḷakā kaṇha vipākā ati vipākaḥ api nesam kaṇhaḥ dukkhaḥ ti attho khattiye pi
translated: “Black” : naturally black. “Black in ripening” : their ripening is black, that is, painful.

original: teti khattiyamhipi te. Ekacceti ekasmiṃ. Esa nayo sabbattha.
analyzed: te iti te ekaccā iti ekasmin esa nayaḥ sabbattha
translated: “Among the nobles” : among the nobles. “Some” : one. The same method applies in all the other cases.

original: Sukkāti nikkilesabhāvena paṇḍarā. Sukkavipākāti vipākopi nesaṃ sukko sukhoti attho.
analyzed: sukkā ati nikkilesa bhāvena paṇḍarā sukka vipākā ati vipākaḥ api nesam sukkaḥ sukhaḥ ti attho
translated: “White” : pure, bright. “White in ripening” : their ripening is white, that is, pleasant.

original: 116. Ubhayavokiṇṇesu vattamānesūti ubhayesu vokiṇṇesu missībhūtesu hutvā vattamānesu.
analyzed: ubhaya vokiṇṇesu vattamānesu iti ubhayesu vokiṇṇesu missībhūtesu hutvā vattamānesu
translated: “Among those who are mixed” : among those who are mixed, who have become confused.

original: Katamesu ubhayesūti? Kaṇhasukkesu dhammesu viññugarahitesu ceva viññuppasatthesu
analyzed: katamesu ubhayesu iti kaṇha sukkesu dhammesu viññuga rahitesu ca iva viññu ppasatthesu
translated: “Among which two” : among the black and white ideas, those that are blameworthy and those that are blameless.

original: ca. Yadettha brāhmaṇā evamāhaṃsūti ettha etesu kaṇhasukkadhammesu vattamānāpi brāhmaṇā
analyzed: ca yat ettha brāhmaṇāḥ evam āhaṃsu iti ettha etesu kaṇha sukka dhammesu vattamānā api brāhmaṇā
translated: “Herein, Vasettha, the brahmins say thus” : although they are found among these black and white ideas,

original: yadetaṃ evaṃ vadanti “brāhmaṇova seṭṭho vaṇṇo”tiādi. Taṃ nesaṃ viññū nānujānantīti
analyzed: yat etam evam vadanti brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ tam na īsam viññū na anujānanti iti
translated: They do not approve of the Brahmins’ claim that “Only the Brahmin race is the highest,” etc.

original: ye loke paṇḍitā, te nānumodanti, na pasaṃsantīti attho. Taṃ kissa hetu? Imesañhi
analyzed: ye loke paṇḍitā te na anumodanti na pasaṃsanti iti atthaḥ tam kissa hetu imesaṃ hi
translated: The wise do not agree with this. The meaning is that the wise people in the world do not approve of it, do not praise it. Why is that?🔽The meaning of the passage beginning with “Vasettha” is this:

original: vāseṭṭhātiādimhi ayaṃ saṅkhepattho. Yaṃ vuttaṃ nānujānantīti, taṃ kasmāti ce? Yasmā
analyzed: vāseṭṭhā ti ādimhi ayam saṅkhepa atthaḥ yam vuttam na anujānanti iti tam kasmā iti ce yasmā
translated: Why is it that the wise do not approve of the Brahmins’ claim? Because

original: imesaṃ catunnaṃ vaṇṇānaṃ yo bhikkhu arahaṃ…pe… sammadaññā vimutto, so tesaṃ aggamakkhāyati,
analyzed: imesam catunnam vaṇṇānam yaḥ bhikkhu arahaṃpe sammadaññā vimutto so tesam aggam akkhāyati
translated: among these four castes, the bhikkhu who is an arahant, etc., is declared the highest.

original: te ca na evarūpā. Tasmā nesaṃ viññū nānujānanti.
analyzed: te ca na evarūpā tasmai na īsam viññū na anujānanti
translated: But the Brahmins are not like that. Therefore the wise do not approve of them.

original: Arahantiādipadesu cettha kilesānaṃ ārakattādīhi kāraṇehi arahaṃ. Āsavānaṃ khīṇattā
analyzed: arahant iti ādi padesu ca ittha kilesānam ārakatta ādīhi kāraṇehi araham āsavānam khīṇattā
translated: Herein, as to the words “arahant,” etc., he is an arahant for the following reasons: he is far from defilements, etc.🔽He is one whose cankers are destroyed because his cankers have been destroyed.

original: khīṇāsavo. Satta sekkhā puthujjanakalyāṇakā ca brahmacariyavāsaṃ vasanti nāma. Ayaṃ
analyzed: khīṇāsavo satta sekkhā puthujjana kalyāṇakā ca brahmacariya vāsam vasanti nāma ayam
translated: Seven kinds of persons and worldlings of fine character are said to “live the spiritual life,”🔽but this one is said to have “lived the spiritual life” because he has lived it to the end.

original: pana vutthavāsoti vusitavā. Catūhi maggehi catūsu saccesu parijānanādikaraṇīyaṃ kataṃ
analyzed: pana vuttha vāsaḥ ti vusitavā catūhi maggehi catūsu saccesu parijānana ādi karaṇīyam katam
translated: He has done what is to be done in regard to the four paths and the four fruits.

original: assāti katakaraṇīyo. Kilesabhāro ca khandhabhāro ca ohito assāti ohitabhāro. Ohitoti
analyzed: assa ati kata karaṇīyo kilesa bhāro ca khandha bhāro ca ohitaḥ assa ati ohita bhāro ohitaḥ ti
translated: He has laid down: he has removed.

original: ohārito. Sundaro attho, sako vā attho sadattho, anuppatto sadattho etenāti anuppattasadattho.
analyzed: ohāritaḥ sundaraḥ attho sakaḥ vā atthaḥ sadattho anuppattaḥ sadatthaḥ etena ati anuppatta sadattho
translated: The meaning of good is the meaning of good itself. He has reached the meaning of good: the meaning of good has come to him.

original: Bhavasaṃyojanaṃ vuccati taṇhā, sā parikkhīṇā assāti parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojano. Sammadaññā🔽vimuttoti sammā hetunā kāraṇena jānitvā vimutto. Janetasminti jane etasmiṃ, imasmiṃ
analyzed: bhava saṃyojanam vuccati taṇhā sā parikkhīṇā assa ati parikkhīṇa bhava saṃyojanaḥ sammadaññā  vimuttaḥ iti sammā hetunā kāraṇena jānitvā vimuttaḥ jana itasmin ti jane etasmin imasmin
translated: Craving is called the fetter of becoming. It has been destroyed by him: he is one whose fetter of becoming has been destroyed.🔽He is rightly liberated in heart: he is liberated by the right, the proper, the fitting, the correct, the suitable, the becoming, the cause, the reason.🔽In the world: in this generation.

original: loketi attho. Diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcāti idhattabhāve ca parattabhāve.
analyzed: loka iti atthaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati idhatta bhāve ca paratta bhāve
translated: In this very life: in this present life, in this present selfhood.🔽Without interval: without interval between, without delay, is the meaning.

original: 117. Anantarāti antaravirahitā, attano kulena sadisāti attho. Anuyuttāti vasavattino.
analyzed: anantarā iti antara virahitā attanaḥ kulena sadisā ati attho anuyuttā ati vasa vattinaḥ
translated: He is one who is in touch with: he is one who is in control of.

original: Nipaccakāranti mahallakatarā nipaccakāraṃ dassenti. Daharatarā abhivādanādīni karonti.
analyzed: nipaccakāranti mahallakatarāḥ nipaccakāram dassenti daharatarāḥ abhivādana ādīni karonti
translated: They show him respect: the more senior monks show him respect, while the more junior monks do obeisance to him and so on.

original: Tattha sāmīcikammanti taṃtaṃvattakaraṇādi anucchavikakammaṃ.
analyzed: tattha sāmīcikammanti taṃ taṃvatta karaṇa ādi anucchavika kammaṃ
translated: Herein, the duties proper to him are the duties proper to his age, such as attending to novices, etc.,

original: 118. Niviṭṭhāti abhiniviṭṭhā acalaṭṭhitā. Kassa pana evarūpā saddhā hotīti? Sotāpannassa.🔽So hi niviṭṭhasaddho asinā sīse chejjamānepi buddho abuddhoti vā, dhammo adhammoti
analyzed: niviṭṭhā ati abhiniviṭṭhā acala ṭṭhitā kassa pana evarūpā saddhā hoti iti sotāpannassa  so hi niviṭṭha saddhaḥ asinā sīse chejjamāne pi buddhaḥ abuddhaḥ iti vā dhammaḥ adhammaḥ iti
translated: “Well-planted” means planted well, firmly planted. But whose faith is of this kind? Of a stream-enterer.

original: vā, saṅgho asaṅghoti vā na vadati. Patiṭṭhitasaddho hoti sūrambaṭṭho viya.🔽So kira satthu dhammadesanaṃ sutvā sotāpanno hutvā gehaṃ agamāsi. Atha māro dvattiṃsavaralakkhaṇappaṭimaṇḍitaṃ
analyzed: vā saṅghaḥ a saṅghaḥ iti vā na vadati patiṭṭhita saddhaḥ hoti sūrambaṭṭhaḥ viya  so kira satthu dhamma desanam sutvā sotāpannaḥ hutvā geham agamāsi atha māraḥ dvattiṃsa vara lakkhaṇa ppaṭimaṇḍitam
translated: For when a stream-enterer’s head is being cut off with a two-handled saw, he does not say, “The Buddha is not enlightened,” or “The Dhamma is not well taught,” or “The Sangha does not practice well.” His faith is firm, like that of Sūrambaṭṭha.🔽It is said that after listening to the Buddha’s teaching, Sūrambaṭṭha attained the fruit of stream-entry and returned home. Then Māra had a Buddha image made, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

original: buddharūpaṃ māpetvā tassa gharadvāre ṭhatvā “satthā āgato”ti sāsanaṃ pahiṇi. Sūrambaṭṭho
analyzed: buddha rūpam māpetvā tassa ghara dvāre ṭhatvā satthā āgataḥ ti sāsanam pahiṇi sūrambaṭṭhaḥ
translated: and placed it at the door of Sūrambaṭṭha’s house, sending word that the Teacher had come. Sūrambaṭṭha

original: cintesi “ahaṃ idāneva satthu santike dhammaṃ sutvā āgato, kiṃ nu kho bhavissatī”ti🔽upasaṅkamitvā satthusaññāya vanditvā aṭṭhāsi. Māro āha – “ambaṭṭha, yaṃ te mayā ‘rūpaṃ
analyzed: cintesi aham idānā iva satthu santike dhammaṃ sutvā āgataḥ kim nu kho bhavissati iti  upasaṅkamitvā satthu saññāya vanditvā aṭṭhāsi māraḥ āha ambaṭṭha yam te mayā rūpam
translated: thought, “I have just returned from listening to the Dhamma with the Teacher. What could this mean?”

original: aniccaṃ…pe… viññāṇaṃ aniccanti kathitaṃ, taṃ dukkathitaṃ. Anupadhāretvāva hi mayā
analyzed: viññāṇam aniccanti kathitam tam dukkathitam an upadhāretvā ava hi mayā
translated: He went to the door, paid homage to the image, thinking it was the Teacher, and stood waiting. Māra said, “Sūrambaṭṭha, what I said to you—that form is impermanent … that consciousness is impermanent—was badly said. I should not have said it.

original: evaṃ vuttaṃ. Tasmā tvaṃ ‘rūpaṃ niccaṃ…pe… viññāṇaṃ nicca’nti gaṇhāhī”ti. So cintesi
analyzed: evam vuttam tasmā tvam rūpam viññāṇam niccanti gaṇhāhi iti saḥ cintesi
translated: He thought:

original: – “aṭṭhānametaṃ yaṃ buddhā anupadhāretvā apaccakkhaṃ katvā kiñci katheyyuṃ, addhā
analyzed: aṭṭhānam etam yam buddhāḥ an upadhāretvā a paccakkham katvā kiñci katheyyum addhā
translated: “It is impossible that the Buddhas should speak without having investigated and seen. Surely

original: ayaṃ mayhaṃ vicchindajananatthaṃ māro āgato”ti. Tato naṃ “tvaṃ mārosī”ti āha. So
analyzed: ayam mayham vicchinda janana attham māraḥ āgataḥ iti tatas nam tvam ārosi iti āha saḥ
translated: this Mara has come to break my faith.” He said to him: “You are Mara.”

original: musāvādaṃ kātuṃ nāsakkhi. “Āma mārosmī”ti paṭijānāti. “Kasmā āgatosī”ti? Tava saddhācālanatthanti
analyzed: musāvādam kātum na asakkhi āma māro asmi iti paṭijānāti kasmai āgataḥ usi iti tava saddhā cālana ttham ti
translated: He was unable to tell a lie. He admitted: “Yes, I am Mara.” “Why have you come?” He said:

original: āha. “Kaṇha pāpima, tvaṃ tāva eko tiṭṭha, tādisānaṃ mārānaṃ satampi sahassampi satasahassampi🔽mama saddhaṃ cāletuṃ asamatthaṃ, maggena āgatasaddhā nāma thirā silāpathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhitasineru
analyzed: āha kaṇha pāpima tvam tāva ekaḥ tiṭṭha tādisānam mārānam satam pi sahassam pi sata sahassam pi  mama saddham cāletum asamattham maggena āgatasaddhā nāma thirā silā pathaviyam patiṭṭhita sineru
translated: “To shake your faith.” “Black Pāpīmat, you stand alone. Even a thousand or a hundred thousand such Maras

original: viya acalā hoti, kiṃ tvaṃ etthā”ti accharaṃ pahari. So ṭhātuṃ asakkonto tattheva
analyzed: viya acalā hoti kim tvam ettha ati accharam pahari saḥ ṭhātum a sakkonto tattha iva
translated: are unable to shake the faith that has come to me by the path. Faith that has come by the path is as firm as a rock firmly set in the earth or as the Sineru mountain. What can you do to it?” He snapped his fingers. Unable to stand it,

original: antaradhāyi. Evarūpaṃ saddhaṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ “niviṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: antaradhāyi evarūpam saddham sandhāya itam vuttam niviṭṭhā ti
translated: Mara disappeared right there. This is the kind of faith that is meant by “firmly established.”

original: Mūlajātā patiṭṭhitāti maggamūlassa sañjātattā tena maggamūlena patiṭṭhitā. Daḷhāti🔽thirā. Asaṃhāriyāti sunikhātaindakhīlo viya kenaci cāletuṃ asakkuṇeyyā. Tassetaṃ
analyzed: mūla jātā patiṭṭhitā ati magga mūlassa sañjāta ttā tena magga mūlena patiṭṭhitā daḷhā ati  thirā su nikhāta aindakhīlaḥ kenacid cāletum a sakkuṇeyyā tassa etam
translated: “Rooted in the root”: rooted in the root of the path, established by means of that root of the path. “Firm”:🔽steadfast. “Unremovable”: incapable of being moved by anyone, like an indakhīla firmly planted in the earth. “This is said of him”: this is proper to say of that noble disciple. What? “I am the Blessed One’s son,

original: kallaṃ vacanāyāti tassa ariyasāvakassa yuttametaṃ vattuṃ. Kinti? “Bhagavatomhi putto
analyzed: kallam vacanāya ati tassa ariya sāvakassa yuttam etam vattum kinti bhagavataḥ amhi putto
translated: born of his breast, born of his mouth, born of the Dhamma, created by the Dhamma, an heir in the Dhamma, not an heir in material things.”

original: oraso”ti evamādi. So hi bhagavantaṃ nissāya ariyabhūmiyaṃ jātoti bhagavato putto.
analyzed: orasaḥ ti evamādi so hi bhagavantam nissāya ariya bhūmiyam jātaḥ ti bhagavataḥ putto
translated: For he is the Blessed One’s son because he is born in the noble plane of existence by depending on the Blessed One.

original: Ure vasitvā mukhato nikkhantadhammaghosavasena maggaphalesu patiṭṭhitattā oraso mukhato🔽jāto. Ariyadhammato jātattā ariyadhammena ca nimmitattā dhammajo dhammanimmito. Navalokuttaradhammadāyajjaṃ
analyzed: ure vasitvā mukhataḥ nikkhanta dhamma ghosa vasena magga phalesu patiṭṭhita ttā orasaḥ mukhataḥ  jātaḥ ariya dhammataḥ jāta ttā ariya dhammena ca nimmita ttā dhamma jaḥ dhamma nimmitaḥ nava lokuttara dhamma dāyajjam
translated: He is born of his breast because he is established in the path and fruition by means of the sound of the Dhamma that has come forth from the mouth of the Blessed One.🔽He is born of his mouth because he is born of the Dhamma and created by the Dhamma. He is an heir in the Dhamma because he is worthy of the nine supramundane dhammas that are the Blessed One’s inheritance.

original: arahatīti dhammadāyādo. Taṃ kissa hetūti yadetaṃ “bhagavatomhi putto”ti vatvā “dhammajo
analyzed: arahati iti dhamma dāyādaḥ tam kissa hetu uti yat etam bhagavataḥ ahi putto ti vatvā dhammajaḥ
translated: Why is he so? Because he says: “I am the Blessed One’s son, born of his breast, born of his mouth, born of the Dhamma, created by the Dhamma, an heir in the Dhamma, not an heir in material things.”

original: dhammanimmito”ti vuttaṃ, taṃ kasmāti ce? Idānissa atthaṃ dassento tathāgatassa hetantiādimāha.
analyzed: dhamma nimmito ti vuttam tam kasmā iti ce idānissa attham dassento tathāgatassa hetat tiādim āha
translated: “The Tathāgata is the embodiment of the Dhamma” ?

original: Tattha “dhammakāyo itipī”ti kasmā tathāgato “dhammakāyo”ti vutto? Tathāgato hi tepiṭakaṃ
analyzed: tattha dhamma kāyaḥ iti pi iti kasmā tathāgataḥ dhamma kāyaḥ ti vuttaḥ tathāgataḥ hi tepiṭakam
translated: Here, why is the Tathāgata called the embodiment of the Dhamma? The Tathāgata,

original: buddhavacanaṃ hadayena cintetvā vācāya abhinīhari. Tenassa kāyo dhammamayattā dhammova.
analyzed: buddha vacanam hadayena cintetvā vācāya tena assa kāyaḥ dhamma maya ttā dhammaḥ uva
translated: having thought over the nine-fold scriptures with his heart, has brought them forth with his speech. Therefore, his body is the Dhamma itself, because of its being made of the Dhamma.

original: Iti dhammo kāyo assāti dhammakāyo. Dhammakāyattā eva brahmakāyo. Dhammo hi seṭṭhatthena
analyzed: iti dhammaḥ kāyaḥ assa ati dhamma kāyaḥ dhamma kāya ttā eva brahma kāyaḥ dhammaḥ hi seṭṭha tthena
translated: Thus, he is the embodiment of the Dhamma. Because of his being the embodiment of the Dhamma, he is the embodiment of Brahma. The Dhamma is called Brahma in the sense of being the best.

original: brahmāti vuccati. Dhammabhūtoti dhammasabhāvo. Dhammabhūtattā eva brahmabhūto.🔽119. Ettāvatā bhagavā seṭṭhacchedakavādaṃ dassetvā idāni aparenapi nayena seṭṭhacchedakavādameva
analyzed: brahmā ati vuccati dhamma bhūto ti dhamma sabhāvaḥ dhamma bhūtattā eva brahma bhūtaḥ  ettāvatā bhagavā seṭṭha chedaka vādam dassetvā idāni aparena api nayena seṭṭha chedaka vādam eva
translated: He is the embodiment of the Dhamma, because of his being the embodiment of the Dhamma, he is the embodiment of Brahma.

original: dassetuṃ hoti kho so, vāseṭṭha, samayotiādimāha. Tattha saṃvaṭṭavivaṭṭakathā brahmajāle
analyzed: dassetum hoti kho so vāseṭṭha samayaḥ ti ādim āha tattha saṃvaṭṭa vivaṭṭa kathāḥ brahmajāle
translated: Having shown the doctrine of the best-cutter in this way, the Master now says “There is, Vasettha, a class of people” in order to show the doctrine of the best-cutter in another way. Here, the discourse on the dissolution and evolution of the world is in the Brahmajala Sutta.

original: vitthāritāva. Itthattaṃ āgacchantīti itthabhāvaṃ manussattaṃ āgacchanti. Tedha honti🔽manomayāti te idha manussaloke nibbattamānāpi opapātikā hutvā maneneva nibbattāti
analyzed: itthattam āgacchanti iti ittha bhāvam manussattam āgacchanti te idha honti  manaḥ mayā ati te idha manussa loke nibbattamānā api opapātikā hutvā manena iva nibbattā ati
translated: and so on. They come to the human state: they come to the human state, to the human kind. Then they are

original: manomayā. Brahmaloke viya idhāpi nesaṃ pītiyeva āhārakiccaṃ sādhetīti pītibhakkhā.
analyzed: manaḥ mayāḥ brahma loke idha api na īsam pītiyā iva āhāra kiccam sādheti iti pīti bhakkhā
translated: mind-made: though they are reborn here in the human world, they are apparitionally born and so they are mind-made. And just as in the Brahmā-world, so here too their nutriment is only the joy. So they live on joy.

original: Eteneva nayena sayaṃpabhādīnipi veditabbānīti.
analyzed: etena iva nayena sayaṃpabha ādīni api veditabbāni iti
translated: And in the same way the self-luminous and so on should be understood.

original: Rasapathavipātubhāvavaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the appearance of the earth as the essence of flavour

original: 120. Ekodakībhūtanti sabbaṃ cakkavāḷaṃ ekodakameva bhūtaṃ. Andhakāroti tamo. Andhakāratimisāti
analyzed: ekodakībhūtanti sabbam cakkavāḷam eka udakam eva bhūtam tamaḥ andhakāra timisā ati
translated: The whole universe became one sheet of water: the whole universe became all one sheet of water. Darkness: gloom. Great darkness:

original: cakkhuviññāṇuppattinivāraṇena andhabhāvakaraṇaṃ bahalatamaṃ. Samatanīti patiṭṭhahi🔽samantato patthari. Payaso tattassāti tattassa khīrassa. Vaṇṇasampannāti vaṇṇena
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa uppatti nivāraṇena andha bhāva karaṇam bahalatamam samata nīti patiṭṭhahi  samantataḥ patthari payasaḥ tat tassa ati tat tassa khīrassa vaṇṇa sampannā ati vaṇṇena
translated: darkness that causes blindness by preventing the occurrence of eye-consciousness. It stood, spread out: it stood, spread out all round.

original: sampannā. Kaṇikārapupphasadiso hissā vaṇṇo ahosi. Gandhasampannāti gandhena sampannā
analyzed: sampannā kaṇikāra puppha sadisaḥ hissā vaṇṇaḥ ahosi gandha sampannā ati gandhena sampannā
translated: The essence of that milk: the essence of that milk. It was perfect in colour: its colour was like that of the kaṇikāra flower. It was perfect in smell: it was perfect in smell.

original: dibbagandhaṃ vāyati. Rasasampannāti rasena sampannā pakkhittadibbojā viya hoti. Khuddamadhunti
analyzed: dibba gandham vāyati rasa sampannā ati rasena sampannā pakkhitta dibba ojā viya hoti khudda madhunti
translated: and a divine fragrance wafts forth. It is endowed with taste: it is endowed with taste, like honey mixed with ghee. It is like honey made by small bees:

original: khuddakamakkhikāhi katamadhuṃ. Aneḷakanti niddosaṃ makkhikaṇḍakavirahitaṃ. Lolajātikoti
analyzed: khuddaka makkhikāhi kata madhum an eḷakam ti niddosam makkhi kaṇḍaka virahitam
translated: it is like honey made by small bees. It is not sour: it is free from faults, free from the dregs of the bees. I am of a greedy nature:

original: lolasabhāvo. Atītānantarepi kappe loloyeva. Ambhoti acchariyajāto āha. Kimevidaṃ
analyzed: āha kim eva idam
translated: I am of a greedy disposition. Even in the past I was greedy. I said, “What is this?”

original: bhavissatīti vaṇṇopissā manāpo gandhopi, raso panassā kīdiso bhavissatīti attho.🔽Yo tattha uppannalobho, so rasapathaviṃ aṅguliyā sāyi, aṅguliyā gahetvā jivhagge ṭhapesi.
analyzed: bhavissati iti vaṇṇaḥ api ssā manāpaḥ gandhaḥ api raso pana assā kīdisaḥ bhavissati iti atthaḥ  yaḥ tattha uppanna lobho so rasa pathavim aṅguliyā sāyi aṅguliyā gahetvā jivhagge ṭhapesi
translated: What is this? I thought, “Its color is lovely, and its fragrance is lovely. But what is its taste like?”🔽The craving that arose in me for its taste I tasted with my finger. I took it with my finger and placed it in my mouth.

original: Acchādesīti jivhagge ṭhapitamattā satta rasaharaṇīsahassāni pharitvā manāpā hutvā tiṭṭhati. Taṇhā cassa okkamīti tattha cassa taṇhā uppajji.🔽Candimasūriyādipātubhāvavaṇṇanā
analyzed: acchādesi iti jivhagge ṭhapita mattā satta rasaharaṇī sahassāni pharitvā manāpā hutvā tiṭṭhati taṇhā ca ssa okkamīti tattha ca ssa taṇhā uppajji 🔽
translated: It is lovely: it is lovely, spreading through the seven thousand tastes as soon as it is placed in the mouth. Craving arose in me: craving arose in me for it.

original: 121. Āluppakārakaṃ upakkamiṃsu paribhuñjitunti ālopaṃ katvā piṇḍe piṇḍe chinditvā paribhuñjituṃ ārabhiṃsu. Candimasūriyāti candimā ca sūriyo ca. Pāturahesunti pātubhaviṃsu.
analyzed: āluppa kārakam upakkamiṃsu paribhuñjitum ti ālopam katvā piṇḍe piṇḍe chinditvā paribhuñjitum ārabhiṃsu candima sūriyā ati candimā ca sūriyaḥ ca pāturahesunti
translated: They began to eat it by breaking it up into lumps, that is, they began to eat it by breaking it up into lumps and eating it mouthful by mouthful. Moon and sun: the moon and the sun. Appeared: became manifest.

original: Ko pana tesaṃ paṭhamaṃ pātubhavi, ko kasmiṃ vasati, kassa kiṃ pamāṇaṃ, ko upari,
analyzed: kaḥ pana tesam paṭhamam kaḥ kasmin vasati kassa kim pamāṇam kaḥ upari
translated: But which of them appeared first? Who lives where? What is the size of each? Which is above?

original: ko sīghaṃ gacchati, kati nesaṃ vīthiyo, kathaṃ caranti, kittake ṭhāne ālokaṃ karontīti?
analyzed: kaḥ sīgham gacchati kati vīthiyaḥ katham caranti kittake ṭhāne ālokam karonti iti
translated: Which moves fast? How many courses have they? How do they move? In what space do they shed light?

original: Ubho ekato pātubhavanti. Sūriyo paṭhamataraṃ paññāyati. Tesañhi sattānaṃ sayaṃpabhāya
analyzed: ubho ekatas pātubhavanti sūriyaḥ paṭhamataram paññāyati tesam hi sattānam sayaṃpabhāya
translated: Both appear together. The sun becomes manifest first. For when beings’ self-luminosity disappeared,

original: antarahitāya andhakāro ahosi. Te bhītatasitā “bhaddakaṃ vatassa sace āloko pātubhaveyyā”ti🔽cintayiṃsu. Tato mahājanassa sūrabhāvaṃ janayamānaṃ sūriyamaṇḍalaṃ uṭṭhahi. Tenevassa
analyzed: antara hitāya andhakāraḥ ahosi te bhīta tasitā bhaddakam vatassa sace āloko pātubhaveyya ati  cintayiṃsu tatas mahā janassa sūra bhāvam janayamānam sūriya maṇḍalam uṭṭhahi tena iva ssa
translated: there was darkness, and they were afraid and terrified, thinking, “How good it would be if a light would appear!”🔽Then the sun’s disk arose, producing fragrance for the great earth. That is how it got the name “sun” .

original: sūriyoti nāmaṃ ahosi. Tasmiṃ divasaṃ ālokaṃ katvā atthaṅgate puna andhakāro ahosi.
analyzed: nāmam ahosi tasmin divasam ālokam katvā atthaṅgate puna andhakāraḥ ahosi
translated: When it had shed light for a day and then disappeared, darkness appeared again.

original: Te “bhaddakaṃ vatassa sace añño āloko uppajjeyyā”ti cintayiṃsu. Atha nesaṃ chandaṃ
analyzed: te bhaddakam vatassa sace aññaḥ ālokaḥ uppajjeyya ati cintayiṃsu atha nesam chandam
translated: They thought, “How good it would be if another light were to appear.”

original: ñatvāva candamaṇḍalaṃ uṭṭhahi. Tenevassa candoti nāmaṃ ahosi.🔽Tesu cando antomaṇivimāne vasati. Taṃ bahi rajatena parikkhittaṃ. Ubhayampi sītalameva
analyzed: ñatvā ava canda maṇḍalam uṭṭhahi tena iva assa cando ti nāmam ahosi  tesu candaḥ antar maṇi vimāne vasati tam bahi rajatena parikkhittam ubhayam pi sītalam eva
translated: Then, as soon as they had this thought, the moon appeared. That is why the moon got its name.🔽The moon dwells in the inner gem-palace. It is surrounded by silver on the outside. Both are cool.

original: ahosi. Sūriyo antokanakavimāne vasati. Taṃ bāhiraṃ phalikaparikkhittaṃ hoti. Ubhayampi uṇhameva.🔽Pamāṇato cando ujukaṃ ekūnapaññāsayojano. Parimaṇḍalato tīhi yojanehi ūnadiyaḍḍhasatayojano. Sūriyo ujukaṃ paññāsayojano, parimaṇḍalato diyaḍḍhasatayojano.🔽Cando heṭṭhā, sūriyo upari, antarā nesaṃ yojanaṃ hoti. Candassa heṭṭhimantato sūriyassa uparimantato yojanasataṃ hoti.
analyzed: sūriyaḥ antar kanaka vimāne vasati tam bāhiram phalika parikkhittam hoti ubhayam pi uṇham eva  pamāṇataḥ candaḥ ujukam ekūna paññāsa yojanaḥ parimaṇḍalataḥ tīhi yojanehi ūna diyaḍḍha sata yojanaḥ sūriyaḥ ujukam paññāsa yojanaḥ parimaṇḍalataḥ diyaḍḍha sata yojanaḥ  candaḥ heṭṭhā sūriyaḥ upari antarā nesam yojanam hoti candassa heṭṭhimantataḥ sūriyassa uparimantataḥ yojana satam hoti
translated: The sun dwells in the inner gold-palace. It is surrounded by crystal on the outside. Both are hot.🔽As for their size, the moon is 49 yojanas in diameter and 49 yojanas in circumference. The sun is 50 yojanas in diameter and 50 yojanas in circumference.🔽The moon is below the sun. The distance between them is 1 yojana. The distance from the bottom of the moon to the top of the sun is 100 yojanas.

original: Cando ujukaṃ saṇikaṃ gacchati, tiriyaṃ sīghaṃ. Dvīsu passesu nakkhattatārakā gacchanti.
analyzed: candaḥ ujukam saṇikam gacchati tiriyam sīgham dvīsu passesu nakkhatta tārakāḥ gacchanti
translated: The moon moves straight and slowly, but it moves quickly across. The stars and constellations move across the two sides.

original: Cando dhenu viya vacchaṃ taṃ taṃ nakkhattaṃ upasaṅkamati. Nakkhattāni pana attano
analyzed: candaḥ dhenu viya vaccham tam tam nakkhattam upasaṅkamati nakkhattāni pana attanaḥ
translated: The moon moves towards the different constellations like a cow towards her calf. But the constellations do not move towards the moon.

original: ṭhānaṃ na vijahanti. Sūriyassa ujukaṃ gamanaṃ sīghaṃ, tiriyaṃ gamanaṃ dandhaṃ. So
analyzed: ṭhānam na vijahanti sūriyassa ujukam gamanam sīgham tiriyam gamanam dandham so
translated: The moon approaches each constellation in turn like a cow approaching her calf. But the constellations do not leave their places. The sun’s straight course is swift, its oblique course slow.

original: kāḷapakkhauposathato pāṭipadadivase yojanānaṃ satasahassaṃ candamaṇḍalaṃ ohāya gacchati.
analyzed: kāḷapakkha uposathataḥ pāṭipada divase yojanānam sata sahassam canda maṇḍalam ohāya gacchati
translated: On the day after the Uposatha of the dark fortnight, the moon goes a hundred thousand leagues away from the moon’s disk.

original: Atha cando lekhā viya paññāyati. Pakkhassa dutiyāya satasahassanti evaṃ yāva uposathadivasā
analyzed: atha candaḥ lekhā viya paññāyati pakkhassa dutiyāya evam yāvaḥ uposatha divasā
translated: Then the moon appears like a line. On the second day of the fortnight, it goes a hundred thousand leagues. In this way, until the Uposatha day,

original: satasahassaṃ satasahassaṃ ohāya gacchati. Atha cando anukkamena vaḍḍhitvā uposathadivase
analyzed: sata sahassam sata sahassam ohāya gacchati atha candaḥ anukkamena vaḍḍhitvā uposatha divase
translated: it goes a hundred thousand leagues. Then the moon gradually increases and on the Uposatha day

original: paripuṇṇo hoti. Puna pāṭipadadivase yojanānaṃ satasahassaṃ dhāvitvā gaṇhāti. Dutiyāya
analyzed: paripuṇṇaḥ hoti puna pāṭipada divase yojanānam sata sahassam dhāvitvā gaṇhāti dutiyāya
translated: it is full. On the following day after the Uposatha, it goes a hundred thousand leagues. On the second day,

original: satasahassanti evaṃ yāva uposathadivasā satasahassaṃ satasahassaṃ dhāvitvā gaṇhāti.
analyzed: evam yāvaḥ uposatha divasā sata sahassam sata sahassam dhāvitvā gaṇhāti
translated: in this way, until the Uposatha day, it goes a hundred thousand leagues.

original: Atha cando anukkamena hāyitvā uposathadivase sabbaso na paññāyati. Candaṃ heṭṭhā
analyzed: atha candaḥ anukkamena hāyitvā uposatha divase sabbaso na paññāyati candam heṭṭhā
translated: Then the moon gradually decreases and on the Uposatha day it is not seen at all.

original: katvā sūriyo upari hoti. Mahatiyā pātiyā khuddakabhājanaṃ viya candamaṇḍalaṃ pidhīyati.🔽Majjhanhike gehacchāyā viya candassa chāyā na paññāyati. So chāyāya apaññāyamānāya
analyzed: katvā sūriyaḥ upari hoti mahatiyā pātiyā khuddaka bhājanam viya canda maṇḍalam pidhīyati  majjhanhike geha chāyā viya candassa chāyā na paññāyati so chāyāya a paññāyamānāya
translated: and the sun is above, the moon’s disk is obscured as though by a large bowl over it.🔽At midday the moon’s shadow does not appear as though it were the shadow of the house.

original: dūre ṭhitānaṃ divā padīpo viya sayampi na paññāyati.
analyzed: dūre ṭhitānam divā padīpaḥ viya sayam pi na paññāyati
translated: And when the shadow does not appear, the moon itself does not appear either, like a lamp when there is no shadow.

original: Kati nesaṃ vīthiyoti ettha pana ajavīthi, nāgavīthi, govīthīti tisso vīthiyo honti.
analyzed: kati nesam vīthiyaḥ ti ettha pana aja vīthi nāga vīthi go vīthi iti tissaḥ vīthiyaḥ honti
translated: As to “how many courses it has”: there are three courses, that is to say, the horse course, the elephant course, and the cattle course.

original: Tattha ajānaṃ udakaṃ paṭikūlaṃ hoti, hatthināgānaṃ manāpaṃ. Gunnaṃ sītuṇhasamatāya
analyzed: tattha ajānam udakam paṭikūlam hoti hatthi nāgānam manāpam gunnam sītuṇha samatāya
translated: Herein, water is uninviting to horses but inviting to elephants. It is comfortable for cattle because of its coolness and freshness.

original: phāsu hoti. Tasmā yaṃ kālaṃ candimasūriyā ajavīthiṃ āruhanti, tadā devo ekabindumpi
analyzed: tasmai yam kālam candima sūriyāḥ aja vīthim āruhanti tadā devaḥ
translated: So when the moon and sun enter the horse course, then not a drop of rain falls from the sky even.

original: na vassati. Yadā nāgavīthiṃ ārohanti, tadā bhinnaṃ viya nabhaṃ paggharati. Yadā govīthiṃ
analyzed: na vassati yadā nāga vīthim ārohanti tadā bhinnam viya nabham paggharati yadā go vīthim
translated: When they enter the elephant course, then it pours down as though the sky were cleft. When they enter the cattle course,

original: ārohanti, tadā utusamatā sampajjati. Candimasūriyā chamāse sineruto bahi nikkhamanti,
analyzed: ārohanti tadā utu sama tā sampajjati candima sūriyā cha māse sinerutaḥ bahi nikkhamanti
translated: then the weather becomes normal. The moon and sun emerge from Sineru in the six months when they move north and in the six months when they move south.

original: chamāse anto vicaranti. Te hi āsāḷhamāse sinerusamīpena vicaranti. Tato pare dve
analyzed: cha māse antar vicaranti te hi āsāḍha māse sineru samīpena vicaranti tatas pare dve
translated: They move about inside for six months. For in the month of Āsāḷhā they move about near the Himalayas. Then,

original: māse nikkhamitvā bahi vicarantā paṭhamakattikamāse majjhena gacchanti. Tato cakkavāḷābhimukhā
analyzed: māse nikkhamitvā bahi vicarantā paṭhama kattika māse majjhena gacchanti tatas cakkavāḷa abhimukhā
translated: after coming out in the following two months, they move about outside. In the first Kattikā month they go by the middle. Then,

original: gantvā tayo māse cakkavāḷasamīpena caritvā puna nikkhamitvā citramāse majjhena gantvā
analyzed: gantvā tayaḥ māse cakkavāḷa samīpena caritvā puna nikkhamitvā citra māse majjhena gantvā
translated: having gone towards the rim of the world, they move about near the rim of the world for three months. Then, after coming out again, they go by the middle in the Citta month.

original: tato dve māse sinerubhimukhā pakkhanditvā puna āsāḷhe sinerusamīpena caranti.
analyzed: tatas dve māse sineru abhimukhā pakkhanditvā punar āsāḷhe sineru samīpena caranti
translated: Then, after descending towards the Himalayas for two months, they move about near the Himalayas again in Āsāḷhā.

original: Kittake ṭhāne ālokaṃ karontīti? Ekappahārena tīsu dīpesu ālokaṃ karonti. Kathaṃ?🔽Imasmiñhi dīpe sūriyuggamanakālo pubbavidehe majjhanhiko hoti, uttarakurūsu atthaṅgamanakālo,🔽aparagoyāne majjhimayāmo. Pubbavidehamhi uggamanakālo uttarakurūsu majjhanhiko, aparagoyāne
analyzed: kittake ṭhāne ālokam karonti iti eka pahārena tīsu dīpesu ālokam karonti katham  imasmin hi dīpe sūri yuj gamana kālaḥ pubbavidehe majjhanhikaḥ hoti uttarakurūsu atthaṅgamana kālaḥ  aparagoyāne majjhima yāmaḥ pubbavidehamhi uggamana kālaḥ uttarakurūsu majjhanhikaḥ aparagoyāne
translated: In what places do they make light? They make light in the three continents at one time. How?🔽For at the time of the sun’s rising in this continent, it is midday in Pubbavideha, and sunset in Uttarakuru,🔽and midnight in Aparagoyāna. At the time of the sun’s rising in Pubbavideha, it is midday in Uttarakuru, and

original: atthaṅgamanakālo, idha majjhimayāmo. Uttarakurūsu uggamanakālo aparagoyāne majjhanhiko,
analyzed: atthaṅgamana kālaḥ idha majjhima yāmaḥ uttarakurūsu uggamana kālaḥ aparagoyāne majjhanhikaḥ
translated: sunset in Aparagoyāna, and midnight in this continent. At the time of the sun’s rising in Uttarakuru, it is midday in Aparagoyāna, and

original: idha atthaṅgamanakālo, pubbavidehe majjhimayāmo. Aparagoyānadīpe uggamanakālo idha🔽majjhanhiko, pubbavidehe atthaṅgamanakālo, uttarakurūsu majjhimayāmoti.
analyzed: idha atthaṅgamana kālo pubbavidehe majjhima yāmaḥ apara goyāna dīpe uggamana kālo idha  majjhanhikaḥ pubbavidehe atthaṅgamana kālaḥ uttarakurūsu majjhima yāmaḥ ti
translated: midday, in Pubbavideha the setting, in Uttarakuru the middle watch.

original: Nakkhattāni tārakarūpānīti kattikādinakkhattāni ceva sesatārakarūpāni ca candimasūriyehi🔽saddhiṃyeva pāturahesuṃ. Rattindivāti tato sūriyatthaṅgamanato yāva aruṇuggamanā
analyzed: nakkhattāni tāraka rūpāni iti kattikā ādi nakkhattāni ca iva sesa tāraka rūpāni ca candima sūriyehi  saddhiṃyā iva tatas sūriyatthaṅgamanataḥ yāva
translated: The constellations are the forms of the stars: the constellations beginning with Kattika and the other forms of stars came into existence together with the moon and sun.

original: ratti, aruṇuggamanato yāva sūriyatthaṅgamanā divāti evaṃ rattindivā paññāyiṃsu. Atha
analyzed: ratti aruṇuggamanataḥ yāva sūriyatthaṅgamanā divā ati evam rattindivā paññāyiṃsu atha
translated: Day and night: from the time of the sun’s setting until the time of dawn’s rising is night, and from the time of dawn’s rising until the time of the sun’s setting is day. Thus day and night were recognized.

original: pañcadasa rattiyo aḍḍhamāso, dve aḍḍhamāsā māsoti evaṃ māsaḍḍhamāsā paññāyiṃsu. Atha🔽cattāro māsā utu, tayo utū saṃvaccharoti evaṃ utusaṃvaccharā paññāyiṃsu.
analyzed: pañcadasa rattiyaḥ aḍḍha māsaḥ dve aḍḍha māsāḥ māso ti evam māsa ḍḍha māsā paññāyiṃsu atha  cattāraḥ māsāḥ utu tayo utū saṃvaccharā iti evam utu saṃvaccharā paññāyiṃsu
translated: Then fifteen nights and days make a half-month, two half-months make a month, and so the months and half-months were recognized. Then four months make a season, three seasons make a year, and so the seasons and the years were recognized.

original: 122. Vaṇṇavevaṇṇatā cāti vaṇṇassa vivaṇṇabhāvo. Tesaṃ vaṇṇātimānapaccayāti tesaṃ
analyzed: vaṇṇa vevaṇṇa tā ca ati vaṇṇassa vivaṇṇa bhāvo tesam vaṇṇa atimāna paccayā ati tesam
translated: The distinction of sex: the distinction of male and female. The distinction of virtue and evil: the distinction of what is blameless and blameworthy. The distinction of good and bad appearance: the distinction of beauty and ugliness. The distinction of happiness and suffering: the distinction of pleasure and pain. The distinction of the pleasantness and unpleasantness of visible forms, etc.: the distinction of the pleasantness and unpleasantness of visible forms, sounds, odours, tastes, and tangible objects. The distinction of the beauty and ugliness of visible forms, etc.: the distinction of the beauty and ugliness of visible forms, sounds, odours, tastes, and tangible objects. The distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the sex organs: the distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the male and female sex organs. The distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the body: the distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the body’s shape. The distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the complexion: the distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the complexion’s colour. The distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the skin: the distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the skin’s texture. The distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the hands and feet: the distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the hands and feet’s shape. The distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the fingers and toes: the distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the fingers and toes’ shape. The distinction of the beauty and ugliness of the nails: the distinction of the

original: vaṇṇaṃ ārabbha uppannaatimānapaccayā. Mānātimānajātikānanti punappunaṃ uppajjamānātimānasabhāvānaṃ.
analyzed: vaṇṇam ārabbha uppanna atimāna paccayāḥ māna atimāna jātikānam ti punappunam uppajjamāna atimāna sabhāvānam
translated: and the conceit that arose in them was due to the colour. ‘The conceit that arose in them again and again’: the conceit that arose in them again and again.

original: Rasāya pathaviyāti sampannarasattā rasāti laddhanāmāya pathaviyā. Anutthuniṃsūti
analyzed: rasāya pathaviyā ati sampanna rasa ttā rasāti laddha nāmāya pathaviyā
translated: ‘The earth that had good flavour’: the earth that had the name ‘flavour’ because of its good flavour. ‘They spoke’:

original: anubhāsiṃsu. Aho rasanti aho amhākaṃ madhurarasaṃ antarahitaṃ. Aggaññaṃ akkharanti
analyzed: anubhāsiṃsu aho rasanti aho amhākam madhura rasam antarahitam aggaññam akkharanti
translated: they said. ‘Oh, the flavour!’: ‘Oh, our sweet flavour has disappeared!’ ‘The beginning of the world’:

original: lokuppattivaṃsakathaṃ. Anusarantīti anugacchanti.
analyzed: anusaranti iti anugacchanti
translated: the story of the origin of the world. ‘They followed’: they went along with it.

original: Bhūmipappaṭakapātubhāvādivaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Appearance of the Earth-Cake

original: 123. Evameva pāturahosīti ediso hutvā uṭṭhahi, antovāpiyaṃ udake chinne sukkhakalalapaṭalaṃ viya ca uṭṭhahi.
analyzed: evam eva pātuḥ ahosi iti edisaḥ hutvā uṭṭhahi udake chinne sukkha kalala paṭalam viya ca uṭṭhahi
translated: ‘So too, it appeared’: it arose thus, it arose like a dry withered lotus leaf when the water in a lotus-tank has gone.

original: 124. Padālatāti ekā madhurarasā bhaddālatā. Kalambukāti nāḷikā. Ahu vata noti madhurarasā vata no padālatā ahosi. Ahāyi vata noti sā no etarahi antarahitāti.
analyzed: padālatā ati ekā madhura rasā bhaddālatā kalambukā ati nāḷikā ahu vata no ti madhura rasā vata no padālatā ahosi vata no ti sā no etarahi antarahitā ati
translated: ‘The creeper’: a creeper called ‘padālatā’ that had a sweet flavour. ‘Gourd’: a bottle-gourd. ‘It was indeed’: it was indeed sweet-flavoured. ‘It has disappeared’: it has disappeared and is no longer here.

original: 125. Akaṭṭhapākoti akaṭṭheyeva bhūmibhāge uppanno. Akaṇoti nikkuṇḍako. Athusoti nitthuso.
analyzed: akaṭṭha pākaḥ iti akaṭṭheya iva bhūmi bhāge uppannaḥ akaṇaḥ iti nikkuṇḍakaḥ athusaḥ ti nitthusaḥ
translated: ‘Unripe’: it arose in a place where there was no tree. ‘Unhusked’: unthreshed. ‘Unwinnowed’: unwinnowed.

original: Sugandhoti dibbagandhaṃ vāyati. Taṇḍulapphaloti suparisuddhaṃ paṇḍaraṃ taṇḍulameva
analyzed: sugandhaḥ ti dibba gandham vāyati taṇḍulapphalo ti su parisuddham paṇḍaram taṇḍulam eva
translated: Fragrant: it exudes a divine fragrance. Rice-grain: it bears rice-grains that are quite pure and white.

original: phalati. Pakkaṃ paṭivirūḷhanti sāyaṃ gahitaṭṭhānaṃ pāto pakkaṃ hoti, puna virūḷhaṃ
analyzed: phalati pakkam paṭivirūḍhanti sāyam gahita ṭṭhānam pāto pakkam hoti puna virūḍham
translated: Ripened and grown again: what is picked in the morning ripens by evening, and by the next morning it has grown again and is ready to pick.

original: paṭipākatikameva gahitaṭṭhānaṃ na paññāyati. Nāpadānaṃ paññāyatīti alāyitaṃ hutvā🔽anūnameva paññāyati.
analyzed: paṭipākatikam eva gahita ṭṭhānam na paññāyati na apadānam paññāyati iti alāyitam hutvā  anūnam eva paññāyati
translated: No sign of its having been picked: it does not show any sign of having been picked, like a withered stalk.

original: Itthipurisaliṅgādipātubhāvavaṇṇanā🔽126. Itthiyā cāti yā pubbe manussakāle itthī, tassa itthiliṅgaṃ pātubhavati, pubbe
analyzed: itthi purisa liṅga ādi pātubhāva vaṇṇanā  itthiyā ca ati yā pubbe manussa kāle itthī tassa itthi liṅgam pātubhavati pubbe
translated: The appearance of the sex organs of male and female, etc.,🔽As to “and the female sex organ in a female”: in a female who was a woman in her previous existence the female sex organ appears, and in a male who was a man in his previous existence the male sex organ appears.

original: purisassa purisaliṅgaṃ. Mātugāmo nāma hi purisattabhāvaṃ labhanto anupubbena purisattapaccaye
analyzed: purisassa purisa liṅgam mātugāmaḥ nāma hi purisa atta bhāvam labhantaḥ anupubbena purisa atta paccaye
translated: For a woman who obtains the state of a man does so only by gradually fulfilling the conditions for manhood,

original: dhamme pūretvā labhati. Puriso itthattabhāvaṃ labhanto kāmesumicchācāraṃ nissāya
analyzed: dhamme pūretvā labhati purisaḥ itthatta bhāvam labhanto kāmesum icchā ācāram nissāya
translated: while a man who obtains the state of a woman does so by means of misconduct in sensual pleasures.

original: labhati. Tadā pana pakatiyā mātugāmassa itthiliṅgaṃ, purisassa purisaliṅgaṃ pāturahosi.
analyzed: labhati tadā pana pakatiyā mātu gāmassa itthi liṅgam purisassa purisa liṅgam pāturahosi
translated: But then the female sex organ of the woman and the male sex organ of the man appear in their normal form.

original: Upanijjhāyatanti upanijjhāyantānaṃ olokentānaṃ. Pariḷāhoti rāgapariḷāho. Seṭṭhinti
analyzed: upanijjhāyatanti upanijjhāyantānam olokentānam pariḷāho ti rāga pariḷāho
translated: ‘Looking down upon’: looking down upon those who are looking down upon them. ‘Fever’: the fever of lust. ‘The master’:

original: chārikaṃ. Nibbuyhamānāyāti niyyamānāya.🔽127. Adhammasammatanti taṃ paṃsukhipanādi adhammoti sammataṃ. Tadetarahi dhammasammatanti
analyzed: chārikam nibbuyhamānāya ati niyyamānāya  adhamma sammatam ti tam paṃsu khipana ādi sammatam tat etarahi dhamma sammatam ti
translated: the charcoal. ‘As it was being carried away’: as it was being taken away.🔽‘Regarded as contrary to the Dhamma’: that was regarded as contrary to the Dhamma, as rubbish, etc. ‘Now regarded as the Dhamma’:

original: taṃ idāni dhammoti sammataṃ, dhammoti taṃ gahetvā vicaranti. Tathā hi ekaccesu jānapadesu
analyzed: tam idāni dhammoti sammatam dhammoti tam gahetvā vicaranti tathā hi ekaccesu jānapadesu
translated: now it is regarded as the Dhamma; people go about taking it as the Dhamma. For in some districts

original: kalahaṃ kurumānā itthiyo “tvaṃ kasmā kathesi? Yā gomayapiṇḍamattampi nālatthā”ti
analyzed: kalaham kurumānāḥ tvam kasmai kathesi yā gomaya piṇḍa mattam pi na alattha ati
translated: when women are quarrelling they say: ‘Why are you talking? You haven’t even got a lump of cowdung.’

original: vadanti. Pātabyatanti sevitabbataṃ. Sannidhikārakanti sannidhiṃ katvā. Apadānaṃ paññāyitthāti
analyzed: vadanti sevitabbatam sannidhi kārakam ti sannidhim katvā apadānam paññāyittha ati
translated: ‘To be practised’: to be resorted to. ‘To be stored’: to be stored up. ‘The place of origin was known’:

original: chinnaṭṭhānaṃ ūnameva hutvā paññāyittha. Saṇḍasaṇḍāti ekekasmiṃ ṭhāne kalāpabandhā
analyzed: chinna ṭṭhānam ūnam eva hutvā paññāyittha saṇḍa saṇḍā ti ekekasmim ṭhāne kalāpa bandhā
translated: the place from which it was cut was known, for it was only a little. ‘In clumps’: in some places it was in clumps,

original: viya gumbagumbā hutvā.
analyzed: viya gumba gumbā hutvā
translated: like bundles of straw.

original: 128. Mariyādaṃ ṭhapeyyāmāti sīmaṃ ṭhapeyyāma. Yatra hi nāmāti yo hi nāma. Pāṇinā pahariṃsūti tayo vāre vacanaṃ agaṇhantaṃ pāṇinā pahariṃsu. Tadagge khoti taṃ aggaṃ katvā.
analyzed: mariyādam ṭhapeyyāma ati sīmam ṭhapeyyāma yatra hi nāma ati yaḥ hi nāma pāṇinā pahariṃsu iti tayaḥ vāre vacanam a gaṇhantam pāṇinā pahariṃsu tad agge tam aggam katvā
translated: ‘We will set a limit’: we will set a boundary. ‘Where indeed’: where, indeed. ‘They would strike with the hand’: they would strike with the hand one who did not accept the word three times. ‘At the head of’: having made that the head.

original: Mahāsammatarājavaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the First King

original: 130. Khīyitabbaṃ khīyeyyāti pakāsetabbaṃ pakāseyya khipitabbaṃ khipeyya, hāretabbaṃ
analyzed: khīyitabbam khīyeyya ati pakāsetabbam pakāseyya khipitabbam khipeyya hāretabbam
translated: ‘What should be diminished should be diminished’: what should be made manifest should be made manifest, what should be removed should be removed, what should be expelled should be expelled.

original: hāreyyāti vuttaṃ hoti. Yo nesaṃ sattoti yo tesaṃ satto. Ko pana soti? Amhākaṃ bodhisatto.
analyzed: hāreyya iti vuttam hoti yaḥ nesam satto ti yaḥ tesam satto kaḥ pana saḥ ti amhākam bodhisatto
translated: ‘The being of them’: the being of them. But who was that? Our Bodhisatta.

original: Sālīnaṃ bhāgaṃ anupadassāmāti mayaṃ ekekassa khettato ambaṇambaṇaṃ āharitvā tuyhaṃ
analyzed: sālīnam bhāgam anupadassāma ati mayam ekekassa khettataḥ ambaṇambaṇam āharitvā tuyham
translated: ‘We will show a share of the rice’: we will bring a handful from each field and show you a share of the rice.

original: sālibhāgaṃ dassāma, tayā kiñci kammaṃ na kātabbaṃ, tvaṃ amhākaṃ jeṭṭhakaṭṭhāne tiṭṭhāti.
analyzed: sāli bhāgam dassāma tayā kiñci kammam na kātabbam tvam amhākam jeṭṭhaka ṭṭhāne tiṭṭhāti
translated: You will not have to do any work, you will be in the position of our eldest brother.’

original: 131. Akkharaṃ upanibbattanti saṅkhā samaññā paññatti vohāro uppanno. Khattiyo khattiyotveva
analyzed: akkharam upanibbattanti saṅkhā samaññā paññatti vohāraḥ uppannaḥ khattiyaḥ khattiyaḥ tu eva
translated: ‘The syllable was produced’: the term, the designation, the description, the conventional expression, the name ‘warrior’ arose.

original: dutiyaṃ akkharanti na kevalaṃ akkharameva, te panassa khettasāmino tīhi saṅkhehi
analyzed: dutiyam akkharanti na kevalam akkharam eva te panassa khetta sāmino tīhi saṅkhehi
translated: The second letter: not only the letter, but also the three titles of the field-owners

original: abhisekampi akaṃsu. Rañjetīti sukheti pineti. Aggaññenāti agganti ñātena, agge vā
analyzed: abhisekam pi rañjeti iti sukheti pinā iti aggaññena ati agganti ñātena agge vā
translated: they also gave him the consecration. It delights: it delights, it gladdens, it satisfies. By the most excellent knowledge: by the most excellent knowledge, or by the knowledge of the most excellent,

original: ñātena lokuppattisamaye uppannena abhinibbatti ahosīti.
analyzed: ñātena loka uppatti samaye uppannena abhinibbatti ahosi iti
translated: the birth took place at the time of the arising of the world.

original: Brāhmaṇamaṇḍalādivaṇṇanā🔽132. Vītaṅgārā vītadhūmāti pacitvā khāditabbābhāvato vigatadhūmaṅgārā. Pannamusalāti
analyzed: brāhmaṇa maṇḍala ādi vaṇṇanā  vīta aṅgārā vīta dhūmā ati pacitvā khāditabba abhāvataḥ vigata dhūma aṅgārā panna musalā ati
translated: The Description of the Circle of Brahmins, etc.🔽Without embers, without smoke: without embers and without smoke because there is nothing to cook and eat. Without pestle:

original: koṭṭetvā pacitabbābhāvato patitamusalā. Ghāsamesamānāti bhikkhācariyavasena yāgubhattaṃ
analyzed: koṭṭetvā pacitabba abhāvato patita musalā ghāsam esamānā ati bhikkhā cariya vasena yāgu bhattam
translated: without a pestle that has fallen because there is nothing to pound and cook. Seeking food: seeking rice gruel and cooked food by the practice of wandering for alms.

original: pariyesantā. Tamenaṃ manussā disvāti te ete manussā passitvā. Anabhisambhuṇamānāti
analyzed: pariyesantā tam enam manussā disvā ati te ete manussā passitvā an abhisambhuṇamānā ati
translated: The people, seeing him: those people, seeing him. Unable to bear:

original: asahamānā asakkontā. Ganthe karontāti tayo vede abhisaṅkharontā ceva vācentā ca.
analyzed: a sahamānā a sakkontā ganthe karontā ati tayaḥ vede abhisaṅkharontā ca iva vācentā ca
translated: unable, not able to bear. Making the texts: composing and reciting the three Vedas.

original: Acchantīti vasanti, “acchentī”tipi pāṭho. Esevattho. Hīnasammatanti “mante dhārenti
analyzed: acchanti iti vasanti acchenti iti pi pāṭhaḥ mante dhārenti
translated: They lived: they dwelt. The reading “acchantī” is also correct. The meaning is the same. Considered low: they kept the mantras in mind,

original: mante vācentī”ti kho, vāseṭṭha, idaṃ tena samayena hīnasammataṃ. Tadetarahi seṭṭhasammatanti
analyzed: mante iti kho vāseṭṭhaḥ idam tena samayena hīna sammatam tat etarahi seṭṭha sammatam ti
translated: ‘They are learning mantras,’ Vasettha, was then considered low, but now it is considered high.🔽Now it is considered high, ‘They are learning this much of the mantras, they are learning that much of the mantras.’

original: taṃ idāni “ettake mante dhārenti ettake mante vācentī”ti seṭṭhasammataṃ jātaṃ. Brāhmaṇamaṇḍalassāti brāhmaṇagaṇassa.
analyzed: tam idāni ettake mante dhārenti ettake mante vācenti iti seṭṭha sammatam jātam brāhmaṇa maṇḍalassa ati brāhmaṇa gaṇassa
translated: ‘To the circle of brahmins’: to the assembly of brahmins.🔽‘Having taken up sexual intercourse’: having taken up sexual activity.

original: 133. Methunaṃ dhammaṃ samādāyāti methunadhammaṃ samādiyitvā. Visukammante payojesunti gorakkha vāṇijakammādike vissute uggate kammante payojesuṃ.
analyzed: methunam dhammam samādāya ati methuna dhammam samādiyitvā visu kammante payojesunti gorakkha vāṇija kamma ādike vissute uggate kammante payojesuṃ
translated: ‘They employed them in menial tasks’: they employed them in such well-known and high-class tasks as tending cattle and trading.🔽‘The brahmins went to the sudras, the sudras to the sudras’: by that low-class work and that low-class activity, the brahmins went to the sudras, the sudras to the sudras, they went quickly, quickly, they perished. The meaning is, they were destroyed.

original: 134. Suddā suddāti tena luddācārakammakhuddācārakammunā suddaṃ suddaṃ lahuṃ lahuṃ kucchitaṃ gacchanti, vinassantīti attho. Ahu khoti hoti kho.
analyzed: suddā suddā iti tena sudda ācāra kamma khudda ācāra kammunā suddam suddam lahum lahum kucchitam gacchanti vinassanti iti attho ahu kho ti hoti kho
translated: ‘There was’: there is.

original: 135. Sakaṃ dhammaṃ garahamānoti na setacchattaṃ ussāpanamattena sujjhituṃ sakkāti
analyzed: sakam dhammam garahamānaḥ iti na seta chattam ussāpana mattena sujjhitum sakkā ati
translated: ‘Despising his own Dhamma’: ‘One is not purified by merely holding up a white parasol.’

original: evaṃ attano khattiyadhammaṃ nindamāno. Esa nayo sabbattha. “Imehi kho, vāseṭṭha,
analyzed: evam attanaḥ khattiya dhammam nindamāno esa nayaḥ sabbattha imehi kho vāseṭṭha
translated: Thus he despised his own Dhamma of the nobles. The same method applies in all cases. ‘Vasettha,

original: catūhi maṇḍalehī”ti iminā imaṃ dasseti “samaṇamaṇḍalaṃ nāma visuṃ natthi, yasmā pana
analyzed: catūhi maṇḍalehi iti iminā imam dasseti samaṇa maṇḍalam nāma visum na atthi yasmā pana
translated: “By four circles” : this shows that there is no separate “circle of ascetics” ;

original: na sakkā jātiyā sujjhituṃ, attano attano sammāpaṭipattiyā visuddhi hoti. Tasmā imehi
analyzed: na sakkā jātiyā sujjhitum attanaḥ attanaḥ sammāpaṭipattiyā hoti tasmai imehi
translated: but since it is not possible to be purified by birth, purification comes about through one’s own right practice. Therefore

original: catūhi maṇḍalehi samaṇamaṇḍalassa abhinibbatti hoti. Imāni maṇḍalāni samaṇamaṇḍalaṃ
analyzed: catūhi maṇḍalehi samaṇa maṇḍalassa abhinibbatti hoti imāni maṇḍalāni samaṇa maṇḍalam
translated: the creation of the circle of ascetics comes about by these four circles. These circles follow the circle of ascetics,

original: anuvattanti, anuvattantāni ca dhammeneva anuvattanti, no adhammena. Samaṇamaṇḍalañhi
analyzed: anuvattanti anuvattantāni ca dhammena iva anuvattanti no adhammena samaṇa maṇḍalam hi
translated: and in following it they do so only by the Dhamma, not by what is not Dhamma. For the circle of ascetics

original: āgamma sammāpaṭipattiṃ pūretvā suddhiṃ pāpuṇantī”ti.
analyzed: āgamma sammāpaṭipattim pūretvā suddhim pāpuṇanti iti
translated: comes about through the purification that comes about by fulfilling right practice.”

original: Duccaritādikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: duccarita ādi kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on misconduct, etc.

original: 136. Idāni yathājātiyā na sakkā sujjhituṃ, sammāpaṭipattiyāva sujjhanti, tamatthaṃ🔽pākaṭaṃ karonto khattiyopi kho, vāseṭṭhāti desanaṃ ārabhi. Tattha micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānahetūti
analyzed: idāni yathā jātiyā na sakkā sujjhitum sammā paṭipattiyā ava sujjhanti tam attham  pākaṭam karontaḥ khattiyaḥ api kho vāseṭṭha ati desanam ārabhi tattha micchādiṭṭhi kamma samādāna hetū ti
translated: Now, in order to make clear the fact that it is not possible to be purified by birth, but that one is purified by right practice,

original: micchādiṭṭhivasena samādinnakammahetu, micchādiṭṭhikammassa vā samādānahetu.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhi vasena samādinna kamma hetu micchādiṭṭhi kammassa vā samādāna hetu
translated: he began the teaching with the words “A Khattiya, Vasettha, when he is arisen in such a way” . Therein, the cause of undertaking wrong view and action means the cause of undertaking action by way of wrong view, or the cause of the undertaking of action that is wrong view.

original: 137. Dvayakārīti kālena kusalaṃ karoti, kālena akusalanti evaṃ ubhayakārī. Sukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī🔽hotīti ekakkhaṇe ubhayavipākadānaṭṭhānaṃ nāma natthi. Yena pana akusalaṃ bahuṃ kataṃ
analyzed: dvaya kārī iti kālena kusalam karoti kālena akusalan ti evam ubhaya kārī sukha dukkha ppaṭisaṃvedī  hoti iti eka khaṇe ubhaya vipāka dāna ṭhānam nāma natthi yena pana akusalam bahum katam
translated: “One who does both” is one who does both the wholesome and the unwholesome. “He experiences pleasure and pain”🔽means that there is no such thing as a single occasion on which both kinds of result can be experienced. But when much unwholesome action has been done,

original: hoti, kusalaṃ mandaṃ, so taṃ kusalaṃ nissāya khattiyakule vā brāhmaṇakule vā nibbattati.
analyzed: hoti kusalam mandam saḥ tam kusalam nissāya khattiya kule vā brāhmaṇa kule vā nibbattati
translated: The doer of both: one who does good at one time and bad at another. He experiences pleasure and pain: there is no such state as that in which the result of both kinds of kamma is felt simultaneously. But when much bad kamma has been done and good kamma is slight, he is reborn in a khattiya or brahmin family owing to the good kamma.

original: Atha naṃ akusalakammaṃ kāṇampi karoti khujjampi pīṭhasappimpi. So rajjassa vā anaraho
analyzed: atha nam akusala kammam kāṇam pi karoti khujjam pi pīṭhasappim pi saḥ rajjassa vā anaraho
translated: Then the bad kamma makes him one-eyed or lame or crippled. He is not fit to be a king,

original: hoti, abhisittakāle vā evaṃbhūto bhoge paribhuñjituṃ na sakkoti. Aparassa maraṇakāle
analyzed: hoti abhisitta kāle vā evaṃbhūtaḥ bhoge paribhuñjitum na sakkoti aparassa maraṇa kāle
translated: or, though he is anointed, he is unable to enjoy his wealth. When the other’s time of death arrives,

original: dve balavamallā viya te dvepi kusalākusalakammāni upaṭṭhahanti. Tesu akusalaṃ balavataraṃ
analyzed: dve balava mallā viya te dve pi kusala akusala kammāni upaṭṭhahanti tesu akusalam balavataram
translated: the two kinds of kamma, good and bad, stand before him like two strong wrestlers. The bad kamma is the stronger,

original: hoti, taṃ kusalaṃ paṭibāhitvā tiracchānayoniyaṃ nibbattāpeti. Kusalakammampi pavattivedanīyaṃ
analyzed: hoti tam kusalam paṭibāhitvā tiracchānayoniyam kusala kammam pi pavatti vedanīyam
translated: it repels the good kamma and sends him to rebirth in an animal womb. The good kamma that was ready to give its result

original: hoti. Tamenaṃ maṅgalahatthiṃ vā karonti maṅgalaassaṃ vā maṅgalausabhaṃ vā. So sampattiṃ
analyzed: hoti tam enam maṅgala hatthim vā karonti maṅgala assam vā maṅgala usabham vā saḥ sampattim
translated: He is made a lucky elephant, a lucky horse, or a lucky bull. He has good fortune

original: anubhavati. Idaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “sukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī hotī”ti.
analyzed: anubhavati idam sandhāya vuttam sukha dukkha paṭisaṃvedī hoti iti
translated: He is made a state elephant, a state bull, or a state horse. He experiences the good things of this life. It is with reference to him that it is said: “He experiences pleasure and pain” .

original: Bodhipakkhiyabhāvanāvaṇṇanā🔽138. Sattannaṃ bodhipakkhiyānanti “cattāro satipaṭṭhānā”ti ādikoṭṭhāsavasena sattannaṃ,
analyzed: bodhi pakkhiya bhāvanā vaṇṇanā  sattannam bodhi pakkhiyānam ti cattāro sati paṭṭhānā ti ādi koṭṭhāsa vasena
translated: The explanation of the development of the factors of enlightenment🔽. “The seven factors of enlightenment”: by way of the section beginning “The four foundations of mindfulness” .🔽But by way of the order of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment .

original: paṭipāṭiyā pana sattatiṃsāya bodhipakkhiyānaṃ dhammānaṃ. Bhāvanamanvāyāti bhāvanaṃ
analyzed: paṭipāṭiyā pana sattatiṃsāya bodhi pakkhiyānam dhammānam bhāvanam anvāyāti bhāvanam
translated: “Following the development”: following the development,

original: anugantvā, paṭipajjitvāti attho. Parinibbāyatīti kilesaparinibbānena parinibbāyati.
analyzed: anugantvā paṭipajjitvā ti attho parinibbāyati iti kilesa parinibbānena parinibbāyati
translated: practicing, is the meaning. “Attains final Nibbana”: he attains final Nibbana by the Nibbana element without residue of clinging left.🔽Thus the Blessed One, having shown the four colors, having turned back,

original: Iti bhagavā cattāro vaṇṇe dassetvā vinivattetvā paṭividdhacatusaccaṃ khīṇāsavameva
analyzed: iti bhagavā cattāraḥ vaṇṇe dassetvā vinivattetvā paṭividdha catu saccam khīṇāsavam eva
translated: showed the one who has penetrated the Four Noble Truths, the one whose cankers are destroyed,

original: devamanussesu seṭṭhaṃ katvā dassesi.
analyzed: deva manussesu seṭṭham katvā dassesi

translated: my Teacher is unsurpassed. In the matter of the expression of the sense bases, he is unsurpassed. In the matter of descent into the womb, he is unsurpassed.

original: ādesanāvidhāsu anuttaro, dassanasamāpattiyaṃ anuttaro, puggalapaññattiyaṃ anuttaro,🔽padhāne anuttaro, paṭipadāsu anuttaro, bhassasamācāre anuttaro, purisasīlasamācāre

translated: In the matter of the modes of teaching, he is unsurpassed. In the matter of the attainment of vision, he is unsurpassed. original: diṭṭhabuddhaguṇā. Vīsatibyāmayottena vīsatibyāmaṭṭhāne ñātaudakaṃ viya sakadāgāminā

translated: Or just as when a man were to take earth with his finger from the great earth,🔽the remaining earth would be more than that taken with the finger.🔽Or just as when a man were to point a finger at the great ocean,
