translated: They are concealed. They are concealed from any danger that might come from the eastern direction, etc.

original: taṃ nāgacchati, evaṃ pihitā hoti. Sace hi puttā vippaṭipannā, assu, mātāpitaro daharakālato🔽paṭṭhāya jagganādīhi sammā paṭipannā, ete dārakā, mātāpitūnaṃ appatirūpāti etaṃ bhayaṃ
analyzed: tam na āgacchati evam pihitā hoti sace hi puttāḥ vippaṭipannāḥ assu mātā pitaraḥ dahara kālataḥ  paṭṭhāya jaggana ādīhi sammā paṭipannāḥ ete dārakāḥ mātā pitūnam appatirūpā ati etam bhayam
translated: If the children are misbehaving, the parents, who have been looking after them properly since they were infants, may think, “These children are not worthy of us.”

original: āgaccheyya. Puttā sammā paṭipannā, mātāpitaro vippaṭipannā, mātāpitaro puttānaṃ nānurūpāti
analyzed: āgaccheyya puttā sammā paṭipannāḥ mātā pitaraḥ vippaṭipannāḥ mātā pitaraḥ puttānam na anurūpā ati
translated: This fear may arise. If the children are behaving properly and the parents are misbehaving, the parents may think, “We are not worthy of our children.”

original: etaṃ bhayaṃ āgaccheyya. Ubhosu vippaṭipannesu duvidhampi taṃ bhayaṃ hoti. Sammā paṭipannesu
analyzed: etam bhayam āgaccheyya ubhosu vippaṭipannesu duvidham pi tam bhayam hoti sammā paṭipannesu
translated: This fear may arise. If both are misbehaving, both fears arise. If both are behaving properly,

original: sabbaṃ na hoti. Tena vuttaṃ – “paṭicchannā hoti khemā appaṭibhayā”ti.🔽Evañca pana vatvā bhagavā siṅgālakaṃ etadavoca – “na kho te, gahapatiputta, pitā
analyzed: sabbam na hoti tena vuttam paṭicchannā hoti khemā appaṭibhayā ati  evam ca pana vatvā bhagavā siṅgālakam etat avoca na kho te gahapati putta pitā
translated: all this does not happen. That is why it was said: “It is concealed, safe, and free from danger.”

original: lokasammataṃ puratthimaṃ disaṃ namassāpeti. Mātāpitaro pana puratthimadisāsadise
analyzed: loka sammatam puratthimam disam namassā apeti mātā pitaro pana puratthima disa asadise
translated: After saying this, the Blessed One said to the householder’s son: “Householder’s son, your father is not worshipping the eastern direction, which is the world’s accepted way of speaking. He is taking mother and father as the eastern direction

original: katvā namassāpeti. Ayañhi te pitarā puratthimā disā akkhātā, no aññā”ti.
analyzed: katvā namassā apeti ayam hi te pitarā puratthimā disā akkhātā no aññāti
translated: and worshipping them. This is the eastern direction that has been pointed out to you by your father, not any other.”

original: 268. Uṭṭhānenāti āsanā uṭṭhānena. Antevāsikena hi ācariyaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ disvā
analyzed: uṭṭhānena ati āsanā uṭṭhānena antevāsikena hi ācariyam dūratas va āgacchantam disvā
translated: ‘By rising’: by rising from his seat. For when the pupil sees the teacher coming in the distance,

original: āsanā vuṭṭhāya paccuggamanaṃ katvā hatthato bhaṇḍakaṃ gahetvā āsanaṃ paññapetvā nisīdāpetvā
analyzed: āsanā vuṭṭhāya paccuggamanam katvā hatthataḥ bhaṇḍakam gahetvā āsanam paññapetvā nisīdāpetvā
translated: he should get up from his seat to meet him, take the things out of his hands, prepare a seat, invite him to sit down,

original: bījanapādadhovanapādamakkhanāni kātabbāni. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “uṭṭhānenā”ti. Upaṭṭhānenāti
analyzed: bījana pāda dhovana pāda makkhanāni kātabbāni tam sandhāya vuttam uṭṭhānena ati upaṭṭhānena ati
translated: and then massage his feet and bathe them. It is that which is referred to here as ‘by rising.’ ‘By service’:

original: divasassa tikkhattuṃ upaṭṭhānagamanena. Sippuggahaṇakāle pana avassakameva gantabbaṃ
analyzed: divasassa tikkhattum upaṭṭhāna gamanena sippu gahaṇa kāle pana avassakam eva gantabbam
translated: by going to him three times a day. But at the time of learning a craft he should go whenever he is needed.

original: hoti. Sussūsāyāti saddahitvā savanena. Asaddahitvā suṇanto hi visesaṃ nādhigacchati.
analyzed: hoti sussūsāya ati saddahitvā savanena a saddahitvā suṇantaḥ hi visesam na adhigacchati
translated: ‘By listening’: by listening with confidence. For one who listens without confidence does not make progress.

original: Pāricariyāyāti avasesakhuddakapāricariyāya. Antevāsikena hi ācariyassa pātova vuṭṭhāya
analyzed: pāricariyāya ati avasesa khuddaka pāricariyāya antevāsikena hi ācariyassa pātova vuṭṭhāya
translated: ‘By attendance’: by attendance on the minor duties. For the pupil should get up early in the morning

original: mukhodakadantakaṭṭhaṃ datvā bhattakiccakālepi pānīyaṃ gahetvā paccupaṭṭhānādīni katvā
analyzed: mukha udaka danta kaṭṭham da tvā bhatta kicca kāle pi pānīyam gahetvā paccupaṭṭhāna ādīni katvā
translated: and give his teacher tooth-sticks and water for rinsing the mouth. At mealtimes he should take a low seat and serve the food respectfully.

original: vanditvā gantabbaṃ. Kiliṭṭhavatthādīni dhovitabbāni, sāyaṃ nahānodakaṃ paccupaṭṭhapetabbaṃ.
analyzed: vanditvā gantabbam kiliṭṭha vattha ādīni dhovitabbāni sāyam nahāna udakam paccupaṭṭhapetabbam
translated: and he should go after paying homage to him. If his robes are soiled, he should wash them. He should set out water for washing the feet in the evening.

original: Aphāsukāle upaṭṭhātabbaṃ. Pabbajitenapi sabbaṃ antevāsikavattaṃ kātabbaṃ. Idaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: a phāsu kāle upaṭṭhātabbam pabbajitena api sabbam antevāsika vattam kātabbam idam sandhāya
translated: He should attend on him when he is indisposed. And the pupil should do all the duties to his teacher. It is with reference to this that it was said: “In the service” .

original: vuttaṃ – “pāricariyāyā”ti. Sakkaccaṃ sippapaṭiggahaṇenāti sakkaccaṃ paṭiggahaṇaṃ🔽nāma thokaṃ gahetvā bahuvāre sajjhāyakaraṇaṃ, ekapadampi visuddhameva gahetabbaṃ.🔽Suvinītaṃ vinentīti “evaṃ te nisīditabbaṃ, evaṃ ṭhātabbaṃ, evaṃ khāditabbaṃ, evaṃ
analyzed: vuttam pāricariyāya ati sakkaccam sippa paṭiggahaṇena ati sakkaccam paṭiggahaṇam  nāma thokam gahetvā bahu vāre sajjhāya karaṇam eka padam pi visuddham eva gahetabbam  su vinītam vinenti iti evam te nisīditabbam evam ṭhātabbam evam khāditabbam evam
translated: In the learning of the craft: the learning of the craft is the taking up of it.🔽He should take it up after learning it well.

original: bhuñjitabbaṃ, pāpamittā vajjetabbā, kalyāṇamittā sevitabbā”ti evaṃ ācāraṃ sikkhāpenti
analyzed: bhuñjitabbam pāpa mittā vajjetabbā kalyāṇa mittā sevitabbā ati evam ācāram sikkhāpenti
translated: In the training of the well-trained: they train them and teach them the conduct in this way: “You should sit thus, you should stand thus, you should eat thus, you should drink thus, you should avoid bad friends, you should cultivate good friends.”

original: vinenti. Suggahitaṃ gāhāpentīti yathā suggahitaṃ gaṇhāti, evaṃ atthañca byañjanañca
analyzed: vinenti suggahitam gāhāpenti iti yathā suggahitam gaṇhāti evam attham ca byañjanam ca
translated: In the taking up of what is well taken up: they teach them the meaning and the phrasing after they have purified even a single sentence and have them take it up in such a way that they take it up well.

original: sodhetvā payogaṃ dassetvā gaṇhāpenti. Mittāmaccesu paṭiyādentīti “ayaṃ amhākaṃ antevāsiko
analyzed: sodhetvā payogam dassetvā gaṇhāpenti mitta amaccesu paṭiyādenti iti ayam amhākam antevāsikaḥ
translated: In the making of friends and acquaintances: “This is our pupil.

original: byatto bahussuto mayā samasamo, etaṃ sallakkheyyāthā”ti evaṃ guṇaṃ kathetvā mittāmaccesu patiṭṭhapenti.🔽Disāsu parittāṇaṃ karontīti sippasikkhāpanenevassa sabbadisāsu rakkhaṃ karonti. Uggahitasippo
analyzed: byattaḥ bahu sutaḥ mayā samasamaḥ etam sallakkheyyātha ati evam guṇam kathetvā mitta amaccesu patiṭṭhapenti  disāsu parittāṇam karonti iti sippa sikkhāpanena iva assa sabba disāsu rakkham karonti uggahita sippo
translated: “He is my equal in virtue, learning, and knowledge,” and so they establish him among their friends and companions.

original: hi yaṃ yaṃ disaṃ gantvā sippaṃ dasseti, tattha tatthassa lābhasakkāro uppajjati.
analyzed: hi yam yam disam gantvā sippam dasseti tattha tatthassa lābha sakkāro uppajjati
translated: They make him a protection in all directions: by teaching him a craft they make him a protection in all directions. For when a man has been taught a craft and goes to any country and displays his skill, he gets wealth and honour there.

original: So ācariyena kato nāma hoti, guṇaṃ kathentopissa mahājano ācariyapāde dhovitvā vasitaantevāsiko
analyzed: saḥ ācariyena kataḥ nāma hoti guṇam kathentaḥ api sa mahā janaḥ ācariya pāde dhovitvā vasita antevāsikaḥ
translated: And when he speaks in praise of his teacher, saying, “He is the one who taught me,” the people wash their teacher’s feet, make him sit down on the chief seat, and worship him.

original: vata ayanti paṭhamaṃ ācariyasseva guṇaṃ kathenti, brahmalokappamāṇopissa lābho uppajjamāno🔽ācariyasantakova hoti. Apica yaṃ vijjaṃ parijappitvā gacchantaṃ aṭaviyaṃ corā na
analyzed: vata ayanti paṭhamam ācariyassa iva guṇam kathenti brahma loka ppamāṇaḥ api sa lābhaḥ uppajjamānaḥ  ācariya santakaḥ uva hoti apica yam vijjam parijappitvā gacchantam aṭaviyam corāḥ na
translated: And when the wealth and honour he receives extends even to the Brahma-world, it is his teacher who receives it.

original: passanti, amanussā vā dīghajātiādayo vā na viheṭhenti, taṃ sikkhāpentāpi disāsu parittāṇaṃ
analyzed: passanti amanussāḥ vā dīgha jāti ādayaḥ vā na viheṭhenti tam sikkhāpentā api disāsu parittāṇam
translated: Besides, when a man goes away after learning a spell, if he is not seen by thieves or non-human beings or by the long-nosed goblins, etc., then those who taught him the spell are also a protection in all directions.

original: karonti. Yaṃ vā so disaṃ gato hoti, tato kaṅkhaṃ uppādetvā attano santikaṃ āgatamanusse🔽“etissaṃ disāyaṃ amhākaṃ antevāsiko vasati, tassa ca mayhañca imasmiṃ sippe nānākaraṇaṃ
analyzed: karonti yam vā saḥ disam gataḥ hoti tatas kaṅkham uppādetvā attanaḥ santikam āgata manusse  etissam disāyam amhākam antevāsikaḥ vasati tassa ca mayham ca imasmin sippe nānākaraṇam
translated: Or else, when someone comes to him from the direction in which his pupil has gone, and he arouses his doubts,

original: natthi, gacchatha tameva pucchathā”ti evaṃ antevāsikaṃ paggaṇhantāpi tassa tattha🔽lābhasakkāruppattiyā parittāṇaṃ karonti nāma, patiṭṭhaṃ karontīti attho. Sesamettha
analyzed: natthi gacchatha tam eva pucchatha ati evam antevāsikam paggaṇhantā api tassa tattha  lābha sakkāra uppattiyā parittāṇam karonti nāma patiṭṭham karonti iti attho sesam ettha
translated: saying, “So and so, our pupil, lives in such and such a place in such and such a direction. There is no difference between him and me in the art.

original: purimanayeneva yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: purima nayena iva yojetabbam
translated: Go and ask him,” he is “making a shelter” for his pupil’s gain and honour there, that is, he is “making a support” for him. The rest should be construed in the same way as above.

original: 269. Tatiyadisāvāre sammānanāyāti devamāte tissamāteti evaṃ sambhāvitakathākathanena.
analyzed: tatiya disā vāre sammānanāya ati devamāte tissa māte iti evam sambhāvita kathā kathanena
translated: . In the third direction, by honouring: by talking respectfully, saying, “Madam, Madam so and so” .

original: Anavamānanāyāti yathā dāsakammakarādayo pothetvā viheṭhetvā kathenti, evaṃ hīḷetvā🔽vimānetvā akathanena. Anaticariyāyāti taṃ atikkamitvā bahi aññāya itthiyā saddhiṃ
analyzed: an avamānanāya ati yathā dāsa kammakara ādayaḥ pothetvā viheṭhetvā kathenti evam hīḷetvā  vimānetvā a kathanena an aticariyāya ati tam atikkamitvā bahi aññāya itthiyā saddhiṃ
translated: By not despising: by not talking to her contemptuously and haughtily as servants and workpeople are spoken to.

original: paricaranto taṃ aticarati nāma, tathā akaraṇena. Issariyavossaggenāti itthiyo hi
analyzed: paricarantaḥ tam aticarati nāma tathā a karaṇena issariya vossaggena ati itthiyaḥ hi
translated: By not transgressing: he “transgresses” when he goes beyond her and misconducts himself with another woman outside; by not doing that. By relinquishing lordship: for women

original: mahālatāsadisampi ābharaṇaṃ labhitvā bhattaṃ vicāretuṃ alabhamānā kujjhanti, kaṭacchuṃ
analyzed: mahā latā sadisam pi ābharaṇam labhitvā bhattam vicāretum a labhamānā kujjhanti kaṭacchum
translated: Even when they get jewelry worth a hundred thousand, they get angry if they are not given the choice of food.

original: hatthe ṭhapetvā tava ruciyā karohīti bhattagehe vissaṭṭhe sabbaṃ issariyaṃ vissaṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: hatthe ṭhapetvā tava ruciyā karohi iti bhatta gehe vissaṭṭhe sabbam issariyam vissaṭṭham
translated: When the kitchen is in confusion, with the ladle in hand, saying, “Do it as you like,” all authority is in confusion.

original: nāma hoti, evaṃ karaṇenāti attho. Alaṅkārānuppadānenāti attano vibhavānurūpena alaṅkāradānena.
analyzed: nāma hoti evam karaṇena ati atthaḥ alaṅkāra an uppadānena ati attanaḥ vibhava anurūpena alaṅkāra dānena
translated: This is the meaning. By not withholding ornaments: by giving ornaments in accordance with her husband’s means.

original: Susaṃvihitakammantāti yāgubhattapacanakālādīni anatikkamitvā tassa tassa sādhukaṃ🔽karaṇena suṭṭhu saṃvihitakammantā. Saṅgahitaparijanāti sammānanādīhi ceva paheṇakapesanādīhi🔽ca saṅgahitaparijanā. Idha parijano nāma sāmikassa ceva attano ca ñātijano. Anaticārinīti
analyzed: su saṃvihita kammantā ti yāgu bhatta pacana kāla ādīni an atikkamitvā tassa tassa sādhukam  karaṇena suṭṭhu saṃvihita kammantā saṅgahita parijanā ati sammānana ādīhi ca iva paheṇaka pesanā ādīhi  ca saṅgahita parijanā idha parijanaḥ nāma sāmikassa ca iva attano ca ñāti janaḥ anaticārinī ti
translated: Well-ordered work: by doing well whatever has to be done, not missing the time for preparing rice-gruel, meals, etc.🔽Well-ordered retinue: by keeping her retinue together by means of respect, etc., and by not allowing it to be dispersed by others. Here the “retinue” is the husband’s and her own relatives. Not straying: not even thinking of another man, let alone actually straying.

original: sāmikaṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ manasāpi na pattheti. Sambhatanti kasivāṇijjādīni katvā ābhatadhanaṃ.
analyzed: sāmikam muñcitvā aññam manasā api na pattheti sambhatanti kasi vāṇijja ādīni katvā ābhata dhanam
translated: Wealth: money earned by agriculture, trade, etc.

original: Dakkhā ca hotīti yāgubhattasampādanādīsu chekā nipuṇā hoti. Analasāti nikkosajjā.
analyzed: dakkhā ca hoti iti yāgu bhatta sampādana ādīsu chekā nipuṇā hoti analasā ati nikkosajjā
translated: She is clever: she is skilled, adept, in preparing rice gruel and rice and curry, etc. She is not lazy: she is not idle.

original: Yathā aññā kusītā nisinnaṭṭhāne nisinnāva honti ṭhitaṭṭhāne ṭhitāva, evaṃ ahutvā
analyzed: yathā aññā kusītā nisinna ṭhāne nisinnā ava honti ṭhita ṭhāne ṭhitāva evam a hutvā
translated: Unlike others who are lazy and sit down in a sitting place and lie down in a lying place,

original: vipphāritena cittena sabbakiccāni nipphādeti. Sesamidhāpi purimanayeneva yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: vipphāritena cittena sabba kiccāni nipphādeti sesam idha api purima nayena iva yojetabbam
translated: she does all her work with a mind that is active. The rest should be understood in the same way as above.

original: 270. Catutthadisāvāre avisaṃvādanatāyāti yassa yassa nāmaṃ gaṇhāti, taṃ taṃ avisaṃvādetvā
analyzed: catuttha disā avāre a visaṃvādana tāya ati yassa yassa nāmam gaṇhāti tam tam a visaṃvādetvā
translated: In the fourth direction, by not deceiving: by giving, not deceiving anyone whose name she hears,

original: idampi amhākaṃ gehe atthi, idampi atthi, gahetvā gacchāhīti evaṃ avisaṃvādetvā dānena.🔽Aparapajā cassa paṭipūjentīti sahāyassa puttadhītaro pajā nāma, tesaṃ pana puttadhītaro
analyzed: idam pi amhākam gehe atthi idam pi atthi gahetvā gacchāhi iti evam a visaṃvādetvā dānena  aparapajā cassa paṭipūjenti iti sahāyassa putta dhītaro pajā nāma tesam pana putta dhītaro
translated: saying, “We have this in our house, we have that. Take it and go.”🔽Her children and their children honor her: her children and their children are called her “offspring.”

original: ca nattupanattakā ca aparapajā nāma. Te paṭipūjenti keḷāyanti mamāyanti maṅgalakālādīsu
analyzed: ca nattupanattakā ca aparapajāḥ nāma te paṭipūjenti keḷāyanti mamāyanti maṅgala kāla ādīsu
translated: The children and children’s children of her children and their children are called her “offspring’s offspring.” They honor her, play with her, love her, and🔽perform auspicious rites for her at the proper times.

original: tesaṃ maṅgalādīni karonti. Sesamidhāpi purimanayeneva veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: tesam maṅgala ādīni karonti sesam idha api purima nayena iva veditabbam
translated: The rest should be understood in the same way as above.

original: 271. Yathābalaṃ kammantasaṃvidhānenāti daharehi kātabbaṃ mahallakehi, mahallakehi🔽vā kātabbaṃ daharehi, itthīhi kātabbaṃ purisehi, purisehi vā kātabbaṃ itthīhi akāretvā
analyzed: yathābalam kammanta saṃvidhānena ati daharehi kātabbam mahallakehi mahallakehi  vā kātabbam daharehi itthīhi kātabbam purisehi purisehi vā kātabbam itthīhi a kāretvā
translated: 271.By assigning work according to strength: by assigning work to the young that is suitable for the young to do, and to the old that is suitable for the old to do,🔽and by assigning work to women that is suitable for women to do, and to men that is suitable for men to do, without making them do what is unsuitable.

original: tassa tassa balānurūpeneva kammantasaṃvidhānena. Bhattavetanānuppadānenāti ayaṃ khuddakaputto,
analyzed: tassa tassa bala anurūpena iva kammanta saṃvidhānena bhatta vetanā an uppadānena ati ayam khuddaka putto
translated: By providing food and wages: by giving food and wages in accordance with what each one has done, considering that this one is a small child,

original: ayaṃ ekavihārīti tassa tassa anurūpaṃ sallakkhetvā bhattadānena ceva paribbayadānena
analyzed: ayam eka vihārī iti tassa tassa anurūpam sallakkhetvā bhatta dānena ca iva paribbaya dānena
translated: this one is a single man, and so on.

original: ca. Gilānupaṭṭhānenāti aphāsukakāle kammaṃ akāretvā sappāyabhesajjādīni datvā paṭijagganena.
analyzed: ca gilāna upaṭṭhānena ati a phāsuka kāle kammam a kāretvā sappāya bhesajja ādīni da tvā paṭijagganena
translated: By tending the sick: by not making the sick work and by giving them suitable medicines, etc., and by looking after them.

original: Acchariyānaṃ rasānaṃ saṃvibhāgenāti acchariye madhurarase labhitvā sayameva akhāditvā
analyzed: acchariyānam rasānam saṃvibhāgena ati acchariye madhura rase labhitvā sayam eva a khāditvā
translated: By sharing extraordinary delicacies: by sharing with them any extraordinary delicacies that are obtained, not eating them oneself but🔽giving them to the others.

original: tesampi tato saṃvibhāgakaraṇena. Samaye vossaggenāti niccasamaye ca kālasamaye ca
analyzed: tesam pi tatas saṃvibhāga karaṇena samaye vossaggena ati nicca samaye ca kāla samaye ca
translated: By giving at the proper time: by giving them food and wages at the proper time and at the proper occasion.

original: vossajjanena. Niccasamaye vossajjanaṃ nāma sakaladivasaṃ kammaṃ karontā kilamanti.
analyzed: vossajjanena nicca samaye vossajjanam nāma sakala divasam kammam karontā kilamanti
translated: By giving at the proper time: they get tired doing work all day long.

original: Tasmā yathā na kilamanti, evaṃ velaṃ ñatvā vissajjanaṃ. Kālasamaye vossaggo nāma🔽chaṇanakkhattakīḷādīsu alaṅkārabhaṇḍakhādanīyabhojanīyādīni datvā vissajjanaṃ. Dinnādāyinoti
analyzed: tasmai yathā na kilamanti evam velam ñatvā vissajjanam kāla samaye vossaggaḥ nāma  chaṇa nakkhatta kīḷa ādīsu alaṅkāra bhaṇḍa khādanīya bhojanīya ādīni da tvā vissajjanam dinna ādāyino ti
translated: So he should know the time for letting them out so that they do not get tired.🔽Giving them leave at the proper time:🔽after giving them ornaments, requisites, food, etc., at the time of the moon’s setting, the moon’s entering the constellation, the playing of musical instruments, etc., he should give them leave.

original: corikāya kiñci agahetvā sāmikehi dinnasseva ādāyino. Sukatakammakarāti “kiṃ etassa🔽kammena katena, na mayaṃ kiñci labhāmā”ti anujjhāyitvā tuṭṭhahadayā yathā taṃ kammaṃ
analyzed: corikāya kiñci a gahetvā sāmikehi dinnassa iva ādāyinaḥ kim etassa  kammena katena na mayam kiñci labhāma ati an ujjhāyitvā tuṭṭha hadayāḥ yathā tam kammaṃ
translated: Receivers of what is given:🔽they take only what is given by their masters, not by theft.

original: sukataṃ hoti, evaṃ kārakā. Kittivaṇṇaharāti parisamajjhe kathāya sampattāya “ko amhākaṃ🔽sāmikehi sadiso atthi, mayaṃ attano dāsabhāvampi na jānāma, tesaṃ sāmikabhāvampi
analyzed: su katam hoti evam kārakā kitti vaṇṇa harāti parisamajjhe kathāya sampattāya kaḥ amhākam  sāmikehi sadisaḥ atthi mayam attanaḥ dāsa bhāvam pi na jānāma tesam sāmika bhāvam pi
translated: Well-performed workers: they are satisfied in their hearts, thinking, “What is the use of this work that we are doing? We get nothing from it,” and they do the work well, thinking, “Let it be well done.”

original: na jānāma, evaṃ no anukampantī”ti guṇakathāhārakā. Sesamidhāpi purimanayeneva yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: na jānāmaḥ evam naḥ anukampanti iti guṇa kathā hārakā sesam idha api purima nayena iva yojetabbam
translated: Reporters of what is well done: when a discussion arises in the midst of an assembly, they are the first to say, “Who is there equal to our masters? We do not even know that we are slaves; we do not know that they are masters; they are so kind to us.”🔽The rest should be construed in the same way as above.

original: 272. Mettena kāyakammenātiādīsu mettacittaṃ paccupaṭṭhapetvā katāni kāyakammādīni
analyzed: mettena kāya kammena ati ādīsu metta cittam paccupaṭṭhapetvā katāni kāya kamma ādīni
translated: With kindly bodily action, etc.: having established a mind of loving-kindness, he performs bodily actions, etc.

original: mettāni nāma vuccanti. Tattha bhikkhū nimantessāmīti vihāragamanaṃ, dhamakaraṇaṃ
analyzed: mettāni nāma vuccanti tattha bhikkhū nimantessāmi iti vihāra gamanam dhama karaṇam
translated: are called ‘friendly’. Herein, going to the monastery, making the robe,🔽

original: gahetvā udakaparissāvanaṃ, piṭṭhiparikammapādaparikammādikaraṇañca mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ🔽nāma. Bhikkhū piṇḍāya paviṭṭhe disvā “sakkaccaṃ yāguṃ detha, bhattaṃ dethā”tiādivacanañceva,
analyzed: gahetvā udaka parissāvanam piṭṭhi parikamma pāda parikamma ādi karaṇam ca mettam kāya kammam  nāma bhikkhū piṇḍāya paviṭṭhe disvā sakkaccam yāgum detha bhattam detha ati ādi vacanam ca iva
translated: “Friendly” means “kind”. Herein, the going to the monastery to invite bhikkhus is a kind of bodily action. So too, taking a fan and a water-sprinkler, and doing such services as massaging the back and washing the feet.

original: sādhukāraṃ datvā dhammasavanañca sakkaccaṃ paṭisanthārakaraṇādīni ca mettaṃ vacīkammaṃ
analyzed: sādhukāram da tvā dhamma savanam ca sakkaccam paṭisanthāra karaṇa ādīni ca mettam vacī kammam
translated: The speech of one who, on seeing bhikkhus enter the village for alms, says, “Give rice gruel carefully. Give rice carefully,” and so on, and the giving of applause and listening to the Dhamma, and the doing of services carefully, are a kind of verbal action.

original: nāma. “Amhākaṃ kulūpakattherā averā hontu abyāpajjā”ti evaṃ cintanaṃ mettaṃ manokammaṃ🔽nāma. Anāvaṭadvāratāyāti apihitadvāratāya. Tattha sabbadvārāni vivaritvāpi sīlavantānaṃ🔽adāyako akārako pihitadvāroyeva. Sabbadvārāni pana pidahitvāpi tesaṃ dāyako kārako
analyzed: nāma amhākam kulūpaka ttherāḥ averāḥ hontu a byāpajjāti evam cintanam mettam manaḥ kammaṃ  nāma an āvaṭa dvāra tāya ati apihita dvāra tāya sabba dvārāni sīlavantānam  a dāyakaḥ a kārakaḥ sabba dvārāni pana pidahitvā api tesam dāyakaḥ kārako
translated: The thinking thus, “May the elder who is our supporter be free from enmity and affliction,” is a kind of mental action.

original: vivaṭadvāroyeva. Iti sīlavantesu gehadvāraṃ āgatesu santaṃyeva natthīti avatvā dātabbaṃ.
analyzed: iti sīlavantesu geha dvāram āgatesu santam yeva natthi iti avatvā dātabbam
translated: “Not keeping the door closed”: not keeping the door closed to virtuous bhikkhus. Herein, one who, though he has opened all his doors, does not give to virtuous bhikkhus and does not render services to them, is one who keeps the door closed. But one who, though he has closed all his doors, gives to them and renders services to them, is one who keeps the door open. So when virtuous bhikkhus come to his door, he should give to them without saying, “There is nothing.”

original: Evaṃ anāvaṭadvāratā nāma hoti.
analyzed: evam an āvaṭa dvāra tā nāma hoti
translated: This is called “not turning back the door.”🔽“By providing material support”: material support is what should be used before the meal.

original: Āmisānuppadānenāti purebhattaṃ paribhuñjitabbakaṃ āmisaṃ nāma, tasmā sīlavantānaṃ
analyzed: āmisa an uppadānena ati purebhattam paribhuñjitabbakam āmisam nāma tasmai sīlavantānam
translated: Therefore the meaning is “by providing the excellence of rice gruel and meals.”

original: yāgubhattasampadānenāti attho. Kalyāṇena manasā anukampantīti “sabbe sattā sukhitā
analyzed: yāgu bhatta sampadānena ati attho kalyāṇena manasā anukampanti iti sabbe sattā sukhitā
translated: “With a good mind, they sympathize”: in this way, they sympathize with the thought of benefit: “May all beings be happy,

original: hontu averā arogā abyāpajjā”ti evaṃ hitapharaṇena. Apica upaṭṭhākānaṃ gehaṃ aññe
analyzed: hontu averāḥ arogāḥ a byāpajjāti evam hita pharaṇena apica upaṭṭhākānam geham aññe
translated: free from enmity, free from affliction, and free from danger.”

original: sīlavante sabrahmacārī gahetvā pavisantāpi kalyāṇena cetasā anukampanti nāma. Sutaṃ
analyzed: sīlavante sabrahmacārī gahetvā pavisantā api kalyāṇena cetasā anukampanti nāma sutam
translated: Moreover, when they enter the house of their attendants, taking with them other virtuous companions in the holy life, they are said to sympathize with a good mind.

original: pariyodāpentīti yaṃ tesaṃ pakatiyā sutaṃ atthi, tassa atthaṃ kathetvā kaṅkhaṃ vinodenti,
analyzed: pariyodāpenti iti yam tesam pakatiyā sutam atthi tassa attham kathetvā kaṅkham vinodenti
translated: “They purify what is heard”: they explain the meaning of what they have heard by nature, and they remove their doubts,

original: tathattāya vā paṭipajjāpenti. Sesamidhāpi purimanayeneva yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: tathattāya vā paṭipajjāpenti sesam idha api purima nayena iva yojetabbam
translated: or they cause them to practice in accordance with that. The rest should be combined here in the same way as before.

original: 273. Alamattoti puttadārabharaṇaṃ katvā agāraṃ ajjhāvasanasamattho. Paṇḍitoti disānamassanaṭṭhāne
analyzed: alam atto ti putta dāra bharaṇam katvā agāram ajjhāvasana samattho paṇḍito ti disānam assana ṭhāne
translated: “He is able”: he is able to live in a house, having taken a wife and children. “He is wise”: he is in the position of being able to look in all directions.

original: paṇḍito hutvā. Saṇhoti sukhumatthadassanena saṇhavācābhaṇanena vā saṇho hutvā. Paṭibhānavāti🔽disānamassanaṭṭhāne paṭibhānavā hutvā nivātavuttīti nīcavutti. Atthaddhoti thambharahito.
analyzed: paṇḍitaḥ hutvā saṇhaḥ iti sukhuma attha dassanena saṇha vācā bhaṇanena vā saṇhaḥ hutvā paṭibhāna vāti  disānamassanaṭṭhāne paṭibhānavā hutvā nivāta vuttī iti nīca vutti atthaddho ti thambha rahitaḥ
translated: and wise. Gentle: gentle either through seeing the meaning of gentleness or through speaking gently. Eloquent:🔽eloquent in the place of the fanning of the directions. Of lowly life: of lowly conduct. Unassuming: free from haughtiness.

original: Uṭṭhānakoti uṭṭhānavīriyasampanno. Analasoti nikkosajjo. Acchinnavuttīti nirantarakaraṇavasena
analyzed: uṭṭhānako ti uṭṭhāna vīriya sampanno analasaḥ ati nikkosajjaḥ acchinna vuttī iti nirantara karaṇa vasena
translated: Industrious: endowed with the energy of rising up. Not lazy: not one who is ready to lie down. Of unbroken conduct:

original: akhaṇḍavutti. Medhāvīti ṭhānuppattiyā paññāya samannāgato.
analyzed: akhaṇḍa vutti medhāvī iti ṭhānuppattiyā paññāya samannāgataḥ
translated: of unbroken conduct through uninterrupted performance. Intelligent: endowed with the understanding that is the arising of opportunity.

original: Saṅgāhakoti catūhi saṅgahavatthūhi saṅgahakaro. Mittakaroti mittagavesano. Vadaññūti
analyzed: saṅgāhako ti catūhi saṅgaha vatthūhi saṅgaha karaḥ mitta karaḥ ti mitta gavesanaḥ vadaññu iti
translated: A gatherer: a gatherer through the four bases of gathering. A maker of friends: a seeker of friends. A giver:

original: pubbakārinā, vuttavacanaṃ jānāti. Sahāyakassa gharaṃ gatakāle “mayhaṃ sahāyakassa
analyzed: pubbakārinā vutta vacanam jānāti sahāyakassa gharam gata kāle mayham sahāyakassa
translated: one who acts first, who knows the words that have been spoken. When a friend has come to his house, he remembers the words

original: veṭhanaṃ detha, sāṭakaṃ detha, manussānaṃ bhattavetanaṃ dethā”ti vuttavacanamanussaranto
analyzed: veṭhanam detha sāṭakam detha manussānam bhatta vetanam detha iti vutta vacanam anussarantaḥ
translated: “Give a turban to my friend, give a cloth, give wages to the men,” and

original: tassa attano gehaṃ āgatassa tattakaṃ vā tato atirekaṃ vā paṭikattāti attho. Apica
analyzed: tassa attanaḥ geham āgatassa tattakam vā tatas atirekam vā paṭikattā ati atthaḥ apica
translated: he gives to that friend who has come to his house as much as he said or more than that. The meaning is: he makes good. Moreover,

original: sahāyakassa gharaṃ gantvā imaṃ nāma gaṇhissāmīti āgataṃ sahāyakaṃ lajjāya gaṇhituṃ
analyzed: sahāyakassa gharam gantvā imam nāma gaṇhissāmi iti āgatam sahāyakam lajjāya gaṇhitum
translated: Having gone to a friend’s house, he may think, “I will take this,” and having gone there with the intention of taking it, he may be unable to take it through shame before his friend.

original: asakkontaṃ anicchāritampi tassa vācaṃ ñatvā yena atthena so āgato, taṃ nipphādento
analyzed: a sakkontam an icchāritam pi tassa vācam ñatvā yena atthena saḥ āgataḥ tam nipphādento
translated: Understanding his friend’s unwilling speech, he may accomplish the purpose for which he went there.

original: vadaññū nāma. Yena yena vā pana sahāyakassa ūnaṃ hoti, oloketvā taṃ taṃ dentopi vadaññūyeva.
analyzed: vadaññū nāma yena yena vā pana sahāyakassa ūnam hoti oloketvā tam tam dentaḥ api vadaññūya iva
translated: He is a giver because he gives whatever is lacking to his friend, having seen it.

original: Netāti taṃ taṃ atthaṃ dassento paññāya netā. Vividhāni kāraṇāni dassento netīti vinetā.
analyzed: netā iti tam tam attham dassento paññāya netā vividhāni kāraṇāni dassentaḥ neti iti vinetā
translated: He is a leader because he shows the various meanings with his wisdom. He is a guide because he shows the various reasons.

original: Punappunaṃ netīti anunetā.
analyzed: punar punar neti iti anunetā
translated: He is a re-leader because he leads again and again.

original: Tattha tatthāti tasmiṃ tasmiṃ puggale. Rathassāṇīva yāyatoti yathā āṇiyā satiyeva
analyzed: tattha tattha ati tasmin tasmin puggale yathā āṇiyā satiyā iva
translated: Here and there means in this and that person. As a chariot goes with its axle means just as a chariot goes

original: ratho yāti, asati na yāti, evaṃ imesu saṅgahesu satiyeva loko vattati, asati na vattati.
analyzed: rathaḥ yāti asati na yāti evam imesu saṅgahesu satiyā iva lokaḥ vattati asati na vattati
translated: only when it has an axle, not when it does not have one, so the world goes only when it has these four kinds of social intercourse, not when it does not have them.

original: Tena vuttaṃ – “ete kho saṅgahā loke, rathassāṇīva yāyato”ti.
analyzed: tena vuttam ete kho saṅgahāḥ loke rathassāṇi iva yāyato ti
translated: Therefore it was said: “These are the social intercourse in the world, as a chariot goes with its axle.”

original: Na mātā puttakāraṇāti yadi mātā ete saṅgahe puttassa na kareyya, puttakāraṇā mānaṃ vā pūjaṃ vā na labheyya.
analyzed: na mātā putta kāraṇā ti yadi mātā ete saṅgahe puttassa na kareyya putta kāraṇā mānam vā pūjam vā na labheyya
translated: If a mother does not do these things for the sake of her child, she will not get respect or honour for the sake of her child.🔽“These are the things that are done for the sake of a child” is a statement of the benefits. The reading “Saṅgahe ete” is in the locative case.

original: Saṅgahā eteti upayogavacane paccattaṃ. “Saṅgahe ete”ti vā pāṭho. Sammapekkhantīti sammā pekkhanti. Pāsaṃsā ca bhavantīti pasaṃsanīyā ca bhavanti.🔽274. Iti bhagavā yā disā sandhāya te gahapatiputta pitā āha “disā namasseyyāsī”ti,
analyzed: saṅgahāḥ ete iti upayogavacane paccattam saṅgahe ete iti vā pāṭhaḥ sammā pekkhanti iti sammā pekkhanti pāsaṃsā ca bhavanti iti pasaṃsanīyā ca bhavanti  iti bhagavā yā disā sandhāya te gahapati putta pitā āha disā
translated: “They look on him with affection” means they look on him with love. “They are praiseworthy” means they are worthy of praise.🔽Thus the Blessed One said to the young men, “You should honour these six directions,” referring to the directions in which their parents, teachers, etc., are to be found.

original: imā tā cha disā. Yadi tvaṃ pitu vacanaṃ karosi, imā disā namassāti dassento siṅgālassa
analyzed: imāḥ tā cha disāḥ yadi tvam pitu vacanam karosi imāḥ disāḥ namassā ati dassento siṅgālassa
translated: If you do as your father says, you will honour these directions.

original: pucchāya ṭhatvā desanaṃ matthakaṃ pāpetvā rājagahaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi. Siṅgālakopi saraṇesu
analyzed: pucchāya ṭhatvā desanam matthakam pāpetvā rājagaham piṇḍāya pāvisi siṅgālakaḥ api saraṇesu
translated: After answering the question of Siṅgāla, the Blessed One brought his teaching to a conclusion and entered Rājagaha for alms. Siṅgāla,

original: patiṭṭhāya cattālīsakoṭidhanaṃ buddhasāsane vikiritvā puññakammaṃ katvā saggaparāyaṇo
analyzed: patiṭṭhāya cattālīsa koṭi dhanam buddha sāsane vikiritvā puñña kammam katvā sagga parāyaṇaḥ
translated: after taking the Refuges, scattered forty koṭis of treasure on the Dispensation of the Buddha, performed meritorious deeds, and was reborn in heaven.

original: ahosi. Imasmiñca pana sutte yaṃ gihīhi kattabbaṃ kammaṃ nāma, taṃ akathitaṃ natthi,
analyzed: ahosi imasmin ca pana sutte yam gihīhi kattabbam kammam nāma tat a kathitam natthi

translated: And not only these seven names of the Buddhas are innumerable, but also the names of the Great Sage together with his special qualities are innumerable, it is said.

original: Vessavaṇo pana attano pākaṭanāmavasena evamāha. Te janāti idha khīṇāsavā janāti adhippetā.🔽Apisuṇāthāti desanāsīsamattametaṃ, amusā apisuṇā apharusā mantabhāṇinoti attho. Mahattāti
analyzed: vessavaṇaḥ pana attanaḥ pākaṭa nāma vasena evam āha te janāti idha khīṇa āsavā janāti adhippetā  apisuṇātha ati amusāḥ a pisuṇāḥ a pharusāḥ manta bhāṇino ti attho mahattā ati
translated: But Vessavana spoke thus by way of his own well-known name. The people here are those who are intended, namely, those whose cankers are destroyed.🔽They are not malicious: this is the mere beginning of the teaching; the meaning is, they are not liars, malicious, or deceitful in speech. They are great:

original: mahantabhāvaṃ pattā. “Mahantā”tipi pāṭho, mahantāti attho. Vītasāradāti nissāradā vigatalomahaṃsā.
analyzed: mahanta bhāvam pattā mahantā atipi pāṭhaḥ mahantā ati atthaḥ vīta sāra dā ati nissāra dā vigata lomahaṃsā
translated: they have attained greatness. The reading “mahantā” is also allowable; the meaning is, they are great. They are free from fear: they are fearless, free from the goose-flesh of fear.

original: Hitanti mettāpharaṇena hitaṃ. Yaṃ namassantīti ettha yanti nipātamattaṃ. Mahattanti
analyzed: mettā pharaṇena hitam yam namassanti iti ettha yanti nipāta mattam
translated: They are beneficial: they are beneficial through the pervasion of loving kindness. They worship: here the word “ye” is merely a particle. They are great:

original: mahantaṃ. Ayameva vā pāṭho, idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti “ye cāpi loke kilesanibbānena nibbutā
analyzed: mahantam ayam eva vā pāṭhaḥ idam vuttam hoti ye ca api loke kilesa nibbānena nibbutā
translated: they are great. This is the reading. This is what is said: “And those who are emancipated in the world through the destruction of defilements,

original: yathābhūtaṃ vipassisuṃ, vijjādiguṇasampannañca hitaṃ devamanussānaṃ gotamaṃ namassanti,
analyzed: yathābhūtam vipassisum vijjā ādi guṇa sampannam ca hitam deva manussānam gotamam namassanti
translated: and they have insight into things as they really are, and they are endowed with the qualities of knowledge, etc., and they are the benefactors of gods and men, they honour the Gotama.🔽Those people are not malicious, and they too are worthy of honour.”

original: te janā apisuṇā, tesampi namatthū”ti. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana te janā apisuṇāti te buddhā
analyzed: te janāḥ apisuṇā tesam pi aṭṭhakathā ayam pana te janāḥ apisuṇāti te buddhā
translated: But in the Commentary it is said: “Those people are not malicious” means those Buddhas.

original: apisuṇāti evaṃ paṭhamagāthāya buddhānaṃyeva vaṇṇo kathito, tasmā paṭhamagāthā sattannaṃ
analyzed: apisuṇāti evam paṭhama gāthāya vaṇṇo kathito tasmā paṭhama gāthā
translated: “Not malicious” is said in this way. So the first stanza is spoken with reference to the seven Buddhas.

original: buddhānaṃ vasena vuttā. Dutiyagāthāya “gotama”nti desanāmukhamattametaṃ. Ayampi hi
analyzed: buddhānam vasena vuttāḥ dutiya gāthāya desanā mukham attam etam ayam pi hi
translated: In the second stanza “Gotama” is merely a designation of the Dispensation. This too

original: sattannaṃyeva vasena vuttāti veditabbā. Ayañhettha attho – loke paṇḍitā devamanussā
analyzed: vasena vuttā ati veditabbā ayam ha ittha atthaḥ loke paṇḍitāḥ deva manussāḥ
translated: should be understood as spoken with reference to the seven Buddhas. The meaning here is this: The wise people in the world, gods and men,

original: yaṃ namassanti gotamaṃ, tassa ca tato purimānañca buddhānaṃ namatthūti.🔽278. Yato uggacchatīti yato ṭhānato udeti. Ādiccoti aditiyā putto, vevacanamattaṃ
analyzed: yam namassanti gotamam tassa ca tatas purimānam ca buddhānam namatthu uti  yatas uggacchati iti yatas ṭhānataḥ udeti ādiccaḥ ti aditiyā putto
translated: honour the Gotama, and they honour the Buddhas who have gone before him.🔽“From which it rises”: from which place it rises. “The sun”: the son of Aditi. This is a mere synonym,

original: vā etaṃ sūriyasaddassa. Mahantaṃ maṇḍalaṃ assāti maṇḍalīmahā. Yassa cuggacchamānassāti
analyzed: vai etam sūriya saddassa mahantam maṇḍalam assa ati maṇḍalīmahā yassa cuccacchamānassa ati
translated: or it is a word for the sun. “Having a great orb”: great in orb. “And as it rises”:

original: yamhi uggacchamāne. Saṃvarīpi nirujjhatīti ratti antaradhāyati. Yassa cuggateti yasmiṃ uggate.🔽Rahadoti udakarahado. Tatthāti yato uggacchati sūriyo, tasmiṃ ṭhāne. Samuddoti yo🔽so rahadoti vutto, so na añño, atha kho samuddo. Saritodakoti visaṭodako, saritā
analyzed: yamhi uggacchamāne nirujjhati iti ratti antaradhāyati yassa yasmin uggate  rahado ti udaka rahado tattha ati yatas uggacchati sūriyo tasmiṃ ṭhāne samuddo ti yaḥ  so rahadaḥ ti vutto so na aññaḥ atha kho samuddaḥ saritā udako ti visaṭa udakaḥ saritā
translated: and when it sets, the day ends.🔽A lake is a body of water. There means in the place where the sun rises. The ocean is

original: nānappakārā nadiyo assa udake paviṭṭhāti vā saritodako. Evaṃ taṃ tattha jānantīti
analyzed: nānappakārāḥ nadiyaḥ assa udake paviṭṭhāti vā saritā udako evam tam tattha jānanti iti
translated: what is called a lake. It is not different from that, but is that itself. Watery is water that is flowing. It is watery because many kinds of rivers flow into it. Knowing it thus there means

original: taṃ rahadaṃ tattha evaṃ jānanti. Kinti jānanti? Samuddo saritodakoti evaṃ jānanti.
analyzed: tam rahadam tattha evam jānanti kinti jānanti samuddaḥ saritā udakaḥ ti evam jānanti
translated: knowing that lake thus. How do they know it? They know it as the ocean, watery.

original: Itoti sineruto vā tesaṃ nisinnaṭṭhānato vā. Janoti ayaṃ mahājano. Ekanāmāti indanāmena
analyzed: itoti sinerutaḥ vā tesam nisinna ṭṭhānataḥ vā jano ti ayam mahā jano inda nāmena
translated: From here means from Sineru or from the place where they are sitting. People means this great multitude. Of one name means of the name Indra.

original: ekanāmā. Sabbesaṃ kira tesaṃ sakkassa devarañño nāmameva nāmamakaṃsu. Asīti dasa
analyzed: eka nāmā sabbesam kira tesam sakkassa deva raññaḥ nāmam eva nāmam akaṃsu asi iti dasa
translated: All of them, it seems, gave the name of Sakka, the king of the gods, as their name. Eighty, ten,

original: eko cāti ekanavutijanā. Indanāmāti indoti evaṃnāmā. Buddhaṃ ādiccabandhunanti kilesaniddāpagamanenāpi
analyzed: ca ati ekanavuti janāḥ inda nāmā ati indo iti evaṃnāmā buddham kilesa niddā apagamanena api
translated: and one means ninety-one people. Of the name Indra means of the name Indra. The Buddha, the kinsman of the sun, means by removing the sleep of defilements.

original: buddhaṃ. Ādiccena samānagottatāyapi ādiccabandhunaṃ. Kusalena samekkhasīti anavajjena🔽nipuṇena vā sabbaññutaññāṇena mahājanaṃ olokesi. Amanussāpi taṃ vandantīti amanussāpi🔽taṃ “sabbaññutaññāṇena mahājanaṃ olokesī”ti vatvā vandanti. Sutaṃ netaṃ abhiṇhasoti🔽etaṃ amhehi abhikkhaṇaṃ sutaṃ. Jinaṃ vandatha gotamaṃ, jinaṃ vandāma gotamanti amhehi
analyzed: buddham ādiccena kusalena samekkhasi iti anavajjena  nipuṇena vā sabbaññu ta ññāṇena mahājanam olokesi amanussā api tam vandanti iti amanussā api  tam sabbaññu ta ññāṇena mahājanam olokesi iti vatvā vandanti sutam na itam abhiṇhaso ti  etam amhehi abhikkhaṇam sutam jinam vandatha gotamam jinam vandāma gotamanti amhehi
translated: and the Buddha. They are kinsmen of the Sun because they are of the same clan as the Sun. You survey the great multitude with your skill, with your faultless🔽knowledge of omniscience, or with your discernment. Even the non-human beings pay homage to you. They say: “We have heard this repeatedly.”

original: puṭṭhā jinaṃ vandāma gotamanti vadanti.🔽279. Yena petā pavuccantīti petā nāma kālaṅkatā, te yena disābhāgena nīhariyantūti🔽vuccanti. Pisuṇā piṭṭhimaṃsikāti pisuṇāvācā ceva piṭṭhimaṃsaṃ khādantā viya parammukhā🔽garahakā ca. Ete ca yena nīhariyantūti vuccanti, sabbepi hete dakkhiṇadvārena nīharitvā

original: dakkhiṇato nagarassa ḍayhantu vā chijjantu vā haññantu vāti evaṃ vuccanti. Ito sā
analyzed: dakkhiṇatas nagarassa ḍayhantu vā chijjantu vā haññantu vā ati evam vuccanti itas sā
translated: Let them burn, let them be cut up, let them be killed, to the south of the city’ ’—thus they are called. ‘ From here

original: dakkhiṇā disāti yena disābhāgena te petā ca pisuṇādikā ca nīhariyantūti vuccanti,
analyzed: dakkhiṇā disā ati yena disā bhāgena te petā ca pisuṇā ādikā ca vuccanti
translated: to the south ’: in the direction in which those ghosts and the slanderers, etc., are being led away, thus they are called.

original: ito sā dakkhiṇā disā. Itoti sineruto vā tesaṃ nisinnaṭṭhānato vā. Kumbhaṇḍānanti🔽te kira devā mahodarā honti, rahassaṅgampi ca nesaṃ kumbho viya mahantaṃ hoti. Tasmā
analyzed: itas sā dakkhiṇā disā itas uti sinerutaḥ vā tesam nisinna ṭhānataḥ vā  te kira devāḥ mahā udarāḥ honti ca kumbhaḥ viya mahantam hoti tasmai
translated: ‘ From here ’: from Sineru or from the place where they are sitting. ‘ Kumbhaṇḍas ’:

original: kumbhaṇḍāti vuccanti.
analyzed: kumbhaṇḍāḥ ati vuccanti
translated: they are said to be so because they are said to be big-bellied and to have a penis like a big pot.

original: 280. Yattha coggacchati sūriyoti yasmiṃ disābhāge sūriyo atthaṃ gacchati.
analyzed: yattha ca uggacchati sūriyā iti yasmin disābhāge sūriyaḥ attham gacchati
translated: . ‘ Where the sun sets ’: in the direction in which the sun sets.

original: 281. Yenāti yena disābhāgena. Mahānerūti mahāsineru pabbatarājā. Sudassanoti sovaṇṇamayattā🔽sundaradassano. Sinerussa hi pācīnapassaṃ rajatamayaṃ, dakkhiṇapassaṃ maṇimayaṃ,
analyzed: yena ati yena disā bhāgena mahānerū ti mahā sineru pabbata rājā sudassano ti sovaṇṇa mayattā  sundara dassanaḥ sinerussa hi pācīna passam rajata mayam dakkhiṇa passam maṇi mayam
translated: . ‘ By which ’: by the direction. ‘ Great Sineru ’: the great Sineru, king of mountains. ‘ Beautiful ’: it is beautiful to look at because it is made of gold.🔽For the eastern side of Sineru is silver, the southern side is gem,

original: pacchimapassaṃ phalikamayaṃ, uttarapassaṃ sovaṇṇamayaṃ, taṃ manuññadassanaṃ hoti.
analyzed: pacchima passam phalika mayam uttara passam sovaṇṇa mayam tam manuñña dassanam hoti
translated: the western side is crystal, and the northern side is gold, and that is beautiful to look at.

original: Tasmā yena disābhāgena sineru sudassanoti ayametthattho. Manussā tattha jāyantīti
analyzed: tasmai yena disā bhāgena sineru sudassano ti ayam etthatthaḥ manussā tattha jāyanti iti
translated: ‘Men are born there’:

original: tattha uttarakurumhi manussā jāyanti. Amamāti vatthābharaṇapānabhojanādīsupi mamattavirahitā.
analyzed: tattha uttarakurumhi manussā jāyanti vattha ābharaṇa pāna bhojana ādīsu pi mamatta virahitā
translated: men are born in Uttarakuru. ‘Without ownership’: they are devoid of ownership in regard to clothing, ornaments, drinks, foods, etc.

original: Apariggahāti itthipariggahena apariggahā. Tesaṃ kira “ayaṃ mayhaṃ bhariyā”ti mamattaṃ
analyzed: apariggahā ati itthi pariggahena apariggahā tesam kira ayam mayham bhariyā ati mamattam
translated: ‘Unpossessed’: they are unpossessed by the possession of a wife. For they have no such ownership as ‘She is my wife.’

original: na hoti, mātaraṃ vā bhaginiṃ vā disvā chandarāgo nuppajjati.
analyzed: na hoti mātaram vā bhaginim vā disvā chanda rāgaḥ nuppajjati
translated: When they see a mother or a sister, desire and passion do not arise in them.

original: Napi nīyanti naṅgalāti naṅgalānipi tattha “kasikammaṃ karissāmā”ti na khettaṃ nīyanti.
analyzed: na pi nīyanti naṅgalā ati naṅgalāni pi tattha kasi kammam karissāma ati na khettam nīyanti
translated: ‘No ploughs are yoked’: no ploughs are yoked there for the purpose of ploughing.

original: Akaṭṭhapākimanti akaṭṭhe bhūmibhāge araññe sayameva jātaṃ. Taṇḍulapphalanti taṇḍulāva tassa phalaṃ hoti.🔽Tuṇḍikīre pacitvānāti ukkhaliyaṃ ākiritvā niddhumaṅgārena agginā pacitvā. Tattha
analyzed: akaṭṭha pākimanti akaṭṭhe bhūmi bhāge araññe sayam eva jātam taṇḍula pphalanti taṇḍulā ava tassa phalam hoti  tuṇḍi kīre ukkhaliyam ākiritvā niddhum aṅgārena agginā pacitvā
translated: ‘Unplanted crop’: it grows by itself in the uncultivated forest land. ‘Its fruit is like the rice of men’: its fruit is like the rice of men.🔽‘Cooked in a natural furnace’: having put it in a pot, they cook it with the heat of embers. There, it seems, there are what are called ‘self-kindling stones.’

original: kira jotikapāsāṇā nāma honti. Atha kho te tayo pāsāṇe ṭhapetvā taṃ ukkhaliṃ āropenti.
analyzed: kira jotikapāsāṇāḥ nāma honti atha kho te tayo pāsāṇe ṭhapetvā tam ukkhalim āropenti
translated: Then they place the three stones and put the pot on them.

original: Pāsāṇehi tejo samuṭṭhahitvā taṃ pacati. Tato bhuñjanti bhojananti tato ukkhalito
analyzed: pāsāṇehi tejaḥ samuṭṭhahitvā tam pacati tatas bhuñjanti tatas ukkhalitaḥ
translated: Fire arises from the stones and cooks it. Then they eat the food.

original: bhojanameva bhuñjanti, añño sūpo vā byañjanaṃ vā na hoti, bhuñjantānaṃ cittānukūloyevassa
analyzed: bhojanam eva bhuñjanti aññaḥ sūpaḥ vā byañjanam vā na hoti bhuñjantānam citta anukūlaḥ yā iva assa
translated: Fire arises from the stones and cooks it. Then they eat it. ‘Food’ means that they eat only the food, there is no other curry or condiment, and the taste of the food is agreeable to their minds.

original: raso hoti. Te taṃ ṭhānaṃ sampattānaṃ dentiyeva, macchariyacittaṃ nāma na hoti. Buddhapaccekabuddhādayopi
analyzed: rasaḥ hoti te tam ṭhānam sampattānam dentiyā iva macchariya cittam nāma na hoti buddha paccekabuddha ādayaḥ api
translated: They give it only to those who have reached that place; there is no such thing as a miserly mind. Even Buddhas, Paccekabuddhas, and others of great spiritual power,

original: mahiddhikā tattha gantvā piṇḍapātaṃ gaṇhanti.🔽Gāviṃ ekakhuraṃ katvāti gāviṃ gahetvā ekakhuraṃ vāhanameva katvā. Taṃ abhiruyha vessavaṇassa🔽paricārakā yakkhā. Anuyanti disodisanti tāya tāya disāya caranti. Pasuṃ ekakhuraṃ
analyzed: tattha gantvā piṇḍapātam gaṇhanti  gāvim eka khuram katvā iti gāvim gahetvā eka khuram vāhanam eva katvā tam abhiruyha vessavaṇassa  paricārakāḥ yakkhāḥ anuyanti disodisanti tāya tāya disāya caranti pasum eka khuram
translated: when they go there, take alms food.🔽‘Having made a cow a single hoof’: having caught a cow, they make it a single hoof, a vehicle. Having mounted it, the yakkhas who are Vessavaṇa’s attendants

original: katvāti ṭhapetvā gāviṃ avasesacatuppadajātikaṃ pasuṃ ekakhuraṃ vāhanameva katvā disodisaṃ anuyanti.
analyzed: katvā iti ṭhapetvā gāvim avasesa catuppada jātikam pasum eka khuram vāhanam eva katvā disodisam anuyanti
translated: go in all directions. They go in all directions. ‘Having made an animal a single hoof’: having left out the cow, they make the rest of the four-footed animals a single hoof, a vehicle, and go in all directions.

original: Itthiṃ vā vāhanaṃ katvāti yebhuyyena gabbhiniṃ mātugāmaṃ vāhanaṃ karitvā. Tassā piṭṭhiyā
analyzed: itthim vā vāhanam katvā ati yebhuyyena gabbhinim mātugāmam vāhanam karitvā tassā piṭṭhiyā
translated: ‘Having made a woman a vehicle’: having made a pregnant woman or a woman of the female sex a vehicle.

original: nisīditvā caranti. Tassā kira piṭṭhi onamituṃ sahati. Itarā pana itthiyo yāne yojenti.🔽Purisaṃ vāhanaṃ katvāti purise gahetvā yāne yojenti. Gaṇhantā ca sammādiṭṭhike gahetuṃ
analyzed: nisīditvā caranti tassā kira piṭṭhi onamitum sahati itarā pana itthiyaḥ yāne yojenti  purisam vāhanam katvā ati purise gahetvā yāne yojenti gaṇhantā ca sammādiṭṭhike gahetum
translated: and they ride in them. It is said that she can bend her back. But other women yoke them.🔽They make men their vehicles: they take men and yoke them to vehicles. And when they take them, they cannot take those who have right view.

original: na sakkonti. Yebhuyyena paccantimamilakkhuvāsike gaṇhanti. Aññataro kirettha jānapado
analyzed: na sakkonti yebhuyyena gaṇhanti aññataraḥ kira ittha jānapadaḥ
translated: For the most part they take those who live in the border regions of the country.

original: ekassa therassa samīpe nisīditvā niddāyati, thero “upāsaka ativiya niddāyasī”ti pucchi.
analyzed: ekassa therassa samīpe nisīditvā niddāyati theraḥ upāsaka ativiya niddāyasi iti pucchi
translated: A certain district chief, it seems, was sitting in the presence of a certain elder and fell asleep. The elder asked him, “Lay follower, you are sleeping a lot.”

original: “Ajja, bhante, sabbarattiṃ vessavaṇadāsehi kilamitomhī”ti āha.
analyzed: ajja bhante sabbarattim vessavaṇa dāsehi kilamito mhi iti āha
translated: “Venerable sir, I was harassed all night by the slaves of Vessavaṇa.”

original: Kumāriṃ vāhanaṃ katvāti kumāriyo gahetvā ekakhuraṃ vāhanaṃ katvā rathe yojenti. Kumāravāhanepi
analyzed: kumārim vāhanam katvā ati kumāriyaḥ gahetvā eka khuram vāhanam katvā rathe yojenti kumāra vāhane api
translated: They make girls their vehicles: they take girls and yoke them to a single cart, making them a vehicle. In the case of boys’ vehicles

original: eseva nayo. Pacārā tassa rājinoti tassa rañño paricārikā. Hatthiyānaṃ assayānanti
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ pacārā tassa rājino ti tassa rañño paricārikā hatthi yānam assa yānanti
translated: the same method applies. The king’s female slaves: the king’s female attendants. Elephant vehicles, horse vehicles:

original: na kevalaṃ goyānādīniyeva, hatthiassayānādīnipi abhiruhitvā vicaranti. Dibbaṃ yānanti
analyzed: na kevalam go yāna ādīni yā iva hatthi assa yāna ādīni pi abhiruhitvā vicaranti dibbam yānanti
translated: not only cows’ vehicles, etc., but also elephant vehicles, horse vehicles, etc., they mount and ride. Divine vehicles:

original: aññampi nesaṃ bahuvidhaṃ dibbayānaṃ upaṭṭhitameva hoti, etāni tāva nesaṃ upakappanayānāni.
analyzed: aññam pi nesam bahuvidham dibba yānam upaṭṭhitam eva hoti etāni tāva nesam upakappana yānāni
translated: and many other kinds of divine vehicles are also ready for them. These are their vehicles for conveyance.

original: Te pana pāsāde varasayanamhi nipannāpi pīṭhasivikādīsu ca nisinnāpi vicaranti. Tena
analyzed: te pana pāsāde vara sayanamhi nipannā api pīṭha sivikā ādīsu ca nisinnā api vicaranti tena
translated: But they travel also while lying on a fine couch in the palaces and while seated on a chair, a divan, etc.,🔽so it was said: ‘Palaces, chairs, and couches.’

original: vuttaṃ “pāsādā sivikā cevā”ti. Mahārājassa yasassinoti evaṃ ānubhāvasampannassa yasassino
analyzed: vuttam pāsādā sivikā ca iva ati mahā rājassa yasassino ti evam ānubhāva sampannassa yasassino
translated: These vehicles are produced for the great king, the illustrious one,

original: mahārājassa etāni yānāni nibbattanti.🔽Tassa ca nagarā ahu antalikkhe sumāpitāti tassa rañño ākāse suṭṭhu māpitā ete āṭānāṭādikā
analyzed: mahā rājassa etāni yānāni nibbattanti  tassa ca nagarā ahu antalikkhe su māpitā ati tassa rañño ākāse suṭṭhu māpitā ete āṭānāṭādikā
translated: who is thus endowed with majesty.🔽And for him there were cities well built in the sky,

original: nagarā ahesuṃ, nagarāni bhaviṃsūti attho. Ekañhissa nagaraṃ āṭānāṭā nāma āsi, ekaṃ
analyzed: nagarāḥ ahesum nagarāni bhaviṃsu iti attho ekam hissa nagaram āṭānāṭā nāma āsi ekam
translated: these cities beginning with Āṭānāṭā were well built in the sky for that king. The meaning is that they were his cities. One of his cities was called Āṭānāṭā,

original: kusināṭā nāma, ekaṃ parakusināṭā nāma, ekaṃ nāṭasūriyā nāma, ekaṃ parakusiṭanāṭā nāma.
analyzed: kusināṭā nāma ekam parakusināṭā nāma ekam nāṭasūriyā nāma ekam parakusiṭanāṭā nāma
translated: one Kusināṭā, one Parakusināṭā, one Nāṭasūriyā, and one Parakusiṭanāṭā.🔽To the north of Kāsi

original: Uttarena kasivantoti tasmiṃ ṭhatvā ujuṃ uttaradisāya kasivanto nāma aññaṃ nagaraṃ.
analyzed: uttarena kasivanto ti tasmin ṭhatvā ujum uttara disāya kasivantaḥ nāma aññam nagaram
translated: and to the north of that, having settled there, he built a city called Kāsi.

original: Janoghamaparena cāti etassa aparabhāge janoghaṃ nāma aññaṃ nagaraṃ. Navanavatiyoti
analyzed: janogham aparena ca ati etassa apara bhāge janogham nāma aññam nagaram
translated: Janoghamaparena ca = “And Janogha is next to it.”🔽Navanavatiyo = “And Navanavatiyo is next to it.”

original: aññampi navanavatiyo nāma ekaṃ nagaraṃ. Aparaṃ ambaraambaravatiyo nāma. Āḷakamandāti
analyzed: aññam pi navanavatiyaḥ nāma ekam nagaram aparam ambaraambaravatiyaḥ nāma āḷakamandā ati
translated: Aparaṃ ambaraambaravatiyo = “And Ambaraambaravatiyo is next to it.”

original: aparampi āḷakamandā nāma rājadhānī.
analyzed: aparampi āḷakamandā nāma rājadhānī
translated: Āḷakamandā = “And Āḷakamandā is next to it.”🔽Tasmā kuvero mahārājā = “Therefore Kuvera the Great King.”

original: Tasmā kuvero mahārājāti ayaṃ kira anuppanne buddhe kuvero nāma brāhmaṇo hutvā ucchuvappaṃ🔽kāretvā satta yantāni yojesi. Ekissāya yantasālāya uṭṭhitaṃ āyaṃ āgatāgatassa mahājanassa
analyzed: tasmai kuveraḥ mahā rāja ati ayam kira anuppanne buddhe kuveraḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ hutvā ucchuvappam  kāretvā satta yantāni yojesi ekissāya yanta sālāya uṭṭhitam āyam āgata āgatassa mahājanassa
translated: This Kuvera, it seems, when there was no Buddha in the world, was a brāhmaṇa called Kuvera. He had seven machines made,🔽and he gave the wealth that came from the one machine to the people who came along.

original: datvā puññaṃ akāsi. Avasesasālāhi tattheva bahutaro āyo uṭṭhāsi, so tena pasīditvā
analyzed: da tvā puññam akāsi avasesa sālāhi tattha iva bahutaraḥ āyo uṭṭhāsi saḥ tena pasīditvā
translated: He made merit in this way. The wealth that came from the other machines was even greater, and he was pleased.

original: avasesasālāsupi uppajjanakaṃ gahetvā vīsati vassasahassāni dānaṃ adāsi. So kālaṃ
analyzed: avasesa sālāsu pi uppajjanakam gahetvā vīsati vassa sahassāni dānam adāsi saḥ kālam
translated: He took the wealth that came from them and gave gifts for twenty thousand years. When he died

original: katvā cātumahārājikesu kuvero nāma devaputto jāto. Aparabhāge visāṇāya rājadhāniyā
analyzed: katvā cātumahārājikesu kuveraḥ nāma deva puttaḥ jātaḥ aparabhāge visāṇāya rājadhāniyā
translated: he was reborn as a god in the retinue of the Four Great Kings called Kuvera. Later he became king in the capital city of Visāṇā.

original: rajjaṃ kāresi. Tato paṭṭhāya vessavaṇoti vuccati.
analyzed: rajjam kāresi tatas paṭṭhāya vessavaṇaḥ ti vuccati
translated: From then on he was called Vessavaṇa.

original: Paccesanto pakāsentīti paṭiesanto visuṃ visuṃ atthe upaparikkhamānā anusāsamānā aññe
analyzed: paccesantaḥ pakāsenti iti paṭiesantaḥ visum visum atthe upaparikkhamānāḥ anusāsamānāḥ aññe
translated: They proclaim, they make known: they proclaim, they make known, they investigate, they advise, each one separately,

original: dvādasa yakkharaṭṭhikā pakāsenti. Te kira yakkharaṭṭhikā sāsanaṃ gahetvā dvādasannaṃ
analyzed: dvādasa yakkharaṭṭhikā pakāsenti te kira yakkharaṭṭhikā sāsanam gahetvā
translated: twelve yakkha-kingdoms. They, it seems, having taken the Dispensation, inform twelve

original: yakkhadovārikānaṃ nivedenti. Yakkhadovārikā taṃ sāsanaṃ mahārājassa nivedenti. Idāni
analyzed: yakkha dovārikānam nivedenti yakkha dovārikā tam sāsanam mahā rājassa nivedenti idāni
translated: yakkha-gatekeepers. The yakkha-gatekeepers inform the Great King. Now

original: tesaṃ yakkharaṭṭhikānaṃ nāmaṃ dassento tatolātiādimāha. Tesu kira eko tatolā nāma,
analyzed: tesam yakkharaṭṭhikānam nāmam dassentaḥ tatolā iti ādim āha tesu kira ekaḥ tatolā nāma
translated: showing the name of those yakkha-kingdoms he said tatolā and so on. It seems that one of them was called Tatolā,

original: eko tattalā nāma, eko tatotalā nāma, eko ojasi nāma, eko tejasi nāma, eko tatojasī🔽nāma. Sūro rājāti eko sūro nāma, eko rājā nāma, eko sūrorājā nāma, ariṭṭho nemīti
analyzed: ekaḥ tattalāḥ nāma ekaḥ tatotalāḥ nāma ekaḥ ojasi nāma ekaḥ tejasi nāma ekaḥ tatojasī  nāma sūraḥ rājā ati ekaḥ sūraḥ nāma ekaḥ rājā nāma ekaḥ sūrorājā nāma ariṭṭhaḥ nemi iti
translated: one was called Tattalā, one was called Tatotalā, one was called Ojasi, one was called Tejasī, one was called Tatojasī,

original: eko ariṭṭho nāma, eko nemi nāma, eko ariṭṭhanemi nāma.
analyzed: ekaḥ ariṭṭhaḥ nāma ekaḥ nemi nāma ekaḥ ariṭṭhanemi nāma
translated: one was called Sūro, one was called Rājā, one was called Sūrorājā, one was called Ariṭṭha, one was called Nemī, one was called Ariṭṭhanemi.

original: Rahadopi tattha dharaṇī nāmāti tattha paneko nāmena dharaṇī nāma udakarahado atthi,
analyzed: rahadaḥ api tattha dharaṇī nāma ati tattha pana ekaḥ nāmena dharaṇī nāma udaka rahadaḥ atthi
translated: There is a lake called Dharaṇī there: there is a lake called Dharaṇī there, it seems, which is by name,

original: paṇṇāsayojanā mahāpokkharaṇī atthīti vuttaṃ hoti. Yato meghā pavassantīti yato pokkharaṇito🔽udakaṃ gahetvā meghā pavassanti. Vassā yato patāyantīti yato vuṭṭhiyo avattharamānā🔽nigacchanti. Meghesu kira uṭṭhitesu tato pokkharaṇito purāṇaudakaṃ bhassati. Upari🔽megho uṭṭhahitvā taṃ pokkharaṇiṃ navodakena pūreti. Purāṇodakaṃ heṭṭhimaṃ hutvā nikkhamati.🔽Paripuṇṇāya pokkharaṇiyā valāhakā vigacchanti. Sabhāpīti sabhā. Tassā kira pokkharaṇiyā
analyzed: paṇṇāsa yojanā mahā pokkharaṇī atthi iti vuttam hoti yatas meghā pavassanti iti yatas pokkharaṇito  udakam gahetvā meghā pavassanti vassāḥ yatas patāyanti iti yatas vuṭṭhiyaḥ avattharamānā  nigacchanti meghesu kira uṭṭhitesu tato pokkharaṇitaḥ purāṇa odakam bhassati upari  meghaḥ uṭṭhahitvā tam pokkharaṇim nava udakena pūreti purāṇa udakam heṭṭhimam hutvā nikkhamati  paripuṇṇāya pokkharaṇiyā valāhakāḥ vigacchanti sabhā api iti sabhā tassā kira pokkharaṇiyā
translated: ‘From which the clouds rain down’ means from which the cloud takes up water and rains it down. ‘From which the rain falls’ means from which the rain falls down without stopping. It is said that when the clouds rise up, the old water in the lake dries up. The cloud rises up above and fills the lake with new water. The old water goes down and comes out. When the lake is full, the clouds disappear. ‘The assembly’ means the assembly.

original: tīre sālavatiyā nāma latāya parikkhitto dvādasayojaniko ratanamaṇḍapo atthi, taṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ.🔽Payirupāsantīti nisīdanti. Tattha niccaphalā rukkhāti tasmiṃ ṭhāne taṃ maṇḍapaṃ parivāretvā
analyzed: tīre sālavatiyāḥ nāma latāya parikkhittaḥ dvādasa yojanikaḥ ratana maṇḍapaḥ atthi tam sandhāya itam vuttam 🔽payirupāsanti iti nisīdanti tattha nicca phalā rukkhā tasmin ṭhāne tam maṇḍapam parivāretvā
translated: “A lake fifty leagues across” means a lake fifty leagues in length and breadth. “From which the clouds draw water” means that the clouds take water from that lake and rain it down. “From which the rain flows out” means that the water from that lake flows out and spreads over the earth. When the clouds rise up, the old water in the lake becomes agitated. The clouds rise up and fill the lake with new water. The old water flows out below. When the lake is full, the clouds disappear. “In the assembly” means in the assembly hall. It is said that on the bank of that lake there is a jeweled pavilion twelve leagues in circumference, surrounded by a creeper called Sālavati. “They sit down” means they take their seats. “The trees are always fruitful” means that the trees surround that pavilion

original: sadā phalitā ambajambuādayo rukkhā niccapupphitā ca campakamālādayoti dasseti. Nānādijagaṇāyutāti
analyzed: sadā phalitāḥ amba jambu ādayaḥ rukkhāḥ nicca pupphitā ca campaka mālā ādayo ti dasseti nānā ādi jagaṇa āyutā ati
translated: and the trees are always laden with fruit, such as mango, rose-apple, etc., and always in blossom, such as champak, jasmine, etc. ‘With myriads of various birds’

original: vividhapakkhisaṅghasamākulā. Mayūrakoñcābhirudāti mayūrehi koñcasakuṇehi ca abhirudā upagītā.
analyzed: vividha pakkhi saṅgha samākulā mayūra koñca abhirudā ati mayūrehi koñca sakuṇehi ca abhirudā upagītā
translated: means crowded with flocks of various birds. ‘With peacocks and cranes crying out’ means with peacocks and cranes crying out.

original: Jīvañjīvakasaddetthāti “jīva jīvā”ti evaṃ viravantānaṃ jīvañjīvakasakuṇānampi ettha🔽saddo atthi. Oṭṭhavacittakāti “uṭṭhehi, citta, uṭṭhehi cittā”ti evaṃ vassamānā uṭṭhavacittakasakuṇāpi
analyzed: jīvañjīvaka sadda itthā ati jīva jīva ati evam viravantānam jīvañjīvaka sakuṇānam pi ettha  saddo atthi oṭṭhavacittakā ati uṭṭhehi citta uṭṭhehi citta ati evam vassamānā uṭṭhavacittaka sakuṇā api
translated: ‘With the sound of the jīvañjīva bird here’ means that there is the sound of the jīvañjīva bird here, which cries out ‘jīva jīva’. ‘With the uṭṭhavacitta bird’

original: tattha vicaranti. Kukkuṭakāti vanakukkuṭakā. Kuḷīrakāti suvaṇṇakakkaṭakā. Vaneti
analyzed: tattha vicaranti kukkuṭakā ati vanakukkuṭakā kuḷīrakā ati suvaṇṇakakkaṭakā vaneti
translated: means that the uṭṭhavacitta bird, which cries out ‘uṭṭhehi citta, uṭṭhehi citta’, also wanders there. ‘With the kukkuṭa bird’ means with the forest cock. ‘With the kuḷīra bird’ means with the golden parrot. ‘In the forest’

original: padumavane. Pokkharasātakāti pokkharasātakā nāma sakuṇā.
analyzed: padumavane pokkharasātakā ati pokkharasātakāḥ nāma sakuṇā
translated: means in the lotus forest. ‘With the pokkharasātaka bird’ means with the pokkharasātaka bird.

original: Sukasāḷikasaddetthāti sukānañca sāḷikānañca saddo ettha. Daṇḍamāṇavakāni cāti manussamukhasakuṇā.
analyzed: suka sāḷika saddaḥ itthā ati sukānam ca sāḷikānam ca saddaḥ ettha daṇḍa māṇavakāni ca ati manussa mukha sakuṇā
translated: ‘With the sound of the parrot and the sāḷika bird here’ means the sound of the parrot and the sāḷika bird here. ‘And with the daṇḍamāṇavaka bird’ means with the human-faced bird.

original: Te kira dvīhi hatthehi suvaṇṇadaṇḍaṃ gahetvā ekaṃ pokkharapattaṃ akkamitvā anantare
analyzed: te kira dvīhi hatthehi suvaṇṇa daṇḍam gahetvā ekam pokkhara pattam akkamitvā anantare
translated: It is said that they take a golden staff with two hands, step on a lotus leaf, and then

original: pokkharapatte suvaṇṇadaṇḍaṃ nikkhipantā vicaranti. Sobhati sabbakālaṃ sāti sā pokkharaṇī
analyzed: pokkhara patte suvaṇṇa daṇḍam nikkhipantā vicaranti sobhati sabbakālam sā ati sā pokkharaṇī
translated: They move about placing a golden staff on the lotus leaf.🔽That lotus-pond shines always,🔽it shines always.

original: sabbakālaṃ sobhati. Kuveranaḷinīti kuverassa naḷinī padumasarabhūtā, sā dharaṇī nāma
analyzed: sabbakālam sobhati kuvera naḷinī iti kuverassa naḷinī paduma sara bhūtā sā dharaṇī nāma
translated: The lotus of Kuvera is Kuveranaḷinī. It is a lotus-pond called Dharaṇī,

original: pokkharaṇī sadā nirantaraṃ sobhati.
analyzed: pokkharaṇī sadā nirantaram sobhati
translated: a lotus-pond that always shines without interruption.

original: 282. Yassa kassacīti idaṃ vessavaṇo āṭānāṭiyaṃ rakkhaṃ niṭṭhapetvā tassā parikammaṃ🔽dassento āha. Tattha suggahitāti atthañca byañjanañca parisodhetvā suṭṭhu uggahitā.
analyzed: yassa kassaci iti idam vessavaṇaḥ āṭānāṭiyam rakkham niṭṭhapetvā tassā parikammaṃ  dassentaḥ āha tattha suggahitā ti atthañca byañjanañca parisodhetvā suṭṭhu uggahitā
translated: “Whoever” : this is Vessavaṇa, after concluding the Āṭānāṭiya protection,🔽showing the service to it, he said. There, “well-learned” : after purifying the meaning and the phrasing, it is well-learned.

original: Samattā pariyāputāti padabyañjanāni ahāpetvā paripuṇṇaṃ uggahitā. Atthampi pāḷimpi
analyzed: pada byañjanāni ahāpetvā paripuṇṇam uggahitā attham pi pāḷim pi
translated: “Complete and perfect” : without omitting the words and the phrasing, it is learned completely. The meaning and the text

original: visaṃvādetvā sabbaso vā pana appaguṇaṃ katvā bhaṇantassa hi parittaṃ tejavantaṃ na
analyzed: visaṃvādetvā sabbasas vā pana appaguṇam katvā bhaṇantassa hi parittam tejavantam na
translated: are not contradicted, or if it is recited making it all deficient, then the protection does not have power,

original: hoti, sabbaso paguṇaṃ katvā bhaṇantasseva tejavantaṃ hoti. Lābhahetu uggahetvā bhaṇantassāpi
analyzed: hoti sabbaso paguṇam katvā bhaṇantassa iva tejavantam hoti lābha hetu uggahetvā bhaṇantassa api
translated: but if it is recited making it all complete, then it has power. If it is learned for the sake of gain and recited,

original: atthaṃ na sādheti, nissaraṇapakkhe ṭhatvā mettaṃ purecārikaṃ katvā bhaṇantasseva
analyzed: attham na sādheti nissaraṇa pakkhe ṭhatvā mettam purecārikam katvā bhaṇantassa iva
translated: He does not succeed in his aim. He shows that it is for his welfare if, standing on the side of escape, he recites the Metta Sutta as a preliminary practice.

original: atthāya hotīti dasseti. Yakkhapacāroti yakkhaparicārako.
analyzed: atthāya hoti iti dasseti yakkha pacāro ti yakkha paricārako
translated: Yakkhapacāro: a servant of the yakkhas.

original: Vatthuṃ vāti gharavatthuṃ vā. Vāsaṃ vāti tattha nibaddhavāsaṃ vā. Samitinti samāgamaṃ.
analyzed: vatthum vāti ghara vatthum vā vāsam vāti tattha nibaddha vāsam vā samāgamam
translated: Vatthuṃ vā: a house. Vāsaṃ vā: a permanent residence there. Samitanti samāgamaṃ: a gathering.

original: Anāvayhanti na āvāhayuttaṃ. Avivayhanti na vivāhayuttaṃ. Tena saha āvāhavivāhaṃ na🔽kareyyunti attho. Attāhipi paripuṇṇāhīti “kaḷārakkhi kaḷāradantā”ti evaṃ etesaṃ attabhāvaṃ
analyzed: an āvayhanti na āvāha yuttam a vivayhanti na vivāha yuttam tena saha āvāha vivāham na  kareyyunti paripuṇṇāhi iti kaḷārakkhi kaḷāra dantā ati evam etesam atta bhāvam
translated: Anāvayhaṃ: not fit to be invited. Avivayhaṃ: not fit to be dismissed. The meaning is: one should not invite or dismiss him together with them.🔽Attāhipi paripuṇṇāhīti: “Kaḷārakkhi kaḷāradantā” (Dhp 350), thus speaking with taunts that bring up their bodily form,

original: upanetvā vuttāhi paripuṇṇabyañjanāhi paribhāsāhi paribhāseyyuṃ yakkhaakkosehi nāma
analyzed: upanetvā vuttāhi paripuṇṇa byañjanāhi paribhāsāhi paribhāseyyum yakkha akkosehi nāma
translated: they would taunt him with yakkha-insults. The meaning is: they would insult him with insults of the yakkhas.

original: akkoseyyunti attho. Rittampissa pattanti bhikkhūnaṃ pattasadisameva lohapattaṃ hoti.
analyzed: akkoseyyum ti attho rittam pissa pattanti bhikkhūnam patta sadisam eva loha pattam hoti
translated: Rittampissa pattaṃ: his bowl is like the monks’ bowl, but it is a metal bowl.

original: Taṃ sīse nikkujjitaṃ yāva galavāṭakā bhassati. Atha naṃ majjhe ayokhīlena ākoṭenti.
analyzed: tam sīse nikkujjitam yāva galavāṭakā bhassati atha nam majjhe ayaḥ khīlena ākoṭenti
translated: It is placed on his head, and it burns down to his collar bone. Then they beat him in the middle with an iron spike.

original: Caṇḍāti kodhanā. Ruddhāti viruddhā. Rabhasāti karaṇuttariyā. Neva mahārājānaṃ ādiyantīti
analyzed: caṇḍā ati kodhanā ruddhā ati viruddhā rabhasā ati karaṇuttariyā na iva mahā rājānam ādiyanti iti
translated: Fierce: prone to anger. Obstructing: opposed. Violent: exceeding the measure. Not obeying the Great Kings:

original: vacanaṃ na gaṇhanti, āṇaṃ na karonti. Mahārājānaṃ purisakānanti aṭṭhavīsatiyakkhasenāpatīnaṃ.
analyzed: vacanam na gaṇhanti āṇam na karonti mahā rājānam purisakānam ti aṭṭhavīsati yakkha senāpatīnam
translated: not taking their word, not doing their bidding. The Great Kings’ men: the twenty-eight generals of the yakkhas.

original: Purisakānanti yakkhasenāpatīnaṃ ye manassā tesaṃ. Avaruddhā nāmāti paccāmittā verino.
analyzed: purisakānam ti yakkha senāpatīnam ye manassā tesam avaruddhāḥ nāma ati pacca amittāḥ verino
translated: The men: the yakkhas who are their mind-born sons. The obstructed: enemies, foes.

original: Ujjhāpetabbanti parittaṃ vatvā amanusse paṭikkamāpetuṃ asakkontena etesaṃ yakkhānaṃ
analyzed: ujjhāpetabbanti parittam vatvā amanusse paṭikkamāpetum a sakkontena etesam yakkhānam
translated: Should be made to recite: if one is unable to make the non-human beings depart by reciting the paritta, then the paritta should be recited for these yakkhas;

original: ujjhāpetabbaṃ, ete jānāpetabbāti attho.
analyzed: ujjhāpetabbam ete jānāpetabbā ati atthaḥ
translated: the meaning is, they should be made to know.

original: Parittaparikammakathā
analyzed: paritta parikamma kathā
translated: The Discussion of the Preliminaries to the Recitation of the Paritta

original: Idha pana ṭhatvā parittassa parikammaṃ kathetabbaṃ. Paṭhamameva hi āṭānāṭiyasuttaṃ
analyzed: idha pana ṭhatvā parittassa parikammam kathetabbam paṭhamam eva hi āṭānāṭiya suttam
translated: Herein, the preliminaries to the recitation of the paritta should be told. For the Āṭānāṭiya Sutta

original: na bhaṇitabbaṃ, mettasuttaṃ dhajaggasuttaṃ ratanasuttanti imāni sattāhaṃ bhaṇitabbāni.
analyzed: na bhaṇitabbam metta suttam dhajagga suttam ratana suttam ti imāni sattāham bhaṇitabbāni
