original: dibbacakkhupaññā ālokapharaṇatā nāma. Paccavekkhaṇañāṇaṃ paccavekkhaṇanimittaṃ nāma.
analyzed: dibba cakkhu paññā āloka pharaṇa tā nāma paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam paccavekkhaṇa nimittam nāma
translated: And the knowledge of reviewing is called the sign of reviewing.

original: Vuttampi cetaṃ “dvīsu jhānesu paññā pītipharaṇatā, tīsu jhānesu paññā sukhapharaṇatā.
analyzed: vuttam pi ca itam dvīsu jhānesu paññā pīti pharaṇa tā tīsu jhānesu paññā sukha pharaṇa tā
translated: And this is said: “The understanding in the first two jhānas is the extension of rapture, and the understanding in the three jhānas is the extension of happiness.

original: Paracitte paññā cetopharaṇatā, dibbacakkhu ālokapharaṇatā. Tamhā tamhā samādhimhā
analyzed: para citte paññā cetaḥ pharaṇa tā dibba cakkhu āloka pharaṇa tā tamhā tamhā samādhimhā
translated: The understanding of the mind of another is the extension of mind, and the divine eye is the extension of light.

original: vuṭṭhitassa paccavekkhaṇañāṇaṃ paccavekkhaṇanimitta”nti.
analyzed: vuṭṭhitassa paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam paccavekkhaṇa nimittan ti
translated: And the knowledge of reviewing of one who has emerged from this or that concentration is the sign of reviewing” .

original: Tattha pītipharaṇatā sukhapharaṇatā dve pādā viya. Cetopharaṇatā ālokapharaṇatā dve
analyzed: tattha pīti pharaṇa tā sukha pharaṇa tā dve pādāḥ viya cetaḥ pharaṇa tā āloka pharaṇa tā dve
translated: Herein, the extension of rapture and the extension of happiness are like two feet. The extension of mind and the extension of light are like two hands.

original: hatthā viya. Abhiññāpādakajjhānaṃ majjhimakāyo viya. Paccavekkhaṇanimittaṃ sīsaṃ
analyzed: hatthāḥ viya abhiññā pādaka jjhānam majjhima kāyaḥ viya paccavekkhaṇa nimittam sīsam
translated: The basic-jhāna concentration is like the middle of the body. The sign of reviewing is like the head.

original: viya. Iti āyasmā sāriputtatthero pañcaṅgikaṃ sammāsamādhiṃ aṅgapaccaṅgasampannaṃ🔽purisaṃ katvā dassesi.
analyzed: viya iti āyasmā sāriputta thero pañcaṅgikam sammāsamādhim aṅga paccaṅga sampannam  purisam katvā dassesi
translated: So the Elder Sāriputta showed the five-factored right concentration with the five factors and the five factors’ accessories.

original: (Ja) ayaṃ samādhi paccuppannasukho ce vātiādīsu arahattaphalasamādhi adhippeto. So
analyzed: ayam samādhi paccuppanna sukho ce vā ati ādīsu arahatta phala samādhi adhippeto so
translated: (Ja) This concentration that is “blissful in the present” and so on is the concentration of the fruition of arahantship that is intended here.

original: hi appitappitakkhaṇe sukhattā paccuppannasukho. Purimo purimo pacchimassa pacchimassa
analyzed: hi appita ppita khaṇe sukhattā paccuppanna sukho purimaḥ purimaḥ pacchimassa pacchimassa
translated: and because of the pleasure at each moment it is pleasant now. The former is the cause of the latter.

original: samādhisukhassa paccayattā āyatiṃ sukhavipāko.🔽Kilesehi ārakattā ariyo. Kāmāmisavaṭṭāmisalokāmisānaṃ abhāvā nirāmiso. Buddhādīhi🔽mahāpurisehi sevitattā akāpurisasevito. Aṅgasantatāya ārammaṇasantatāya sabbakilesadarathasantatāya
analyzed: samādhi sukhassa paccaya ttā āyatim sukha vipāko  kilesehi ārakattā ariyaḥ kāma āmisa vaṭṭa āmisa loka āmisānaṃ abhāvā nirāmisaḥ buddha ādīhi  mahāpurisehi aṅga santatāya ārammaṇa santatāya sabba kilesa daratha santatāya
translated: It is pleasant in the moment of its occurrence, thus it is pleasant now. It is the cause of the successively more tranquil jhānas, thus it is the cause of future pleasure.🔽It is noble because it is far from defilements. It is without gross or gross-sensuous-pleasure-seeking or worldly-pleasure-seeking, thus it is without grossness.

original: ca santo. Atappanīyaṭṭhena paṇīto. Kilesapaṭippassaddhiyā laddhattā kilesapaṭippassaddhibhāvaṃ🔽vā laddhattā paṭippassaddhaladdho. Paṭippassaddhaṃ paṭippassaddhīti hi idaṃ atthato🔽ekaṃ. Paṭippassaddhakilesena vā arahatā laddhattā paṭippassaddhaladdho. Ekodibhāvena
analyzed: ca santo a tappanīya ṭṭhena paṇīto kilesa paṭippassaddhiyā laddhattā kilesa paṭippassaddhi bhāvam  vā laddha ttā paṭippassaddha laddhaḥ paṭippassaddham paṭippassaddhi iti hi idam atthato  ekam paṭippassaddha kilesena vā arahatā laddhattā paṭippassaddha laddhaḥ ekodi bhāvena
translated: It is not frequented by ordinary men, thus it is not frequented by ordinary men. It is peaceful because of the peacefulness of the factors, of the object, and of the defilements that are removed.🔽It is sublime because of the state of being free from remorse. It is obtained by the obtaining of the state of peace from defilements, or it is obtained by the obtaining of the state of peace,🔽for “peace” and “the state of peace” are the same in meaning.

original: adhigatattā ekodibhāvameva vā adhigatattā ekodibhāvādhigato. Appaguṇasāsavasamādhi
analyzed: adhigata ttā ekodi bhāvam eva vā adhigata ttā ekodi bhāva adhigataḥ appaguṇa sa āsava samādhi
translated: Or it is obtained by the obtaining of the state of peace by an Arahant whose defilements are peaceful. It is unified because it is reached by unification, or it is unified because it has reached unification.🔽It is bright because it is not mixed with the defilements that are opposed to the jhānas, or it is bright because it is the means to the attainment of the bright supramundane states.

original: viya sasaṅkhārena sappayogena cittena paccanīkadhamme niggayha kilese vāretvā anadhigatattā
analyzed: sa saṅkhārena sa payogena cittena paccanīka dhamme niggayha kilese vāretvā anadhigata ttā
translated: and he does so by means of a cognizance that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought, by means of a cognizance that is accompanied by the effort that is the opposite of the defilements.🔽He is not one who has gone by means of a cognizance that is not accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought, by means of a cognizance that is not accompanied by the effort that is the opposite of the defilements.

original: nasasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato. Tañca samādhiṃ samāpajjanto tato vā vuṭṭhahanto sativepullapattattā.
analyzed: tat ca samādhim samāpajjantaḥ tatas vā vuṭṭhahantaḥ sati vepulla patta ttā
translated: And when he enters upon and emerges from that concentration, he does so with mindfulness and full awareness.🔽He enters upon and emerges with mindfulness and full awareness.

original: Satova samāpajjati sato vuṭṭhahati. Yathāparicchinnakālavasena vā sato samāpajjati
analyzed: sataḥ iva samāpajjati sataḥ vuṭṭhahati yathā paricchinna kāla vasena vā sataḥ samāpajjati
translated: Or he enters upon and emerges with mindfulness and full awareness in accordance with the time determined upon.

original: sato vuṭṭhahati. Tasmā yadettha “ayaṃ samādhi paccuppannasukho ceva āyatiñca sukhavipāko”ti
analyzed: sataḥ vuṭṭhahati tasmai yat ettha ayam samādhi paccuppanna sukho ca iva āyatim ca sukha vipāko ti
translated: So when he reviews thus ‘This concentration is pleasant here and now and it will ripen in the future in the happiness of heaven’,

original: evaṃ paccavekkhamānassa paccattaṃyeva aparappaccayaṃ ñāṇaṃ uppajjati, taṃ ekamaṅgaṃ.
analyzed: evam paccavekkhamānassa paccattam yeva apara ppaccayam ñāṇam uppajjati tam ekam aṅgam
translated: then knowledge arises in him that is due to his own abandoning of the hindrances, which is independent of others and due to his own realization of the jhana.🔽The same method of explanation applies in the case of the other four kinds of reviewing.

original: Esa nayo sesesupi. Evamimehi pañcahi paccavekkhaṇañāṇehi ayaṃ samādhi “pañcañāṇiko
analyzed: esa nayo sesesu pi evam imehi pañcahi paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇehi ayam samādhi pañcañāṇikaḥ
translated: So this concentration is called “accompanied by five kinds of knowledge”

original: sammāsamādhī”ti vutto.
analyzed: sammāsamādhi iti vuttaḥ
translated: and “right concentration” .

original: Imasmiṃ vāre visesabhāgiyapade maggo kathito. Sacchikātabbapade phalaṃ. Sesaṃ purimasadisameva.
analyzed: imasmim vāre visesa bhāgiya pade maggo kathito sacchikātabba pade phalam sesam purima sadisam eva
translated: Or alternatively, in this section the path is stated in the phrase “accompanied by five kinds of knowledge,” the fruition in the phrase “to be realized here and now,” and the rest as before.

original: Chadhammavaṇṇanā
analyzed: cha dhamma vaṇṇanā
translated: Description of the six ideas

original: 356. Chakkesu sabbaṃ uttānatthameva. Duppaṭivijjhapade panettha maggo kathito. Sesaṃ purimasadisaṃ.
analyzed: chakkesu sabbam uttāna attham eva duppaṭivijjha pade pana ittha maggo kathito sesam purima sadisam
translated: In the case of the wheels, all is straightforward in meaning. But the path is taught in the clause “hard to penetrate.” The rest is as before.

original: Sattadhammavaṇṇanā
analyzed: satta dhamma vaṇṇanā
translated: Seven ideas

original: 357. (Ña) sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhā hontīti hetunā nayena vipassanāñāṇena sudiṭṭhā honti.🔽Kāmāti vatthukāmā ca kilesakāmā ca, dvepi sapariḷāhaṭṭhena aṅgārakāsu viya sudiṭṭhā
analyzed: sammappaññāya su diṭṭhāḥ honti iti hetunā nayena vipassanā ñāṇena su diṭṭhāḥ honti  kāmā ati vatthu kāmā ca kilesa kāmā ca dve api sa pariḷāha aṭṭhena aṅgārakāsu viya su diṭṭhā
translated: “Well seen with right understanding”: well seen by means of the understanding consisting in insight, which is the cause, the method.🔽“Sense desires”: both kinds of sense desires, namely, as objects of sense desire and as defilements of sense desire, are well seen as a charcoal pit in the sense of being associated with fever.

original: honti. Vivekaninnanti nibbānaninnaṃ. Poṇaṃ pabbhāranti ninnassetaṃ vevacanaṃ. Byantībhūtanti
analyzed: honti viveka ninnanti nibbāna ninnam poṇam pabbhāranti ninnassa etam vevacanam byantībhūtanti
translated: “Bent on seclusion”: bent on extinction. “Pointing to the open air”: this is a synonym for “bent on.” “Come to the conclusion”:

original: niyatibhūtaṃ. Nittaṇhanti attho. Kuto? Sabbaso āsavaṭṭhānīyehi dhammehi tebhūmakadhammehīti
analyzed: niyati bhūtam nittaṇhanti attho kutas sabbaso āsava ṭṭhānīyehi dhammehi tebhūmaka dhammehi iti
translated: “come to the conclusion” is the meaning. “From all”: from all ideas in the three planes of existence that are a footing for cankers.

original: attho. Idha bhāvetabbapade maggo kathito. Sesaṃ purimasadisameva.
analyzed: atthaḥ idha bhāvetabba pade maggo kathitaḥ sesam purima sadisam eva
translated: Herein, the path is taught in the clause “what should be developed.” The rest is as before.

original: Aṭṭhadhammavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aṭṭhadhamma vaṇṇanā
translated: Eight ideas

original: 358. (Ka) ādibrahmacariyikāya paññāyāti sikkhattayasaṅgahassa maggabrahmacariyassa
analyzed: kaḥ ādibrahmacariyikāya paññāyāti sikkhattaya saṅgahassa magga brahmacariyassa
translated: “For the first kind of living in the life of purity”: for the path-life of purity comprised by the three trainings.

original: ādibhūtāya pubbabhāge taruṇasamathavipassanāpaññāya. Aṭṭhaṅgikassa vā maggassa ādibhūtāya
analyzed: ādi bhūtāya pubbabhāge taruṇa samatha vipassanā paññāya aṭṭhaṅgikassa vā maggassa ādi bhūtāya
translated: Or it is the beginning of the eight-factored path,

original: sammādiṭṭhipaññāya. Tibbanti balavaṃ. Hirottappanti hirī ca ottappañca. Pemanti gehassitapemaṃ.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi paññāya tibbanti balavam hirā uttappanti hirī ca ottappañca pemanti gehassita pemam
translated: and it is the understanding of right view. “Firm” means strong. “Shame and moral dread” means shame and moral dread. “Love” means affection.

original: Gāravoti garucittabhāvo. Garubhāvanīyañhi upanissāya viharato kilesā nuppajjanti
analyzed: gāravaḥ ti garu citta bhāvaḥ garu bhāvanīyam hi upanissāya viharataḥ kilesāḥ nuppajjanti
translated: “Respect” means the state of mind that respects. For when one lives depending on one who is worthy of respect, defilements do not arise.

original: ovādānusāsaniṃ labhati. Tasmā taṃ nissāya vihāro paññāpaṭilābhassa paccayo hoti.
analyzed: ovāda anusāsanim labhati tasmā tam nissāya vihāraḥ paññā paṭilābhassa paccayaḥ hoti
translated: one receives advice and instruction. Therefore living in dependence is a condition for the acquisition of understanding.🔽(6) Because the ghosts go to the invitation of the asuras and to the wedding of the asuras,

original: (Cha) akkhaṇesu yasmā petā asurānaṃ āvāhanaṃ gacchanti, vivāhanaṃ gacchanti, tasmā pettivisayeneva asurakāyo gahitoti veditabbo.
analyzed: cha akkhaṇesu yasmā petāḥ asurānam āvāhanam gacchanti vivāhanam gacchanti tasmā petti visayena iva asura kāyaḥ gahitaḥ iti veditabbo
translated: it should be understood that the asura realm is included in the ghost realm.🔽(7) As to “the contented one”: there are four kinds of contentment,

original: (Ja) appicchassāti ettha paccayaappiccho, adhigamaappiccho, pariyattiappiccho, dhutaṅgaappicchoti
analyzed: jaḥ appicchassa ati ettha paccaya appicchaḥ adhigama appicchaḥ pariyatti appicchaḥ dhutaṅga appicchaḥ iti
translated: that is, contentment with requisites, contentment with spiritual achievement, contentment with learning, and contentment with ascetic practices.

original: cattāro appicchā. Tattha paccayaappiccho bahuṃ dente appaṃ gaṇhāti, appaṃ dente appataraṃ
analyzed: cattāro appicchāḥ tattha paccaya appicchaḥ bahum dente appam gaṇhāti appam dente appataram
translated: Herein, one who is content with requisites takes little when much is offered, and when little is offered, he accepts even that.

original: vā gaṇhāti, na vā gaṇhāti, na anavasesagāhī hoti. Adhigamaappiccho majjhantikatthero🔽viya attano adhigamaṃ aññesaṃ jānituṃ na deti. Pariyattiappiccho tepiṭakopi samāno🔽na bahussutabhāvaṃ jānāpetukāmo hoti sāketatissatthero viya. Dhutaṅgaappiccho dhutaṅgapariharaṇabhāvaṃ🔽aññesaṃ jānituṃ na deti dvebhātikattheresu jeṭṭhakatthero viya. Vatthu visuddhimagge
analyzed: vā gaṇhāti na vā gaṇhāti na anavasesa gāhī hoti adhigama appicchaḥ majjhantika thero  viya attanaḥ adhigamam aññesam jānitum na deti pariyatti appicchaḥ tepiṭakaḥ api samāno  na bahu ssuta bhāvam jānā petu kāmaḥ hoti sāketa tissa theraḥ viya dhutaṅga appicchaḥ dhutaṅga pariharaṇa bhāvam  aññesam jānitum na deti dvebhātika theresu jeṭṭhaka theraḥ viya vatthu visuddhi magge
translated: He does not give his own attainments to others to know, like the Elder Majjhantika, who was not greedy for gain. He does not want to make known his great learning, though he may be a master of the three baskets, like the Elder Tissa of Sāketa. He does not give his practice of the ascetic practices to others to know, like the elder of the two brothers. The matter is dealt with in the Visuddhimagga.

original: kathitaṃ. Ayaṃ dhammoti evaṃ santaguṇanigūhanena ca paccayapaṭiggahaṇe mattaññutāya🔽ca appicchassa puggalassa ayaṃ navalokuttaradhammo sampajjati, no mahicchassa. Evaṃ🔽sabbattha yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: kathitam ayam dhammaḥ ti evam santa guṇa nigūhanena ca paccaya paṭiggahaṇe mattaññu tāya  ca appicchassa puggalassa ayam nava lokuttara dhammo sampajjati no mahicchassa evam  sabbattha yojetabbam
translated: He does not take what is not given. He is not a taker of what is not given. He is not one who does not give a portion. He is not one who does not give a portion of his own gains to others, like the Elder Majjhima who was content with his own gains. He is not one who is content with learning. He is not one who is content with learning, though he may be a master of the three Piṭakas, and does not wish to make known his great learning, like the Elder Tissa of Sāketa. He is not one who is content with ascetic practices. He is not one who is content with ascetic practices, and does not give others a chance to know of his practice of the austerities, like the elder of the two brothers. The matter is stated in the Visuddhimagga. “This Dhamma” : this supramundane Dhamma of the nine supramundane states arises in the person who is content and not in the person who is discontented, because of his concealment of his good qualities in this way and because of his moderation in accepting requisites. This should be applied in all cases.

original: Santuṭṭhassāti catūsu paccayesu tīhi santosehi santuṭṭhassa. Pavivittassāti kāyacittaupadhivivekehi
analyzed: santuṭṭhassa ati catūsu paccayesu tīhi santosehi santuṭṭhassa pavivittassa ati kāya citta upadhi vivekehi
translated: “Content”: content with the four requisites through the three kinds of contentment. “Secluded”: secluded in body and in mind, and secluded from acquisitions.

original: vivittassa. Tattha kāyaviveko nāma gaṇasaṅgaṇikaṃ vinodetvā aṭṭhaārambhavatthuvasena🔽ekībhāvo. Ekībhāvamattena pana kammaṃ na nipphajjatīti kasiṇaparikammaṃ katvā aṭṭha
analyzed: vivittassa tattha kāya vivekaḥ nāma gaṇa saṅgaṇikam vinodetvā aṭṭha ārambha vatthu vasena  ekībhāvaḥ ekībhāva mattena pana kammam na nipphajjati iti kasiṇa parikammam katvā aṭṭha
translated: of seclusion. Herein, bodily seclusion is the state of being alone after sending away a companion, by way of the eight grounds for making an effort .🔽But an action does not originate merely by being alone. So after doing the preliminary work on a kasiṇa,🔽🔽

original: samāpattiyo nibbatteti, ayaṃ cittaviveko nāma. Samāpattimatteneva kammaṃ na nipphajjatīti🔽jhānaṃ pādakaṃ katvā saṅkhāre sammasitvā saha paṭisambhidāhi arahattaṃ pāpuṇāti,
analyzed: samāpattiyaḥ nibbattā iti ayam citta vivekaḥ nāma samāpattimattena iva kammam na nipphajjati iti  jhānam pādakam katvā saṅkhāre sammasitvā saha paṭisambhidāhi arahattam pāpuṇāti
translated: to seclusion. Herein, bodily seclusion is the state of being alone after dismissing society. But action does not originate merely with that, so he produces the eight attainments after doing the preliminary work on the kasiṇas. This is mental seclusion. But action does not originate merely with that, so he reaches Arahantship together with the discriminations after surmounting the jhānas with formations as object.

original: ayaṃ upadhiviveko nāma. Tenāha bhagavā – “kāyaviveko ca vivekaṭṭhakāyānaṃ nekkhammābhiratānaṃ.🔽Cittaviveko ca parisuddhacittānaṃ paramavodānappattānaṃ. Upadhiviveko ca nirupadhīnaṃ
analyzed: ayam upadhi vivekaḥ nāma tena āha bhagavā ca viveka ṭṭha kāyānam nekkhamma abhiratānam  citta viveko ca parisuddha cittānam parama vodāna pattānam upadhi viveko ca nirupadhīnam
translated: This is seclusion from acquisitions. Hence the Blessed One said: “Bodily seclusion is for those whose bodies are secluded from society and who delight in renunciation.

original: puggalānaṃ visaṅkhāragatāna”nti.
analyzed: puggalānam visaṅkhāra gatānam ti
translated: Mental seclusion is for those whose minds are purified and who have attained to the supreme in the world. Seclusion from acquisitions is for those who are without acquisitions and have reached the unformed state” .

original: Saṅgaṇikārāmassāti gaṇasaṅgaṇikāya ceva kilesasaṅgaṇikāya ca ratassa. Āraddhavīriyassāti
analyzed: saṅgaṇika ārāmassa ati gaṇa saṅgaṇikāya ca iva kilesa saṅgaṇikāya ca ratassa āraddha vīriyassa ati
translated: Who delight in society: who delight in society as society and in defilement as society. Who have begun the effort: who have begun the effort to abandon defilements.

original: kāyikacetasikavīriyavasena āraddhavīriyassa. Upaṭṭhitasatissāti catusatipaṭṭhānavasena
analyzed: kāyika cetasika vīriya vasena āraddha vīriyassa upaṭṭhita satissa ati catu sati paṭṭhāna vasena
translated: He is mindful: he has established mindfulness by means of the four foundations of mindfulness.🔽He is concentrated: his mind is unified.

original: upaṭṭhitasatissa. Samāhitassāti ekaggacittassa. Paññavatoti kammassakatapaññāya paññavato.
analyzed: upaṭṭhita satissa samāhitassa ati ekagga cittassa paññavataḥ nti kammassakata paññāya paññavataḥ
translated: He is wise: he is wise by means of the wisdom that is the outcome of knowledge of the way to an end.

original: Nippapañcassāti vigatamānataṇhādiṭṭhipapañcassa.
analyzed: nippapañcassa ti vigata māna taṇhā diṭṭhi papañcassa
translated: He is not puffed up: he is free from the conceit, craving and views of self-effacement.

original: Idha bhāvetabbapade maggo kathito. Sesaṃ purimasadisameva.
analyzed: idha bhāvetabba pade maggo kathitaḥ sesam purima sadisam eva
translated: Herein, the path is stated under the heading of “what should be developed.” The rest is as already stated.

original: Navadhammavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the nine dhammas is ended.

original: 359. (Kha) sīlavisuddhīti visuddhiṃ pāpetuṃ samatthaṃ catupārisuddhisīlaṃ. Pārisuddhipadhāniyaṅganti🔽parisuddhabhāvassa padhānaṅgaṃ. Cittavisuddhīti vipassanāya padaṭṭhānabhūtā aṭṭha
analyzed: sīla visuddhi iti visuddhim pāpetum samattham catu pārisuddhi sīlam  parisuddha bhāvassa padhāna aṅgam citta visuddhi iti vipassanāya padaṭṭhāna bhūtāḥ aṭṭha
translated: (Kha) Purification of virtue: virtue that is capable of being a basis for purification, that is, the virtue of the fourfold purity.🔽The condition for purification: the condition for the state of purification.🔽Purification of consciousness: the eight attainments that are the basis for insight.

original: paguṇasamāpattiyo. Diṭṭhivisuddhīti sapaccayanāmarūpadassanaṃ. Kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhīti
analyzed: paguṇa samāpattiyaḥ diṭṭhi visuddhi iti sa paccaya nāma rūpa dassanam kaṅkhā vitaraṇa visuddhi iti
translated: Purification by overcoming doubt: knowledge of the principles of conditionality.

original: paccayākārañāṇaṃ. Addhattayepi hi paccayavaseneva dhammā pavattantīti passato kaṅkhaṃ
analyzed: paccaya ākāra ñāṇam addha ttaye pi hi paccaya vasena iva dhammā pavattanti iti passataḥ kaṅkham
translated: For one who sees how things occur by way of conditions, doubt

original: vitarati. Maggāmaggañāṇadassanavisuddhīti obhāsādayo na maggo, vīthippaṭipannaṃ udayabbayañāṇaṃ🔽maggoti evaṃ maggāmagge ñāṇaṃ. Paṭipadāñāṇadassanavisuddhīti rathavinīte vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanā
analyzed: vitarati magga amagga ñāṇa dassana visuddhi iti obhāsa ādayaḥ na maggaḥ vīthi paṭipannam udaya bbaya ñāṇam  maggo ti evam magga amagge ñāṇam paṭipadā ñāṇa dassana visuddhi iti ratha vinīte vuṭṭhāna gāmini vipassanā
translated: He gives. Purification by knowledge and vision of what is the path and what is not the path: the illumination, etc., are not the path. Knowledge of rise and fall in the course of the round is the path.🔽So this is knowledge of the path and not-path. Purification by knowledge and vision of the way: the direct-knowledge path in the chariot- simile is called the way here, and the insight leading to emergence is called the way here.

original: kathitā, idha taruṇavipassanā. Ñāṇadassanavisuddhīti rathavinīte maggo kathito, idha
analyzed: kathitā idha taruṇa vipassanā ñāṇa dassana visuddhī iti ratha vinīte maggo kathito idha
translated: Knowledge and vision: the path in the chariot-simile is called knowledge and vision here, and the insight leading to emergence is called vision.

original: vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanā. Etā pana sattapi visuddhiyo vitthārena visuddhimagge kathitā.
analyzed: vuṭṭhāna gāmini vipassanā etāḥ pana visuddhiyaḥ vitthārena visuddhi magge kathitā
translated: But these seven kinds of purification are given in detail in the Path of Purification.

original: Paññāti arahattaphalapaññā. Vimuttipi arahattaphalavimuttiyeva.🔽(Cha) dhātunānattaṃ paṭicca uppajjati phassanānattanti cakkhādidhātunānattaṃ paṭicca🔽cakkhusamphassādinānattaṃ uppajjatīti attho. Phassanānattaṃ paṭiccāti cakkhusamphassādinānattaṃ
analyzed: paññā ati arahatta phala paññā arahatta phala vimuttiyā iva  dhātu nānattam paṭicca uppajjati phassa nānattam ti cakkha ādi dhātu nānattam paṭicca  cakkhu samphassa ādi nānattam uppajjati iti attho phassa nānattam paṭicca ati cakkhu samphassa ādi nānattam
translated: Understanding is the understanding of the fruit of arahantship. And the deliverance is the deliverance of the fruit of arahantship too.

original: paṭicca. Vedanānānattanti cakkhusamphassajādivedanānānattaṃ. Saññānānattaṃ paṭiccāti
analyzed: paṭicca vedanā nānattanti cakkhu samphassa ja ādi vedanā nānattam saññā nānattam paṭicca ati
translated: With the diversity of the six bases as condition, the diversity of contact comes to be: with the diversity of the eye base, etc., as condition, the diversity of eye-contact, etc., comes to be—this is the meaning. With the diversity of contact as condition: with the diversity of eye-contact, etc., as condition. The diversity of feeling: the diversity of eye-contact-born feeling, etc. With the diversity of feeling as condition: with the diversity of eye-contact-born feeling, etc., as condition.

original: kāmasaññādinānattaṃ paṭicca. Saṅkappanānattanti kāmasaṅkappādinānattaṃ. Saṅkappanānattaṃ🔽paṭicca uppajjati chandanānattanti saṅkappanānattatāya rūpe chando sadde chandoti
analyzed: kāma saññā ādi nānattam paṭicca saṅkappa nānattam ti kāma saṅkappa ādi nānattam saṅkappa nānattam  paṭicca uppajjati chanda nānattanti saṅkappa nānatta tāya rūpe chando sadde chandoti
translated: The diversity of intentions is a condition for the diversity of desires.🔽Because of the diversity of intentions, desire for visible forms arises, desire for sounds, etc.🔽Thus the diversity of desires arises. The diversity of passions is due to the diversity of desires.

original: evaṃ chandanānattaṃ uppajjati. Pariḷāhanānattanti chandanānattatāya rūpapariḷāho
analyzed: evam chanda nānattam uppajjati pariḷāha nānattam ti chanda nānatta tāya rūpa pariḷāhaḥ
translated: Because of the diversity of desires, passion for visible forms arises, passion for sounds, etc.

original: saddapariḷāhoti evaṃ pariḷāhanānattaṃ uppajjati. Pariyesanānānattanti pariḷāhanānattatāya
analyzed: sadda pariḷāhaḥ ti evam pariḷāha nānattam uppajjati pariyesanā nānattam ti pariḷāha nānatta tāya
translated: Thus the diversity of passions arises. The diversity of searches is due to the diversity of passions.🔽Because of the diversity of passions, the diversity of searches for visible forms, etc., arises. The diversity of gains is due to the diversity of searches.

original: rūpapariyesanādinānattaṃ uppajjati. Lābhanānattanti pariyesanānānattatāya rūpapaṭilābhādinānattaṃ uppajjati.
analyzed: rūpa pariyesanā ādi nānattam uppajjati lābha nānattam ti pariyesanā nānatta tāya rūpa paṭilābha ādi nānattam uppajjati
translated: Because of the diversity of searches, the diversity of gains of visible forms, etc., arises.

original: (Ja) saññāsu maraṇasaññāti maraṇānupassanāñāṇe saññā. Āhārepaṭikūlasaññāti āhāraṃ
analyzed: saññāsu maraṇa saññā ati maraṇa anupassanā ñāṇe saññā āhāre paṭikūla saññā ati āhāram
translated: The perception of death is a perception in the knowledge of contemplation of death. The perception of the repulsiveness of food is a perception that arises in one who discerns food.

original: pariggaṇhantassa uppannasaññā. Sabbalokeanabhiratisaññāti sabbasmiṃ vaṭṭe ukkaṇṭhantassa
analyzed: pariggaṇhantassa uppanna saññā sabba loke anabhirati saññā ati sabbasmim vaṭṭe ukkaṇṭhantassa
translated: The perception of non-delight in the entire world is a perception that arises in one who is disgusted with the entire round of existence.

original: uppannasaññā. Sesā heṭṭhā kathitā eva. Idha bahukārapade maggo kathito. Sesaṃ purimasadisameva.
analyzed: uppanna saññā sesā heṭṭhā kathitā eva idha bahu kāra pade maggo kathito sesam purima sadisam eva
translated: and perception that has arisen. The rest are as already stated. Herein, the path is stated in terms of the many factors. The rest is similar to the former.

original: Dasadhammavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the ten ideas

original: 360. (Jha) nijjaravatthūnīti nijjarakāraṇāni. Micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā hotīti ayaṃ heṭṭhā🔽vipassanāyapi nijjiṇṇā eva pahīnā. Kasmā puna gahitāti asamucchinnattā. Vipassanāya
analyzed: nijjara vatthūni iti nijjara kāraṇāni micchādiṭṭhi nijjiṇṇā hoti iti ayam heṭṭhā  nijjiṇṇā eva pahīnā kasmā puna gahitā ati asamucchinna ttā vipassanāya
translated: The grounds for wearing away: the reasons for wearing away. Wrong view is worn away. This is already worn away and abandoned by insight.

original: hi kiñcāpi jiṇṇā, na pana samucchinnā, maggo pana uppajjitvā taṃ samucchindati, na
analyzed: hi kiñcā api jiṇṇā na pana samucchinnā maggaḥ pana uppajjitvā tam samucchindati na
translated: Why is it mentioned again? Because it is not cut off. For although it is worn away by insight, it is not cut off. But the path arises and cuts it off,

original: puna vuṭṭhātuṃ deti. Tasmā puna gahitā. Evaṃ sabbapadesu nayo netabbo.🔽Ettha ca sammādiṭṭhipaccayā catusaṭṭhi dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti. Katame
analyzed: puna vuṭṭhātum deti tasmā puna gahitā evam sabba padesu nayaḥ netabbo  ettha ca sammādiṭṭhi paccayā catusaṭṭhi dhammā bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti katame
translated: and does not allow it to arise again. That is why it is mentioned again. The method should be understood in all the passages in this way.🔽And here, with right view as condition, sixty-four ideas reach fulfilment by development. What sixty-four?

original: catusaṭṭhi? Sotāpattimaggakkhaṇe adhimokkhaṭṭhena saddhindriyaṃ paripūreti, paggahaṭṭhena
analyzed: sotāpatti magga kkhaṇe adhimokkha ṭṭhena saddhi indriyam paripūreti paggaha ṭṭhena
translated: At the moment of the stream-entry path the faith faculty reaches fulfilment by development in the sense of resolution;🔽the energy faculty reaches fulfilment by development in the sense of exertion;🔽the mindfulness faculty reaches fulfilment by development in the sense of recollection;

original: vīriyindriyaṃ paripūreti, anussaraṇaṭṭhena satindriyaṃ paripūreti, avikkhepaṭṭhena
analyzed: vīriya indriyam paripūreti anussaraṇa ṭhena sati indriyam paripūreti avikkhepa ṭṭhena
translated: the concentration faculty reaches fulfilment by development in the sense of non-distraction;

original: samādhindriyaṃ paripūreti, dassanaṭṭhena paññindriyaṃ paripūreti, vijānanaṭṭhena🔽manindriyaṃ, abhinandanaṭṭhena somanassindriyaṃ, pavattasantatiadhipateyyaṭṭhena🔽jīvitindriyaṃ paripūreti…pe… arahattaphalakkhaṇe adhimokkhaṭṭhena saddhindriyaṃ,🔽pavattasantatiadhipateyyaṭṭhena jīvitindriyaṃ paripūretīti evaṃ catūsu maggesu catūsu
analyzed: samādhi indriyam paripūreti dassana ṭṭhena paññindriyam paripūreti vijānana ṭṭhena  man indriyam abhinandana ṭhena somanassindriyam pavatta santati adhipateyya ṭṭhena  jīvita indriyam arahatta phala kkhaṇe adhimokkha ṭṭhena saddhi indriyam  pavatta santati adhipateyya ṭṭhena jīvitindriyam paripūreti iti evam catūsu maggesu catūsu
translated: He fulfills the concentration faculty by the meaning of determining, the understanding faculty by the meaning of seeing, the mind faculty by the meaning of discerning,🔽the joy faculty by the meaning of relishing, the life faculty by the meaning of sovereignty over the continuity of the process.🔽… At the moment of fruition of Arahantship he fulfills the faith faculty by the meaning of resolution,

original: phalesu aṭṭha aṭṭha hutvā catusaṭṭhi dhammā pāripūriṃ gacchanti. Idha abhiññeyyapade
analyzed: phalesu aṭṭha aṭṭha hutvā catusaṭṭhi dhammā pāripūrim gacchanti idha abhiññeyya pade
translated: the life faculty by the meaning of sovereignty over the continuity of the process. So in the four paths and four fruitions there are eight sets of six, making forty-eight ideas that reach fulfillment. Herein,

original: maggo kathito. Sesaṃ purimasadisameva.
analyzed: maggo kathitaḥ sesam purima sadisam eva
translated: the path is stated in the section on what is to be directly known. The rest is as already stated.🔽Herein, questions may be raised as follows:

original: Idha ṭhatvā pañhā samodhānetabbā. Dasake sataṃ pañhā kathitā. Ekake ca navake ca
analyzed: idha ṭhatvā pañhā samodhānetabbā dasake satam pañhā kathitāḥ ekake ca navake ca
translated: The hundred questions on the tenfold are stated. And the hundred on the single and the hundred on the ninefold,

original: sataṃ, duke ca aṭṭhake ca sataṃ, tike ca sattake ca sataṃ, catukke ca chakke ca sataṃ,
analyzed: satam duke ca aṭṭhake ca satam tike ca sattake ca satam catukke ca chakke ca satam
translated: and the hundred on the twofold and the hundred on the eightfold, and the hundred on the threefold and the hundred on the sevenfold, and the hundred on the fourfold and the hundred on the sixfold,

original: pañcake paññāsāti aḍḍhachaṭṭhāni pañhasatāni kathitāni honti.
analyzed: pañcake paññāsāti aḍḍha chaṭṭhāni pañha satāni kathitāni honti
translated: and the hundred on the fivefold and the fifty on the fivefold—thus six and a half hundred questions are stated.

original: “Idamavoca āyasmā sāriputto, attamanā te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṃ abhinandu”nti
analyzed: idam avoca āyasmā sāriputtaḥ attamanāḥ te bhikkhū āyasmataḥ sāriputtassa bhāsitam abhinandunti
translated: “This is what the venerable Sariputta said. Elated, those bhikkhus delighted in the venerable Sariputta’s statement.”

original: sādhu, sādhūti abhinandantā sirasā sampaṭicchiṃsu. Tāya ca pana attamanatāya imameva
analyzed: sādhu sādhu iti abhinandantā sirasā tāya ca pana atta manatāya imam eva
translated: and they approved of it and agreed with it, and they remembered it. And by reason of that elation,

original: suttaṃ āvajjamānā pañcasatāpi te bhikkhū saha paṭisambhidāhi aggaphale arahatte patiṭṭhahiṃsūti.
analyzed: suttam āvajjamānā pañca satā api te bhikkhū saha paṭisambhidāhi agga phale arahatte patiṭṭhahiṃsu uti
translated: remembering this sutta, the five hundred bhikkhus were established in the supreme goal, in the fruit of arahantship, together with the analytic insights .

original: Sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīghanikāyaṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīgha nikāya ṭṭhakathāya
translated: In the commentary to the Long Division

original: Dasuttarasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Niṭṭhitā ca pāthikavaggassa vaṇṇanāti.
analyzed: dasuttara sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  niṭṭhitā ca pāthika vaggassa vaṇṇanā ti
translated: the commentary on the Dasuttara Sutta is ended.🔽And the commentary on the Patika Vagga is ended.

original: Pāthikavaggaṭṭhakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pāthika vagga ṭṭhakathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Patika Vagga is ended.

original: Nigamanakathā
analyzed: nigamana kathā
translated: The Conclusion

original: Ettāvatā ca –
analyzed: ettāvatā ca
translated: And so far

original: Āyācito sumaṅgala, pariveṇanivāsinā thiraguṇena;
analyzed: āyācitaḥ sumaṅgala pariveṇa nivāsinā thiraguṇena
translated: I have been urged by Sumaṅgala, a resident of the Pariveṇa, who is firm in virtue,

original: Dāṭhānāgasaṅghattherena, theravaṃsanvayena.
analyzed: dāṭhā nāga saṅgha ttherena thera vaṃsa anvayena
translated: by the Elder Dāṭhā Nāgasamāla, who is in the lineage of elders.

original: Dīghāgamavarassa dasabala, guṇagaṇaparidīpanassa aṭṭhakathaṃ;
analyzed: dīgha āgama varassa guṇa gaṇa paridīpanassa aṭṭha kathaṃ
translated: I have begun the commentary on the Dasabala’s Long Division, which is the best,

original: Yaṃ ārabhiṃ sumaṅgala, vilāsiniṃ nāma nāmena.
analyzed: yam ārabhim sumaṅgala vilāsinim nāma nāmena
translated: and which reveals the mass of his special qualities, called Sumaṅgala Vilāsini .🔽For it is drawn from the great commentary,

original: Sā hi mahāṭṭhakathāya, sāramādāya niṭṭhitā;
analyzed: sā hi mahā aṭṭhakathāya sāram ādāya niṭṭhitā
translated: and it is finished.

original: Esā ekāsītipamāṇāya, pāḷiyā bhāṇavārehi.
analyzed: esā ekāsīti pamāṇāya pāḷiyā bhāṇa vārehi
translated: This is the number of sections in the ninety-one thousand lines of text.

original: Ekūnasaṭṭhimatto, visuddhimaggopi bhāṇavārehi;
analyzed: ekūna saṭṭhi mattaḥ visuddhi maggaḥ api bhāṇa vārehi
translated: The Path of Purification, too, is about fifty-nine thousand lines of text.

original: Atthappakāsanatthāya, āgamānaṃ kato yasmā.
analyzed: attha ppakāsana tthāya āgamānam kataḥ yasmai
translated: Since it was made for the purpose of explaining the scriptures,

original: Tasmā tena sahā’yaṃ, aṭṭhakathā bhāṇavāragaṇanāya;
analyzed: tasmai tena sahāyam aṭṭhakathā bhāṇa vāra gaṇanāya
translated: therefore, together with it, this commentary, by the number of sections,

original: Suparimitaparicchinnaṃ, cattālīsasataṃ hoti.
analyzed: su parimita paricchinnam cattālīsa satam hoti
translated: is limited to exactly four hundred and forty.

original: Sabbaṃ cattālīsādhikasata, parimāṇaṃ bhāṇavārato evaṃ;
analyzed: sabbam parimāṇam bhāṇa vārataḥ evam
translated: The total extent of all the sections is thus four hundred and forty thousand lines of text.

original: Samayaṃ pakāsayantiṃ, mahāvihāre nivāsinaṃ.
analyzed: samayam pakāsayantim mahā vihāre nivāsinam
translated: This is the extent stated by those who lived in the Great Monastery.

original: Mūlakaṭṭhakathāsāra, mādāya mayā imaṃ karontena;
analyzed: mūla kaṭṭha kathā sāra mā ādāya mayā imam karontena
translated: When I made this work, taking the essence from the root commentary,

original: Yaṃ puññamupacitaṃ tena, hotu sabbo sukhī lokoti.🔽Paramavisuddhasaddhābuddhivīriyapaṭimaṇḍitena sīlācārajjavamaddavādiguṇasamudayasamuditena
analyzed: yam puññam upacitam tena hotu sabbaḥ sukhī loko ti  parama visuddha saddhā buddhi vīriya paṭimaṇḍitena sīla ācāra java maddava ādi guṇa samudaya samuditena
translated: may all the world be happy through whatever merit has been accumulated thereby.🔽He who was adorned with the most pure faith, understanding, and energy, who was endowed with the aggregate of such special qualities as virtue, conduct, dignity, and gentleness,

original: sakasamayasamayantaragahanajjhogāhaṇasamatthena paññāveyyattiyasamannāgatena tipiṭakapariyattippabhede
analyzed: saka samaya samaya antara gahana ajjhogāhaṇa samatthena paññā veyyattiya samannāgatena ti piṭaka pariyat tippa bhede
translated: who was capable of penetrating the deep and recondite doctrines of his own and others’ schools, who was endowed with the highest wisdom, who was learned in the ninefold scriptures of the Buddha, which are classified according to the three Pitakas,

original: sāṭṭhakathe satthusāsane appaṭihatañāṇappabhāvena mahāveyyākaraṇena karaṇasampattijanitasukhaviniggatamadhurodāravacanalāvaṇṇayuttena
analyzed: sa aṭṭhakathe satthu sāsane appaṭihata ñāṇa ppabhāvena mahā veyyākaraṇena karaṇa sampatti janita sukha viniggata madhura udāra vacana lāvaṇṇa yuttena
translated: with the sweet and noble speech, which is endowed with the charm of the happiness produced by the perfection of his work,🔽with the great poet, the best of speakers, who speaks in a manner that is appropriate,

original: yuttamuttavādinā vādīvarena mahākavinā pabhinnapaṭisambhidāparivāre chaḷabhiññādippabhedaguṇapaṭimaṇḍite
analyzed: yutta mutta vādinā vādīvarena mahā kavinā pabhinna paṭisambhidā parivāre chaṣ abhiññā ādi pabheda guṇa paṭimaṇḍite
translated: with the Elders, who are the lamps of the lineage of Elders, who are endowed with the qualities of the six kinds of supernormal knowledge, etc., which are included in the analytical knowledges,

original: uttarimanussadhamme suppatiṭṭhitabuddhīnaṃ theravaṃsappadīpānaṃ therānaṃ mahāvihāravāsīnaṃ
analyzed: uttari manussa dhamme su patiṭṭhita buddhīnam thera vaṃsa ppadīpānam therānam mahāvihāra vāsīnam
translated: who are well established in the higher-than-human state, who are the residents of the Mahavihara,

original: vaṃsālaṅkārabhūtena vipulavisuddhabuddhinā buddhaghosoti garūhi gahitanāmadheyyena
analyzed: vaṃsa alaṅkāra bhūtena vipula visuddha buddhinā buddha ghosaḥ iti garūhi gahita nāmadheyyena
translated: who are the ornament of the lineage, who have a vast and pure intellect, who are called by the name Buddhaghosa,

original: therena katā ayaṃ sumaṅgalavilāsinī nāma dīghanikāyaṭṭhakathā –
analyzed: therena katā ayam sumaṅgalavilāsinī nāma dīgha nikāya ṭṭhakathā
translated: by the Elder Buddhaghosa was composed this commentary called the Sumangalavilasinī on the Digha Nikaya.

original: Tāva tiṭṭhatu lokasmiṃ, lokanittharaṇesinaṃ;
analyzed: tāva tiṭṭhatu lokasmim loka nittharaṇa īsinam
translated: Let it remain in the world as long as the name of the Buddha,

original: Dassentī kulaputtānaṃ, nayaṃ diṭṭhivisuddhiyā.🔽Yāva buddhoti nāmampi, suddhacittassa tādino;
analyzed: dassentī kula puttānam nayam diṭṭhi visuddhiyā  yāva buddhaḥ ti nāmam pi suddhacittassa tādinaḥ
translated: Which shows the way to the purification of views for the sons of noble families,🔽As long as the name of the Buddha, the great sage, the eldest of the world,

original: Lokamhi lokajeṭṭhassa, pavattati mahesinoti.
analyzed: lokamhi loka jeṭṭhassa pavattati mahesino ti
translated: The pure-minded one, the great being, remains in the world.

original: Sumaṅgalavilāsinī nāma
analyzed: sumaṅgalavilāsinī nāma
translated: The Sumangalavilasinī

original: Dīghanikāyaṭṭhakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dīgha nikāya ṭṭhakathā niṭṭhitā
translated: Commentary on the Long Division completed.
